address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: M M.
review text:
"That dinner was malicious" - a member of my party.

Overall Rating: 1.5/5

As far as Korean BBQ goes, this may be the worst experience I've had. All you can eat KBBQ doesn't warrant high quality meat, but some meats I couldn't be paid to bite through. Don't order the steak. This is the least full I have ever been after AYCE.

My party ordered:
-"Gen Premium" Steak - 0/5
- Beef bulgogi - 3/5
- Spicy Pork bulgogi - 3/5
- Brisket - 2/5

- Popcorn Chicken - 1/5
- Calamari - 1/5
- Yangyum Galbi - N/A
- Nook Gan Sal - 2/5

Let me start by saying this place is objectively not clean. I felt my shoes slipping on oil or grease. Please clean your floors. I wonder if that's why the lights are so dim in here. We get to the table and there are no tongs?

The side dishes were okay--definitely nothing to write home about. They gave us free rice at the start, which would've been nice had we not finished our rice, then requested more. This request was met with a 15-20 minute wait. This is somewhat unacceptable for a bowl of rice at this establishment, I would like to think. It appeared that there aren't that many dishes made by chefs, so one would think that having some rice going is pretty easy, but maybe the kitchen is understaffed or something. We also didn't get any sauce dishes. I feel these are pretty standard at kbbq. Pretty sure U-Grill down the street has sauce dishes or at least salt to dilute the blandness of some meats.

The meat that came was ok at best. Definitely lower end of meat quality. The best item out of those that we ordered was the spicy pork bulgogi, followed by the beef bulgogi. The marinades carry their flavor. All non-marinated items were pretty bland and chewy. The galbi never even came to our table.

Finally, the calamari was suspect at best and the popcorn chicken was oily and gross. Presentation was as shown in the pictures, which is to say, terrible.

Service - 1/5
Nathan must've been new, because better service should be expected of tenured waiters. On numerous occasions, we would order and then he would disappear without returning for over half an hour (just too long to be ok). I'm not sure how their service system works, but we received the wrong food on numerous occasions (3 i think). We never got the galbi despite waiting for ~40 total minutes for our second round. The calamari and popcorn chicken came at the very end of our meal after we had all but paid. A member of our party had to go to the bar to get a beer because they never brought it.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jeffrey C.
review text:
Sit outside waiting for 90 minutes.  Finally receive text message our seat is ready.  As we check in, the supposed manager, tells us, they are out of all salads and nearly all meats are out.

When ask why they didn't tell us earlier, her response she didn't have time to notify customers waiting.  

Very poor operation, piss poor planning and another person made manager without any skills.

I will never return to this location.  Very poor management or very a very unqualified person made manager (or assistant manager).  When asked she advised GM wasn't on premises.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Rose T.
review text:
Gen in Rancho Cucamonga has been one of my favorites to come to eat. I have tried different locations but I would always come to this one. I have recommended to several people too.
However with Friday experience I will not coming back! First host had said it was 30min wait but when she added to the waitlist it was 1.5 hours wait. When we got seated it was not welcoming at all they had dirty dishes with the sides they were going to served you in one table and dirty cups on top of the edges. When waiter finally saw us brought the sides without saying a word I honestly thought it was someone that cleans up. She did not introduce herself just asked if we wanted to order the drinks and meats! What happen back in the days when they would introduce themselves and asked if you ever been there before ect? Well we never got our drinks when we were in the middle and flagged her down to ask her she brought us water instead. I asked a different waiter because she would not come to the table for our drinks. Through our dinner she never took out our dirty plates but she did take other peoples plates. We had asked for extra pickles and she came with those when we had finished eating. I also had asked for rice sticks and they never came. When she finally came I did let her know of the stuff that was missing and that I would like check. I did speak to a manager and let them know because they had put a hot grill on top and that could be dangerous it it falls. I remember when it was so organized, clean with great customer service it must be managed by someone else now that does not care. I hope I can speak to district manager or he just does a pop in to that location without notice.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd

review text: Worst service ever, me and my wife decided to give Gen a try, didn't get waited on didn't get any service from our waiter, they kept forgetting our rice and meats, by the time we received our meat we had to wait another half hour for our rice, don't waste your time on this place they don't care about customer service, just go down to U grill by the 15 way faster service.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A

author: David C.
review text: Long wait, decent food, great servers. The servers kind of saved the whole meal and night. Things were pretty messy, as in tables that needed to be cleaned up and they were out of a lot of beers on tap. One pitcher of beer we did try was flat. After 4-5 tries of the waitress checking with the bar and coming back to tell us they were out, we finally ended with with Michelob Ultra. Not my favorite, but the table didn't care at that point. Maybe short staffed? Definitely a place you would come back in a pinch, especially for the price but an hour wait for a table on a Monday night was a bit much. Once we were finally seated the food came and came and came, so all good there. For under $30 a person, it's definitely worth a try.  They also have take out options!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dan L.
review text:
This eatery is currently offering indoor on-site AYCE dining. We were given an estimate of a 45 wait time upon arrival for lunch on a Saturday, but I think they got us a table in closer to 20-30 minutes.

Other than the restaurant being a bit understaffed (a circumstance I am all too sympathetic with, as it unfortunately happens all the time in my own organization), I experienced no issues during my visit.

The meats were fine, but the banchan set was a bit on the underwhelming side (no fish cake, etc.). That said, the staff was very good about repeatedly getting us more!

All in all, the service was unusually attentive and outstanding for a KBBQ restaurant - enough so that I feel they probably earned that 5th star (I'm used to typically far worse attitudes at the other KBBQ joints I've been to before).

I would be happy to dine here again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jorry K.
review text:
The food is over all pretty good and the male servers are awesome. However the hostess and all the girls that work here do absolutely nothing. I've tried giving this place multiple chances, but when your visit starts with waiting for 15 minutes at the desk to check-in, all while a group of waitresses and the host huddle around the bar talking and purposefully avoiding looking at you it's hard to convince yourself to give it another try.

My last visit I waited with my party at the front desk and after 15 minutes a waitress walked up to the front, didn't say anything, avoided eye contact, and pretended not to hear me when I said 'excuse me' until I had to shout because she literally tried to run away from the front desk. Even a simple "the hostess will be with you shortly" would have been fine.

I'd recommend U-Grill instead. Their staff is friendly and doesn't avoid or literally run away from you.

Also I received vegetables with a bug on them.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Joshua T.
review text:
After reading the negative comments about service and 1 star ratings I decided to give gen a go because it was always a decent kbbq for the price and location. Today was a very special experience, guessing the useless Manager mentioned in the previous ratings was the one that did it today.

Long story short we came in just party of two and the front desk just said "give us under 10 minutes to clean and get your table ready." Cool no problems there. After 5 minutes of waiting a couple came in and another group of two came in but as these parties came in they were told about a 10 minute wait but since there were multiple parties coming in their name and numbers were taken down. Enter the woman who thought she owned the whole chain of gen, asked for my name and number so I gave it to her, then she called the couple who came after us to go get seated. I asked her why they got seated first and said they were here first and listed their names. By this point the front desk person before her was telling her that we were here first but kept ignoring him.

Like I understand the labor shortage sucks and no one wants to do work for a shit wage but please hire or promote better. The management of this place the past few months has been garbage and it shows, are you not paying your managers enough? Are you trying to focus on your take out? Like be reasonable, if it's been a few months and complaints has been made constantly, why not attempt to fix the problem?

But maybe it's a good thing I didn't end up eating here, this location clearly shows on their health code violations that they don't even clean or sanitize properly. Thanks for saving me from food poisoning useless manager lady (:

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nae G.
review text:
Went here tonight with a few friends- they told us they wait time was an hour and a half but we only ended up waiting about 30 minutes. The service was great THANKS TO JESUS.  Jesus wasn't our server but he kept having to assist us because our server didn't really come much! Jesus told us our server had to take care of a large section, so he was helping him. At the end of our meal though, our initial server swiped out card 4 times and then someone else kept swiping it which caused our bank to put a fraud hold ‍ and unfortunately our bank was closed so we gotta call in the morning.
The only thing that was shocking to me was the sign at the front entrance, it was very rude and offensive and I'm surprised a business would allow this sign to be posted!

I found it very rude and unprofessional for a business, especially to mention a mental illness as a joke! This was done in very poor taste and the manager who allowed this needs to be reprimanded! Also the term "Karen" is used as an insult to Caucasian women who complain, yet again this sign is wrong on so many levels and needs to be removed! I don't think I will eat here again.

I would give 5  for Jesus because his service was exceptional, but the sign left a bad fast in my mouth so I'm leaving one star, sorry  Jesus ‍

author: Jane N.
review text: I'm actually typing this as I'm sitting at the restaurant because I am so disgusted with the service. We didn't even got water until 25 minutes after being seated. Then the server blames the restaurant about his lag.  We ate our first order of meat without anything they normally seat us with, ie salad, dipping sauce tray, etc. our rice was cold, our popcorn chicken was cold.  We are currently sitting with a burnt out grill with no meat, no salad, no ssam jang...this is korean bbq right? He just told me they ran out.  I will not be coming here again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ren N.
review text:
We came from a different korean bbq about a mile away or so because we had a rude greeter at u grill. We left that restaurant before we were seated and will not go back. It was also our first time wanting to give u grill a try but that greeter just was too rude and we left...

We came to gen kbbq house which was our second option. It is our second time to this establishment but first time at this location. We were greeted nicely and respectfully compared to u grill when they had an mia greeter who pop out of no where giving us an attitude.

We were seated within a few minutes after we arrived at gen kbbq house. It only took another couple of mintues to get our banchan sides and meats. Our server was River(?). He really did an excellent job in serving us our meats. We gave him a 10 dollar tip. We also gave another server who did not gave her name(?) but was really friendly and nice and swift at giving us our banchan a 5 dollar tip. We also added an additional 5.01 tip onto the bill. We spent about 60 something total for our lunch. It was worth it. A bit overboard we spent but service was awesome. They also did not rush us... We stay about 3 or 4 hours there.

There was a few downside about it though is that they did not have much thinly sliced options of meat we like there. The grill was so dirty and it was not changed for us the entire time we ate. They were a little forgetful in getting some stuff we asked but I get that they were really busy after we sat down and ate. I was just not quite satisfied of what meat and sides they really had. I do really enjoyed the popcorn chicken though.

Overall, we like the service more than the food there. We had eaten elsewhere that had more tastier meats and thinner slice of meats with a lot more sides. But this is actually our first time eating again at a kbbq with all this covid-19 been going on. We may return again but its questionable!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jahaira C.
review text:
I get y'all are busy ... BUT it's literally just TWO OF US.

This is a ONE time review for THIS particular Gen.

Don't get me wrong, I LOVE Gen KBBQ, but this location absolutely disappointed me.

This was the order of the unfortunate events:

1. My partner and I waited 1.5-2 hours to be seated ( 2ppl) and when we were finally assigned a seat, my partner told the waiter he'd be back in a couple min to get a jacket from our vehicle. As soon as we returned from the car ( less than 5 min later.. ), another couple was given our table and they received their order immediately. We had to wait to be seated once again.

2. When we ordered, they brought us the incorrect four items, including missing utensils, napkins and drinks. (15-20 min wait)

3. Once we received our food, our grill had been turned on the entire wait thus it was BLACK. We asked literally every waiter we saw on site including the front desk staff, and no one came for an additional 20+ UNTIL my partner got up from his seat and told the staff to change the BURNT pan now. We eventually turned off the grill because the entire thing was black and we couldn't cook any of our food the entire time, we literally only had our rice for over an hour.

Overall, the food is lovely, we tried to make the best out of this experience, but I must say this was quite disappointing/:

I've been a waitress in the past so stating my experience from my point of view as someone who's worked in this field is unfortunate and my expectations were literally the minimum Requirements for a dine in.

Anyways, hopefully this is a one time thing and doesn't occur again to not only us but anyone, for the price we paid, I truly believe this was unacceptable.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A

author: Patricia A.
review text: Came in a Saturday and by 8pm they weren't taking anyone else in. I decided to give them another chance and i ordered online for pick up. The girl at the front was rude and when I let her know it was missing an item she took my stuff back and when she brought it back she purposely put it sideways so it could spill everywhere. Gen should really do a mystery shopper for the girls In the front.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A

author: Danielle R.
review text: Sat next to trash during the whole dinner. I asked our waiter when it would be cleaned up, and his response was that they only had one busser and he was on the other side of the restaurant but it'll eventually get cleaned. After sitting next to the smell of rotting food, gnats and flies, no AC on, delayed meat and a waiter who looked absolutely over worked and way under supported.....we paid and left. Very disappointing.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Emily L.
review text:
Never really liked Gen for ayce kbbq since there's just better places out there, but bc of covid, this is the closest thing to kbbq that's open for togo.

For $10, you can select two different meats and 3 different banchan. I recommend the beef options since it's not as dry as the pork.

The portions are pretty good. I finish the box in two meals. They also give a roll of toilet paper with each order which is pretty nice considering there's a toilet paper shortage everywhere.

They also sell their kbbq meats raw by the pound.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Erin P.
review text: Finally got a table. The service was terrible. I know through the pandemic it's been very hard to keep restaurants staffed but they should try a little harder to make sure they're servicing all the customers in a timely fashion. At any point in time during my meal I could look at the bar and see employees on their cell phones while we waited for basic things like water and chopsticks. To top it all off, the air conditioning unit was broken and we were told it's been broken for quite a while. Attached is a picture of a portable unit that reads 85.1° in a place where you sit at a table and grill your own food. How have they not gotten the air conditioning fixed by now? The place is going downhill fast and I foresee new management having to clean up the mess of the current. I doubt we will return to this location.

address:

review text: Heads up! If you're placing an order through a third party WEIGH IT! I just received my order and everything was off. And if you're ordering rice paper just don't (see pic). I understand this location is busy all the time, but this is just irritating. If you're not going to properly and fairly sell items then just don't offer delivery period.

review text: I came with my baby daughter and sister, we had a nice experience, especially with care of Justin and Edith. These workers were really helpful for us and kept checking on us if everything was fine! Thank you to Justin and Edith for making our experience the best!

review text:
I had a great experience today with my friends. We had to wait maybe 45 minutes to be seated and that was okay.
Our waiter Justin was so wonderful and helpful.  The food was good and the experience of trying different meat and sides was a lot of fun.  
I recommend Gens at least experience the atmosphere and food.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A

author: Elisa S.
review text:
First time trying Gen, while visiting out of town.

COVID restrictions:
Wear a mask
Temperature check at the door
Then you wait outside until seated outside

Superb food. Tried beef brisket, riblets, bulgogi, calamari steak and shrimp. For appetizers we tried fried seaweed rolls, popcorn shrimp and japchae.

The flavor was so delicious. The panchan was a perfect compliment.

Soda was well carbonated. We cooked at the table.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jennifer T.
review text:
**it's understandable due to covid business aren't running as effective as they would like to be....
I checked in my family of 3, was told it was going to be about 1 hour we were seated an 1 hour and 30 minutes later. When we were finally seated we were quickly taken our order. Noticed the table to the right of us ordered after us. My family waited about 40 minutes after being seated when the waitress noticed we didn't have our food but the table to the right had received their food. We waited again about 15 min before letting our waitress know we wanted the check. A few minutes later our waitress comes back with food (not what we ordered) said that a manager wanted to speak to us and politely said to eat while we waited in the mean time. We waited 15 min for a manager to show up before we began to walk to the front desk when a Manager spotted our family and approached us. She stated what was the reason of us leaving and after we told her she apologized and insisted that we stay to eat. She kept reminding us about low staff and we said we understood that they should have a better routine to seating people and that we have a toddler who has a schedule.

Unfortunately I will never be returning to this establishment for the simple fact that they think its OK to joke or whatever you might want to call it....but I personally find it very unprofessional to have a sign that reads "Karen's don't yell at us".

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sarah B.
review text:
We have been here a few times now and have been blown away by the fantastic service each time. We have had different servers the times we've come and each server was very professional, prompt, and kind. I don't often find service that is so good that I feel the need to ask for a manager to tell them how amazing their staff is, but this was certainly the case at Gen. The management/leadership at this location is doing something very well. They are hiring and training great servers. In addition to that, this location is always very clean and the food fantastic. I would look no further if you're looking to get some good Korean BBQ. This is the place to go!

The garlic pork belly is my personal favorite. Also make sure to ask for the dipping sauces!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Krys K.
review text:
Bad news first: reason for loosing one star; the young hostess and servers were not observant of the customers waiting for their check. Which in turn, created a longer wait for the rest of the customers on the waitlist. My family observed a large party waiting 30 minutes for their check. Same for some of the smaller tables. Smaller issues: No beef tongue.

Good news: HEY GEN MANAGEMENT: if you want to succeed, remember your staff needs better training skills, like Josh. Once we got our table, our server Josh, apologized for the wait. He mentioned they were short staffed, and is shows.

We explained our observation and he said he will do his best to make sure to let upper management know. From that point, Josh took our drink order and food order. This young man has a good memory. He brought 98% of what we asked for within the first 15 minutes. Since the restaurant had to prepare everything inside, it did take time to get the food out. They did their best and I cannot express my appreciation for Josh and his hustle!

If GEN ever "let go" Josh, Gen will not survive.

address:

A lot of the normal stuff they normally have. We had a good dinner.  They do require a mask when coming in, then you can take it off when your eating. It was not too crawled.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Barbara F.
review text: During the time where stay home orders were in place and I didn't really want to venture out to Rowland Heights to pick up Korean BBQ meat to grill at home, I was lucky to stumble upon an ad on Instagram about Gen Delivers. OMG.. Such perfect timing because my husband's birthday was coming up and I wanted to surprise him with Korean BBQ at home. If you order before 8:00 pm the day before and spend at least $100, they deliver to you. My delivery was free because I live right near the Rancho Cucamonga location. EVEN BETTER! I ordered my favorites the Hawaiian Steak, Bulgogi, Cajun Shrimp, Cajun Chicken, Garlic Chicken, Honey Chicken, Gen Steak, Beef Short Ribs, Beef Brisket, Beef Cheek, Spicy Chicken and all the sides. Everything came neatly wrapped in a box surrounded with temperature controlled packaging. Temperature of the meat was nice and cold. I bought some smokeless grills, there the meat on them, and it was just like being at Gen! I have ordered several times since and great experience everytime!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nathan C.
review text:
The meats at Gen are always good and fresh. Pair this with good company that can eat and it'll be a great time!

We usually start off by ordering a few rounds of brisket since it cooks the fastest. Then we follow up with other red meats such as bulgogi and steaks. I'm not a huge fan of cooking chicken, because it takes a while and there is a chance of cross contamination. My favorite sides are kimchi, rice paper, and rice. It's $22 for AYCE, so it's a fair price, especially if you eat a lot!

I'm usually not a huge fan of the service, because it gets busy and the workers get frustrated. However, we had a great server this time around and it was nice. His name is Josh and he was very patient with the big party we had. He got all our meats out in a timely manner and he had a great attitude the whole night.

You will most likely smell like BBQ after eating, because of the smoke. So if you're going out after, bring a change of clothes!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Rachel B.
review text:
I grew up in Rancho Cucamonga and remember the rage over Gen when they first opened up. I recently moved to LA and was in town for a wedding on a Friday evening. Friends and I came here for lunch in the middle of the day and expected to be seated rather quickly. It turns out they were understaffed that day as it took us awhile to be seated after the hostess made us feel like an inconvenience with her very dry, no eye contact "welcome".

We could tell the waiter was slammed as he consistently forgot our orders. I would not recommend the onion rings as they tasted as if they were once frozen. Our orders that contained marinated meat took forever to come to the table. Everything else was fine, but I will be visiting the other Korean bbq on the other side of the 15 freeway.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: George L.
review text:
Lmao this place audio levels scare people with the loud celebrations for bdays but it's very fun nonetheless.

We came here to relax and turns out one of our friends had his bday (didn't know, whoops). The Gen's here is very nice - columns of neon light tableaux are everywhere, the place feels clean, service stood out being great, and the food is the quality one would expect if most Gen's. Personally I would actually rate this Gen's higher than other ones since the service was legitimately great and service was really stood out. Better than other Gens imo.

Our waitress was nice and patient, and we were able to order a bunch of items regularly and timely. I think I counted about 5-6 times we ordered for food in the 2 hours allotted.

Food is good as always, with bulgogi, beef belly, and the more exotic like intestines and such. If you're new and have 3 friends who haven't ordered KBBQ then I recommend getting a little bit of gen chadol (beef brisket ie the round looking slices), anything chicken, samgyubsal (pork belly), and especially bulgogi. They serve with complimentary kimchi, pickles and such and also always ask for rice.

Pretty much standard for all Gens is that they change out the stovetop regularly, so if your stovetop gets charred a person will come by and replace it.

Food is the quality one expects from Gens and honestly the service is solid which is icing on the cake. 5/5.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Michelle M.
review text:
After living in Rancho for the last 10 years, and saying that we were going to eat at Gen Korean BBQ House for the last 10 years, we FINALLY did.  
We were going back and forth on what to have for dinner, and decided to try Gen.  I'm so happy that we did.  To be honest though, I'm kind of mad at myself that we wait so long to eat here.  The food is top notch!  Now if you're a newbie to Korean BBQ like us, you're in for a fun time.  You basically order off the all you can eat menu, and cook the food yourself.  There are so many delish items to choose from.  With the recommendations from our server (I can't remember her name), we decided on garlic chicken, Hawaiian steak, short ribs, pork belly, and veggies.  The all you can eat dinner also comes with rice, salad, and an assortment of little side treats like rice paper, kimchi, and pickled cucumbers.  For my fitness minded friends, this is a keto lovers dream restaurant.  Protein, protein, and more protein.  Because I do have a sweet tooth, and enjoy dessert on my cheat days, my only teeny, tiny complaint is they don't have any.  However though, they have a full bar with all of the usual Asian restaurant style drinks, plus everything else.  As for the service...EXCELLENT!  Our drinks were never empty, and we were always checked on to see if we wanted/needed anything else.  
Gen Korean BBQ, you have earned an A+ in my book, and I can't wait to visit again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Manny B.
review text: Got to say that Gens did a fine job yesterday, there covid system is pretty solid and the service was awsome our Waiter "Branden or Brandon" (tall funny white guy) was amazing 5 stars to him alone his energy was on point. $20 tip wasn't enough ill make sure to leave more next time :)!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lizeth A.
review text:
One of my family favorite restaurant! Love the staff always super friendly! Love Vee she is awesome and all her staff! Delicious food.

Wait time depends when you. Now they have an awesome system where you can add yourself to the waitlist via yelp which save s lots of time! Love it! The good is amazing i have pretty much tried everything and it is BOMB!

I love the spicy calamari, prime steak , my kids love the Hawaii steak and the list continues.....

Definitely a place to go and try out! It is not expensive and delicious.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Daniel V.
review text: we dying. been waiting. still waitin. lady rude at the front. help. dying of hunger. havent gotten chop sticks or food. phil a g though only reason ill give yall or him another star. give ma man a raise ong

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Alex S.
review text:
Good service ...,,,!!?!'...,,;;:::////  great manager.

Tasty food  .     ?!?.,,,....   best service .

Ask for manager . Adan

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Maryrose M.
review text: Gone to several Gens including this in the past and this location definitely stepped up a notch with customer service earning 5 stars.  Expect a wait during high peak hours but it's worth it. Prices are very competitive.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Adnan K.
review text: I think this is the best Korean BBQ restaurant in Rancho Cucamonga. This place is always very crowded so you have to wait at least 15 / 20 minutes after arrival. This place has a great ambience. Their service is also appreciable. We came here 3 times and each time they served us well. The food is outstanding. It's like all you can eat in two hours. Great food with a variety of meats and other side dishes like calamari, shrimp etc. The meats are very fresh. Salad and rice are also like all you can eat. Even though the price seems a little bit high, this place is recommended for the Korean BBQ lovers.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Georgie M.
review text:
GEN Korean BBQ is simply the best BBQ, the best Korean food place to eat in any town they decide to open a restaurant!

I've been reading the mouth watering reviews in Yelp for nearly nine years, going back to their original location in K-town LA.

Ever since we left the east coast, we have been looking for some good Korean food for our Asian blended family. The best so far had been Chodang in Chandler.  yelp.com/biz/chodang-cha…  Recently GEN has opened an outpost in Tempe.

We came here with friends one evening and had a blast.  We didn't have Reservations, so we sat for a bit. But, when we were seated, it was in the middle of the restaurant, with a good view of their prep-kitchen.

Everything was fresh. The service was excellent. Prompted, but never rushed.  The price for dinner was $20 for AYCE (All You Can Eat), which seemed like both a dare and a steal.

Expect to pay around $25 to $30 before taxes and gratuities, depending on how thirsty you are.

Enjoy!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lyn Z.
review text:
Worst kbbq experience ever. we don't have steamed egg, sorry we don't have corn, we don't have beef belly ok can I please order salad well about that the salad will have to be dry we don't have the dressing. holly cow what the heck do you have.  
I asked for more pickled cucumber, pickled onion never saw any so I decided to kiss that idea good bye. Asked for house sauce never saw any of that either.
Just come to this place if your bored at want to stare at an empty grill.

Don't make promises you can not keep. Mind you it's Sunday early lunch place is empty when they first open  and u still have horrible service. Now that it's packed forget any type of service.

We had to get our own bill processed and go to the bar as Millie stood at the bar instead of helping the crew

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lil T.
review text:
From all the reviews, it seems like this restaurant is a "hit-or-miss" place.  Gratefully, our experience was a "hit".  Came in on a Sunday afternoon around 12:15pm..got lucky..group of 8, seated immediately.  

Service was quick and diligent.  Male waiter took our orders patiently as everyone was trying to talk at once.  He kept our drinks refilled and changed our grills frequently.  

The condiments were limited and mediocre.  The meats were good with a tad too much seasoning.  The salad was salty but tasty.  There were a wide selection of meats and seafood which was a plus.  My favorite is the kalbi and brisket..shrimp and calamari.

I may come back here but a little skeptical that I'm up for a "miss"next time.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Valerie T.
review text: This review is for the OUTDOOR dining experience only. I personally did not like that they brought out the food in a OLD burnt skillet. All the food brought out was mixed together. If we order 4 things they mixed it all together and I did not like that. I couldn't tell what I was eating because it was all mixed. It should have all been put to the corner if we ordered multiple things. Over cooked the steak. I love gen but now only for indoor dining.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jennifer L.
review text: The service is always good at Gen. It was close to opening time when we got there. There was only one actual server, I think his name was Pheung "superpheung" as his name tag stated. I believe someone called off or something so he was alone. Anywho, I was a little worried because I probably require more than most when I'm kbbqing lol, but even with about 8 tables, he did us right. About 15 mins in, he had help from a couple of other ppl which allowed us to receive perfect service. There was a blonde female staff member wearing glasses, I think she was the manager, she was also super sweet and quick. Seriously always a good experience at any Gen location. Thanks guys

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Cilla P.
review text: Hell ya!! I just got kbbq delivered from gen!! Check out my pics it also came with a grill too! Freaking amazing. And a roll of toilet paper

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mardine M.
review text:
Gen is located in the intersections of Rochester and Foothill next to Denny's. I didn't expect much here because I am always disappointed at the end. We called ahead of time to check what is the wait time and the lady told us " no wait time at the moment." We went straight there and the lady told us to wait couple minutes while they prepared our table.

During the weekend the price is dinner only which is 20.99$.

Our server was Deejay, and Obed. They did a good job made sure we got our order. They are very attentive and always helpful. I was surprised how fast this two work because  with just the two of them they took care of our table and the others as well. If the service is like this every time, I would definitely comeback every time.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Alice Q.
review text: Jinro Chamisul is my fave beverage from S Korea and getting that along with my Gogi-GUI experience was just what I needed. I brought my cousins here because they never experienced Korean BBQ whatsoever and I wanted to make that happen for them. Yelping a Korean BBQ experience near me, Gen was super attractive because of how popular it was and also looked like a promising place to get fresh meats and seafood. Coming in, we were greeted with a hip, dim lighted and cyber looking bar with a table and the stove. We didn't get immediate service to order food, we waited to get the check for what seemed almost an hour. The food, even though we cooked it reasonably well, still tasted sort of salty and off. I was thrown off by the Bulgogi and also spent an hour feeling sick at the restaurant. I wasn't very happy with the service. Overall, I liked the futuristic sit down, but I don't think I will return.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Don K.
review text:
What a cool looking restaurant! With the neon accents and tall, tall ceilings in the main room, once you walk in the door, you feel as if something special was going to happen. Or maybe they're trying too hard to make up for something else? This is an all you can eat restaurant, right?

We went on a Saturday afternoon, where only the dinner menu was available, which was ok with us. It's the standard cook it yourself on the table flame cooker. The banchan selection was rather sparse and odd, but we overlooked it because we were there to catch up on a lot of years' worth of stories.

To the menu, which had the classic Korean bbq stuff and other not-so-classics (Cajun shrimp, anyone? Huh???). You are allowed 4 selections at a time and you can double up on a selection, or I'm sure you can get 4 of the same selection at once. The meat selections were well marinated and tasty, except for the pork belly which was NOT marinated. We also ordered the jap chae,  which was just foul. No idea what they used, but it was not the classic ingredients. So, please, please avoid the jap chae!!!

Overall, for a chain, I think the formula works pretty well. Stick with the meats (the calamari steak was ok, but that Cajun shrimp wasn't great - yeah, I just had to try it) and you should be ok.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Princess Rose R.
review text:
We walked in around 12:30 pm on a Sunday. There are few people waiting, wearing their masks. The server told us that there is a 25 minute waiting time. They took our name and phone # and maybe around 10-15 minutes of waiting, we already received a text that we can already go for dine in. They also have a temperature scanner before entering the restaurant to make sure the customer doesn't have fever. Food is really good. We got some beef bulgogi and premium chadol. I love the premium chadol and the plain beef bulgogi kind of neautralize the taste. I like the ambiance. All the servers are wearing protective masks and face shield to protect themselves and their customers too which is nice. If you dont want to waste your time waiting in the restaurant or in your car, I believe the yelp has some "Join Waitlist" option so you could reserve your time.

They also will gove you a QR Code so you can access your paperless menu, which is very helpful so as for people to be safe from any viruses or germs.

Overall, nice experience.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Virginia N.
review text: I've gone to many Gen's in many locations. I appreciate this specific location as there isn't too many Korean bbq options in the inland empire. Service here is generally pretty good however the wait can be very LONG. I wish this location offered the yelp waitlist as others do. Overall the food is plentiful, there is more seafood options than some other Korean bbq spots. And everything seems fresh and is good. The only thing I would change is the font of the menu and the lighting and it is really difficult for me to read it. Other than that, delicious!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Leslie F.
review text:
SIX STARS SAWYEH.
If I could give her 6 stars I would.

If we needed more food, we got it. If we needed more drinks, we got it. If we needed a new grill, we got it. She was so on top of everything. She was very attentive and helpful when we needed help deciding on menu items. Thanks so much Sawyeh!! We will be back again!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Simon C.
review text:
The food and sides are very tasty.  What also makes this place great is that the servers are helpful when and nice about getting you more sides or a particular side dish.  The food was very tasty.  I usually would get the beef brisket and short ribs.

The reason why I give this a 4 star is because, although the food is great, the service was a little worse than usual.  For our first order, we ordered various meats and asked for tofu soup and popcorn chicken.  The two easier items to get out, minus the beef brisket, took almost 15 mins before they came out.  The server said he would check up on it and would only reassure us that they are slowed down a little and would get it out asap.  He had to tell us this twice, before the manager of the restaurant came and took care of it.  Also, for obvious reasons, I think they just gave us less fattier meat so we would eventually get full and leave.  I am always impressed with the first round of meat, but any other rounds of repeating meat and it goes downhill from there.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jennifer D.
review text:
I have been wanting to check this place out since it opened, but my guy was like  " why am I going to go to a place where I have to cook my own food?!" I was thinking it sounded fun so I got told let's cook something at home then. lol.
My cousin agreed to come on this food adventure with me and we had a blast. We came for the all you can eat lunch $16.99 a person. We were seated quickly at a booth that had a grilling apparatus in the center. Our server said that our eating experience had a 2 hour time limit. I thought that was funny. We were done in an hour, we don't eat that much !
There were many meats , seafood, soups, and vegetables to pick from.  I enjoyed the whole cooking process. There were different sauces and spices you could choose to add to flavor your meal to your liking.
I am glad I found someone to go with. I want to go again. I am trying to eat lower carbohydrates, so this was a perfect choice.
" I'll be back" ( Terminator voice)

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nelle G.
review text: An amazing experience every time we come here . Danny our server always takes care of us and goes above and beyond! One of our favorite places to eat !

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Tom H.
review text: They're doing a $10 Corona special where you pick your 2 meats and 3 sides and rice. Certain meats are an upgrade like Galbi. Called my order in and spoke to Josh and in 25 minutes they were done. Ordered some for friends and family and I became a delivery person. Food was delicious and portions were good. Josh and his crew of one were working their butts off so make sure throw them at least 20% tip for some love. Best way to order is go to their website and pull up their menu.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lynn N.
review text: I haven't had Gen for lunch but I have been to other locations for dinner. It was $16.99 for lunch and the food was great. The meats were soft and well seasoned. My favorite was the Hawaiian beef with the pineapple. I would also recommend the short ribs and bulgogi as well. As for the sides, the sweet rice cakes were terrific. The glass noodles was pretty good to okay. The squid was soft as well, not rubbery at all. The shrimps had the heads on with the sweet head butter. The tofu soup was salty and spicy, great for a cold day. The service here was fast once you get their attention. The food also came out quickly after you order. Overall, I would visit this location again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ryan H.
review text:
Our party came promptly at 8:45pm and checked into our 9pm reservation. We were told it's currently being cleaned. I checked in on our table again at 9:15 and she told me she'd let me know soon and never got back to me. We were finally seated at 9:40pm. I was a little disappointed in the time it took them. It almost defeats the purpose of getting a reservation.

I felt that our server or servers were not super attentive of our table. We had to ask them for silverware for our steamed eggs and the sauces for the meat 4 times because they kept forgetting us. We did not have a consistent server and at times we had flag down people to order more meat

They also made 6 of us share one grill. I've been to other ayce kbbq places where it's usually 4 people per grill. The meats came out pretty slowly and the serving sizes were not meant for 6 people. They were definitely meant for 2-3 people to cook on.

The food was pretty good, and the lack of service starting from the beginning left a bad taste in my mouth.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Viclaire S.
review text:
Good service and great food!  I've been to quite a few KBBQ places and this place impressed me.  Love the cool look inside, wide and long bench seats, and fun atmosphere.  We came for lunch and our servers were Brandon and Mark.  There were a few mix ups with our meat orders, but nothing that couldn't be fixed.  They were both very friendly and nice and came to check on us.  I was impressed on the cleanliness of the restaurant and the flavors of the food.  Bulgogi and short ribs are theeee best!!!  I also liked the dessert macaroon.

Would go back again if we are in town!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Helen D.
review text:
Saddest experience ever at this location. We eat kbbq usually about 2x a month. We hardly ever come to this location(usually we go to Chino Hills). Anyways we checked in around 7:40pm waited about 40 mins to be seated. Once we get to our table there are no utensils no sauces, just plates. So it takes about 15 mins for our server to take our order.
Our 1 plate of bulgogi and shrimp come out and that's it. For 4 people... we wait about 30 more mins to order more food and our utensils drinks etc, about 1 hr later we're missing a ton of stuff not to mention all the tables in our section are all dirty. Only one other table was sitting in our section and we hardly ever saw the servers. We kept having to ask more than 4x for our food and stuff it was ridiculous.
mind you we only ate 1 plate of bulgogi, 1 plate of shrimp and a plate of brisket. We were so done already, not wanting to wait any longer so we get the bill and it's almost $100.00. How in the world is it 100 If we barely ate any food. Didn't even get drinks and having to sit there for 2 hrs. That's the most pathetic experience ever. It's supposed to be all you can eat. We couldn't even order anything because no servers were in sight, and when we finally got one we would order then have to wait like 45 mins to have to ask again for the food we just ordered that never came out. Smh

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Maryanne D.
review text:
My favorite Gen!

This is our family's go-to Gen KBBQ House. We've been to several of their other locations but this location is always consistent when it comes to the quality of food and customer service. On our recent visit, Gene as our server and he was awesome! Very friendly and funny guy. He was super attentive throughout our meal. He kept our meat orders comin', our grill was changed out every time as it was needed, and our waters were always filled up. Every time we've dined here, we always received the same great service and attention. They truly have a great staff here. I wish I could say the same for the Chino Hills location, which is much closer to us but due to the inconsistency of their customer service there, we make the drive to Rancho and it is always worth it.

Hubs and I love the beef brisket, beef belly, garlic pork belly, bulgogi, and cajun shrimp. Yummm! Everything, including the salad and unlimited banchan, is always fresh and tasty. Even the restrooms were very clean and well-stocked!

We also had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Adam. Super nice young man who genuinely care about the satisfaction of his customers. We often see him walking around, visiting other guests and ensuring everyone leaves with a pleasant, fun and delicious experience.

5 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service. Happy bellies all around. Keep it up, Rancho Gen!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Laura L.
review text: I've been here a few times. And I kind of started migrating to U-grill instead. But lately I've started coming back here because I felt that Gen had more variety of meats. Like pork cheek, my fave! Also, the best part is, they open at 10am on the weekends. So that's a plus! I am a morning person, so a girl get hannnggry by 9am haha. I feel like it's the best time to come, you beat the rush and your food come out super quick!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Cindy Z.
review text:
Gen BBQ is the high fashion of Korean BBQ. The better the quality, the higher the price as well though. For $25 AYCE dinner, it's worth the value on the special occasion though. I came out here with a party of 16 for a friend's going away dinner. There was a huge mishap and situation with them holding a table for us even after we put down a $200 deposit. It was ridiculous, but luckily we got it figured out eventually. The couple who took the awkward table between our group even opted to move to another table so our group wouldn't be separated. Nonetheless, it was all figured out and our entire group had arrived.

To get to the point, the food here is great. My favorites are the angus beef and hawaiian beef. --both are absolute musts. Here's a warning: DO NOT get the steamed egg because they come raw and you must waste space on your grill to cook it. I mean, unless you have that kind of patience and love steamed egg enough to do so, be my guest.

I do have to give it to them for good service despite us being a huge group and asking for many refills. Props to Hannah for constantly checking up on us!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ana Maria T.
review text: The best place to enjoy family had a good time. We came to celebrate my love birthday love it

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Trina D.
review text:
My parents and I had dinner here since it's literally the only KBBQ AYCE joint in town.  I was excited about their opening last year but this was the first time I'd been since then.  My parents have gone several times and seem to like the place.  It is a typical Gen KBBQ with fancy booths, a club-like atmosphere, and menu.  Our first server basically took our drink order, food order and left.  He wasn't seen again until we needed a grill change and when it was time to pay.  Our second server, Mirayla (?), was amazing.  She made sure our requests were put in timely, and checked on us when there was a lull.  We made sure she got the tip despite the other server coming by to see if we had paid the bill.  She worked her ass off and my parents were impressed.  Somebody give the girl a raise.  

Food was good for Gen and we ordered a variety of items: sirloin steak, bulgogi, chadol, Cajun prawns, calamari, Hawaiian steak, japchae, vegetables, soondooboo, and short ribs (boneless and with bones).  The meal was great and despite the hiccup with the first server, we had a pleasant time.  They have an upstairs area too with seats as well so it's a fairly large restaurant.  They have a full bar as well.  Sadly dessert is not included but you can purchase separately if you're in the mood.  $14.99 for lunch weekdays, $19.99 for dinner and all-day weekends.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jayeve R.
review text: I really loved this place! Our waiter was great. Food was really good. Nice setting and music! To top it off, the price was good too. I definitely understand why this place is always full on the weekends. I will definitely come back on a regular bases and special events!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ricardo G.
review text:
Two visits under my belt, and I have nothing bad to say about this place besides maybe the wait being a little long. What do you expect though, people love good eatin! If you are one of those persons who has the patience to wait, you will be rewarded with great food and an awesome ambiance.

    My friends and I come here to let loose on the calories. If your on a protein diet, this is the place for you! They have a long list of raw meats and poultry, including fish. We started off with the the Hawaiian Steak, Cajun shrimp, beef bulgogi and teriyaki chicken. We all fell in love with the Hawaiin steak so we kept that meat in our rotation all night!! The other things we tried was the Cajun chicken (barf), tongue (ehhh), and the rib. At this point I was too stuffed to keep eating so I didn't try the rib but my buddy thought it was good.

   One other thing that i forgot to mention is that we enjoyed their potato salad so much we ordered a big bowl of it to go with our dinner. It's bomb!

    Jesse was our waiter and he provided awesome service. He never once appeared to have been frustrated with us even though we kept him very busy, asking for napkins, drinks, food and selfies lol. We ate like kings and our bill was just under $100 for four of us. Looking forward to my next visit.

P.S. They have beer, lol

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brenda G.
review text:
Just moved to this city and I was looking for a great Korean bbq place as good as LA. I found this place here and I was skeptic about it because of some bad reviews I read on here. But damn this place blew me away.
I was amazed at the great costumer service my family and I received. We waited just a few minutes to get seated but it wasn't too long the wait. Our waitress was excellent, wished I could of gotten his name. He interacted with my son which that's always a plus for me. Also loved how he would always check up on our table, and if we needed drink refills he would bring them to us. The food was great, it was delicious. Only down side is that they had ran out of hot sauce. (I love hot sauce on my food) Also, even though the restaurant closed at 11 we never felt we got rushed to get out of there. We will definitely be going back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Tanishia W.
review text:
This was my first ever Korean BBQ and it was a blast. Came here after checking out the Christmas Light Display at the Irvine Speedway. It's located in a large shopping plaza just look for the neon lights.

There was a bit of a wait about twenty minutes and we were seated. The place was much larger on the inside than I thought. Our waiter was extremely nice and patient. He explained how everything worked and got us started on our drinks and apps. FYI apps aren't needed you'll get plenty of food. You get to the table and they have this large set up of little bowls with different sauces and what they call sides. There was music playing they also have a full bar in the middle of the restaurant.

It's an AYCE so everything on the menu is up for grabs. I did chicken shrimp and calamari. He had everything lol pork belly Kalbi beef squid everything. We had the wine and it was pretty tasty. Overall a great first time experience.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lissette M.
review text: First time here and most likely will not be returning here anytime soon. Found a piece of hair inside the rice. No wine available due to it not being stocked. No prongs or kitchen shears provided when meat arrived. Wrong meat provided instead of ordered. Glass noodles did not taste good. Salad did not look appetizing at all.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: McFly F.
review text: By far the worst Ace Kbbq that I have ever been to, don't know if it was the service, or the food. I always wondered why there was so many people willing to wait 45-1hour+ just to eat here, then I saw the price 'ahhh $21 you get what you pay for.. The food quality isn't great. I mean the best thing on the menu was the brisket, probably because it wasn't drinch in sugar and soy sauce, table wasn't set with dipping sauce trays. Had to ask the server, both restrooms didn't have paper towel, floor was very slippery up stairs, and the worst part there center grill sucks.btw there grill sucks. Wish there was a better option where you can pay for better service and better quality meats.. We won't be going back..

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Judy Soojin K.
review text: Me and my daughter are craving for a Korean bbq today. AYCE Lunch is $16.99 only until 3pm. Pretty good place for a Korean bbq.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Josh D.
review text:
We really enjoy coming to Gen. We've gone to 3 different locations and haven't experienced any issues at all.  

The staff are always very friendly.  The person who sat us said "Hey guys my name is Kendall, yeah i know, black guy with a white girl name.... dunno how that happened. " LOL had us rolling.  Good way to start our meal.

Highly recommend coming to this place.  Its a fun environment. Good food.  You're your own chef.  Cook it how you want it... all you can eat.  

I recommend the bulgogi, brisket, spicy chicken, premium steak, pork belly, etc.

Make sure you have enough wrappers. Dicon radish. Dipping sauces.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Louis L.
review text:
I came here to try something different since I haven't been here for a while.  The last time I came here was in 2015.  How time flies!!!

I was seated by the bar which was somewhat crowded, but it was okay, considering this place is always crowded and the wait can be over an hour.

Our server, Jordan, was very professional and my overall experience with his services was very satisfactory. I am glad GEN has improved their service and have properly trained their staff the right way.
This is also one of the reasons why I stopped coming here, which involves their service.

The meats were very good, and flavorful.  The portions were just right and not overwhelming.  One of my favorite meats is their pork cheek; tasted juicy and tender.  

One drawback while seating by the bar area is the floor was very sticky and slippery, due to the water leak that was by their area to the kitchen.
The floor was very wet and there were a couple of times that I had to walk slowly, to not fall down.  Whatever was leaking, I suggest please fix it so the overall dining experience can improve.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Yoggie V.
review text: Paid $58 for this and 1 pound rice paper which wasn't included. The portions are ridiculous and they didn't include all of the meats that was ordered either. Ive been trying to call since my husband picked up the food on his way home and I havent been able to get through for the past 25 minutes.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ashley B.
review text:
1 star review for service: GEN CERRITOS IS SO MUCH BETTER!

First & Foremost we arrived at 1227 & Jo? the hostest on the video I shot did NOT greet us or ask us how many were in our party. She saw us as she was coming back from im assuming checking on something for someone on the phone. As I was standing there at the hostess desk awaiting to get my name down on the list she just looked at me picked up the phone and kept talking so I had to take a video.

1236pm-- we (Fiancé, Myself, and friend) finally got our names on the list.
MIND YOU there were 2 NICKS. The Nick below us got there before we did & they were dumb enough NOT to take his name down and make him wait --- and...

THEN NICK #1 came after us. He and a classmate were both in PLATT COLLEGE STUDENT SCRUBS BEGAN TO FLIRT WITH CHRISTINA THE SERVER/HOST then GUESS WHAT? She sat them BEFORE myself & the Nick below me. MY NAME IS #2 ON THE LIST AND BOTH NICKS WERE BELOW MY NAME.

SERIOUSLY? so I Asked her "are you seating people before us" Christina said: "Uh Yes! I only have party of 2 tables available --- BUT THE ENTIRE RESTAURANT WAS EMPTY (as seen in this video/video i posted)

When Christina saw I was taking photos and videos, she THEN SAT US at an OPEN TABLE FOR 6 stating "Hehehe I was trying to wait for a booth for you 3"

No! YEA RIGHT! you saw me take videos and photos thats why & probably are afraid to get your name on YELP & in the letter I am sending to corporate that "FLIRTING IS KEY to be SEATED even if you were there first.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Wendy T.
review text:
Worst experience ever!

First we arrived Thursday evening at 7:15 and the entry way was jam packed full of people. I go up, and put my name on the list. The wait time was 45 minutes. Just 15 minutes shy of my "fuck this" time. But the place seemed like it was poppin.

We finally get seated at this booth/table at the very back corner (literally BFE) and the host says he'll take our first order right away since we waited so long. Ok thanks. Our first order still didn't arrive for 10 minutes... it's raw meat, so what's the hold up? Not like they had to butcher the pigs and cows out back.

We had two different servers the whole time. Every time we ordered they would screw it up. We ordered 2 plates of brisket, they would bring 1 plate. We ordered a round of rice THREE TIMES and they never came. Everything we asked for, never came. We were seated for TWO HOURS and only had food delivered THREE TIMES. We literally left hangry, and pissed. We were seriously so hungry on our last hour there, we were licking our small banchan bowls clean. And those are complimentary AKA FREE. Top it off we ran out of banchan in our first 15 minutes there - they never bothered giving us more. We also ran out of drinks within 30 minutes, they never bothered to get us refills. We had a stack of empty/dirty raw meat plates, rice bowls, and banchan dishes sitting on our table - took them a whole HOUR to clear them.

Service was so shitty, we almost contemplated leaving without paying.

Also the amount of meat they brought out was literally enough for one person, and there was 3 of us. I'm giving 1 star because the quality of meat was actually really good, but also because yelp requires at least 1 star to review. But they're so damn frugal with the quantity.

Mango soju was good. The spicy rice cakes were alright. And the cucumber kimchi was really good.

Ventilation was AWFUL. Smoke in our faces, and they only changed our grill ONCE. And the tables are so close together that other peoples smoke was flying in our direction.

Overall, horrible experience. Service was nonexistent. Two adults, one kid cost $79.35... we left $80 and bounced. Sorry, if the service wasn't to our liking, you aren't getting a good tip... just a fuck you tip.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dainyeille B.
review text: This was a different experience for me. It reminds me of a Brazilian steak house except you have to prepare the already seasoned food yourself. It's a cool looking spot and the dinner price was good for what you get but I felt the food was mediocre. The waiters were not the most friendly and they  seemed bothered when we needed something. There is a two hour sitting limit, so be prepared to quickly scarf down all the food you can and save the lengthy fellowships for later! This place certainly won't be my first choice for my next outing.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Marlene E.
review text: This place is tooooo awesome!! Out of this world awesome!!! We had Jean as our waiter!! Duuude! Cool dude! He was so attentive, so sweeet, and just over all on his A-Game! Thanks Jean for making my experience too legit!!!!! Love this place and it's service!! Woot woot!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Rachel S.
review text:
As people know, my 4 &  5 star reviews are reserved for places that I'm a fan of & genuinely believe are "as good as it gets." You won't see me doling out top marks for places with forgettable or adequate fare.

This location had the best Korean BBQ I've ever had. It was so good in fact, that I was texting pricing info and pics to family for their next trip to CA, before we were even done with the meal.

Went here right after it opened for the day on  6/25/15. Upon entering, it looks like you're stepping into a night club. It was cool!

After eating at various establishments, I have a grill preference. It's annoying when you constantly have to change grill tops & have to wait for them to preheat because they char and smoke. During our meal, we only changed tops once. The grills are solid metal & slightly dome shaped with holes around the circumference to drain the grease. No unsightly grease pooling in a tray that has to be changed multiple times during the meal here.

The portions here are very generous. I'd almost suggest ordering a partial portion of new meats that you're trying so you're not left either stuffed or with leftovers that you can't take home.

I honestly have no idea how this place turns a profit because the meat quality is great and weekday lunch is $15 pp. The sirloin steak was insane - thick, with a wonderful fat "rind." The bulgogi was the best I've ever had. I'd say skip all the poultry if you even remotely enjoy beef - it's that good.

I like that the banchan was served in tiny portions so that you could fill up on meat. While some places serve endless appetizers to get you full on cheap carbs, Gen does not. They do have japchae as an option but there's nothing special about it. Again, it's all about the meat.

As a final flourish to an incredible meal, macaron ice cream sandwiches are sold separately for $3.25 near the register. Try one.

Service is fantastic. The place is clean. The servers are attentive without breathing down your neck trying to turn or cut your meat or messing with your burner (aka like most kbbq places.)  I can't wait to go back!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brenda F.
review text: Where do I start... my husband and I had a TERRIBLE experience this past Sunday at Gen! Our server  was Joesph John and he was terrible! He was missing for an like an hour and a nice server named Marco was there for us. Which was very helpful because we had 3 small children. When asked where our server was, no one knew where he was.. REALLY!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Marlene L.
review text: Definitely tried a variety of items on their menu. I honestly do NOT like calimari but once I tried it here OMG! It was the beat I've ever had. My absolute fav was the item #4 I don't remember the name of the meat but I was hungry and that one cooks the fastest. The cajón shrimp had great flavor it's just so much work taking off the shell. I most definitely recommend this place and will be returning. Great service & they change the grill every time we order so it's fresh. They give you unlimited rice as well & last. Also if you're going in group it has to be all in once check.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Moe G.
review text: My favorite place to go in Rancho when I'm starvin. The service is always on point and we're never waiting long on our order. Servers are nice even when you forget a few things and they gotta go back a few times in a row! And the manager Adam always comes by to make sure everything's good, and always has good recommendations. If your lookin for some good KBBQ this is the spot! Ps. Don't forget dessert! Macaroon ice cream sandwich is too good! The green tea, and the coffee one is where it's at!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jenny L.
review text:
There are couple of reasons why I rated this place a 5. First of all their dining menu has about 30 choices of meat, 2 choices of soup, and also rice cakes. Lunch menu has about 27 menu items. That's already a lot more than other AYCE kbbq places. I think their food is great but not the best I've had. Make sure you ask for soup! It helps to wash down everything. AND if you ever come in 30 mins before closing or 5mins before closing...there is no LAST CALLS

Their portions are pretty big so you don't have to worry about keep ordering the same type of meat like 5 times to be satisfied.

The environment and services are EXCELLENT!!! Our waiters (2) were making sure that everything was perfect and that everything I wanted/ordered were there. They took turn to serve us but it was no problem because we didn't have to repeat what we wanted twice. They were good at communicating with each other.
The place kinda looks like a club because of all those pretty neon lights! :)

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Tanya D.
review text: Food was so delicious and we had so much fun. We had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated, but that's what's expected at prime hour dinner time. Once seated, we just enjoyed our meat selections, you get to choose 4 meats, and you get rice with it. We also ordered rice noodles, it was an acquired taste, but as the evening, I mean "drinks" progressedit was good. The scenery is very welcoming and our hosts tagged team and were attentive, and luckily we didn't drive them crazy with our questions, plus it is all you can eat, so we ate!! Will definitely be back. The Hawaiian Steak was my fav

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mindy N.
review text:
I work fulltime and I'm a mom to.. ALOT of kids. With that said, when I finally get the chance to spend money, go out to eat, PLUS kidfree I hope to have great service. Otherwise I rather just stay in the comfort of my home cook great food for half the cost.

I almost gave up going out to eat because cust serv has been lacking in the IE. But with my sister in town we decided to go out to GEN.

The wait, on Mother's Day, wasn't too bad. Or maybe it was because we hit the bar first so time flew. We were helped left and right at the bar and when we got sat we had the most amazing server ever! I work really hard in providing cust serv. Where I work. It's your job so do it right. Right? Our server's name was David. He was great. He was attentive, offered suggestions, and there wasn't a time that he came by that we didn't all laugh together. We didnt feel rushed and really felt like we were treated like any person should when you pay to go out to eat. You know you've got an amazing server when you tip him half of  your bill verses the typical 15-20% tax. Thanks David for your exceptional service today. This guy is working a double and still manages to smile! Can't beat that!! Safe to say I definitely will come again.

Oh duh.. Food was great. Not the same as going to Rowland Heights but for the IE it's one of the better places with get ambience. Great crowd! The grill was changed several time without being asked. Drinks were full and meat kept coming.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Quyen N.
review text: Gen Rancho Cucamonga now does in store pickup! Tues-Friday 11am-8pm For pricing,  go on gendelivers.com so yummy and convenient ty for satisfying my kbbq cravings!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Blessing N.
review text:
Came in today on a Wednesday around 5pm. Waited for my 2nd friend and the bartender was just giving us a hard time. Sat at the bar to wait for a that friend, ordered drinks and bartender came after us about when we were going to close the tab. I was quite vexed about that. I prefer to keep my tab open for as long as I can so I can drink to my hearts content. So we closed the tab and went to sit at a table when my 2nd friend showed up.

We complained to Chris the manager and he was able to handle the miscommunication. Apparently the waiter was hoping we would close our tab before being seated at our table so we could tip him. But seriously there's better ways of approaching this situation than making a customer close out their tab when they are not ready. I was truly vexed!  Chris, however, was amazing and apologised appropriately, Thank You!

Food: the quality of food is changing quite a bit. The side dishes, such as the potato salad, used to taste better and had more ingredients. Now it seems quite commercialised to accommodate the massive number of customers they are receiving. I'm quite disappointed with the way things are going at GEN. The meat is tolerable so far. Hence the 1/5 rating.

Luckily this is the closest GEN in my area that is what has brought me back. I might just have to reconsider though from now on.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Connon O.
review text:
I'm not sure if you have to be into this "scene". It just didn't do it for me. It was my first time, I've heard nothing but "I'm missing out" for years now. I had a friend from Ny in town and figured we'd go.

Wait was about 30 minutes. Even at 2100 on a Sunday night. Shocking, but no big deal. We were seated, took our first order of 4 meats. 20 minutes later they came back for the second order and to be notified our waiter was going on break. His relief took the second order and we never saw him after that. No refills. No new orders. Nothing. Zip. Zero. Shit.

I became morbidly annoyed as I was trying to show a friend from 3,000 miles away how cali does things. We spoke to the manager in which he said he was going to give us half off.. I said we've been here almost 2 hours and only ordered twice.. for 5 people.. I'm not paying half for well under half assed service.

Manager made it right after he saw we did in fact only order twice, and never got the drinks we ordered. I won't be back ever. Despite the manager making things right. Our original waiter was beyond pissed that things fell apart. Not his fault, I understood that.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Chris A.
review text:
My fiance and I were starbing and pulled into the new Golden Corral in San Bernardino. After hearing many good things, we decided that today was the day to check it out..but then we pulled into the parking lot and saw the line of people waiting outside. Figuring out that it would take at least 20 minutes to actually get into the restaurant, we then decided to drive 20 minutes to Gen, a Korean BBQ place that we wanted to try.

We were quickly seated and greeted by a staff member who explained that on weekends, the dinner menu is available to order from. She also explained that there were unlimited rounds with a maximum of 4 orders each. This was also accompanied with salad and unlimited bonchon (i.e. kimchee, potato salad, cucumber kimchee, pickled garlic). We proceeded to order Hawaiian steak, beef brisket, pork belly, shrimp, beef belly, and calamari (separate orders). The best items were definitely the flavorful, juicy, tender kalbi and the thinly sliced, melt-in-your-mouth beef brisket. These are the best items to order! Do not waste money on the seafood because it was only average. We will definitely be back!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jaye S.
review text:
I took my children here last night. When I dine out I look for a clean restaurant with great ambiance and excellent food. Gen in Rancho has a great ambiance. Low lighting. A fun, younger/youngish crowd and it appeared pretty clean. The wait was about 30 min on a Thursday night (we were quoted a 25-35 min wait). While waiting I went to use the restroom. The women's restroom only had 2 stalls so a line began to form.

The waiting area is small. Yes, we're in SoCal, but it was cool outside and I wasn't fond of sitting on top of other patrons.

Once we were finally seated, we were offered drinks. We were told two waiters would be serving us. Shortly after, a larger party was seated next to us. Their drinks and meats came quickly, much more quickly before ours did. I thought It was a fluke at first but it kept happening. To add insult to injury, some of of the "marinated" meats were bland. Although the waiters knew my party hadn't eaten there before, they didn't bother helping us with the cooking aspect of the meat. I had to peek at other tables.

I finally asked for the manager and after 15 minutes she came. I let her know that I traveled 40 mins to eat there when I have places closer to my home because my friend gave Gen a good recommendation. She empathized with me, comped 2 of the 3 meals and I left hungry. Never again will I visit Gen in Rancho. The manager was wonderful but I shouldn't have to complain when eating out. They should know better.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Isaura R.
review text:
I love this place !!!!!!!!! Just thinking about it, makes my mouth water! The food is delicious, the waiters are great. The one variable that affects the equation of greatness is ... the long wait time! Almost every single time we've visited this place, we've had to wait a really long time, 45mins+. I hear that the wait time is not as bad for lunch hours ..
Any who, if you want bomb KBBQ in the Inland Empire, this is your place.

If only Korean Town was just around the corner, but since it's not, this joint suffices any and all KBBQ cravings.

address:
