11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Charlene C.
review text:
Since my parents babysat two of our dogs on New Year's Eve, my husband and I took them here for lunch on January 2nd. We got there right at 11:00AM when they open. Originally the hostess told us it would be a 10 minute wait for a table, but they sat us within a few minutes.

The price was $14.99 per person during lunch (weekdays) which is really good! I'm used to going to other AYCE KBBQ places that usually charge around $20/person for lunch. (It's $19.99 for dinner and during weekends.) As others have mention, they totally have the "club" feel inside and were playing great music. My mom recognized one of the songs, "oh this is from The Hunger Games: Mocking Jay" soundtrack." LOL.

After we sat down, our server Raymond introduced himself to us. We all got the spicy tofu soup to start. You can only put in 4 orders of meat per round. We tried the Beef Bulgogi, Hawaiian Steak, Chadol, Miso Samgyubsal, Soondooboo, Calamari Steak, Shrimp, Gobchang, Jap Chae, and Nook Gan Sal.

My favorite so far is the Hawaiian Steak. My dad got the small pig intestine and he was the only one who liked it.. HAHA. It's just too chewy for the rest of us.

During our meal, we were helped by 4 different servers! One even helped cut up the meat for us and gave us tips on the best way to cook each meat. Wow, I must say... they are really on their game! They were constantly taking away used plates, refilling our hot teas, changing out our grill, and checking up on us. There are staff here from the Torrance restaurant helping out since they just barely opened. The manager also stopped by our table and he said he was the manager at the Torrance one as well.

On the way out, we tried two of their Brick Macaron Ice Cream Sandwiches (cappuccino and strawberry). They are $3.25 each.

We are so glad we finally have a Korean BBQ in Rancho Cucamonga. We will definitely be back again..... and again....  :)

2/100 Reviews for 2015

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christina T.
review text:
Servers were kind, but wished that the restaurant was more honest about their "sesame" oil at this location. We clearly saw that the color of the "sesame" oil didn't look right, and when we tasted it, it was bland and we KNOW it's vegetable oil because a server DID CONFIRM that they ran out of sesame oil so they gave us vegetable oil.

Anyone who cooks KNOWS, this does not look nor taste like sesame oil. Anyone who's ever eaten kbbq knows this doesn't look nor taste like sesame oil.

That's extremely condescending and disappointing trying to deceive your customers by giving us vegetable oil instead of sesame oil. Where's the integrity?

We ordered soju as well to sip on while enjoying our food-which never came out. Not sure what's going on with the restaurant, but this is really disappointing.

On the bright side, the vegetable oil was used up to oil the grill before cooking meat etc.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Yela J.
review text:
So disappointed with this place! The first time I was here, I found a big hairy moth in my salad, so I vowed to never come back. (Especially because they still made us pay for our food.) I wish I took a picture of it, but the server took it away before I got the chance to...Then recently, my friend begged me to give this place another chance. But sadly, my opinions still haven't changed!

First, they don't let you order more than one order of meat-dish. We had four people, but we weren't allowed to order 3 plates of beef brisket. We had to wait and keep ordering it one at a time. But towards the end, they brought us 2 plates of beef brisket that we didn't even order, so that was a little weird. Second, the meat quality is really whatever. I know this is AYCE, but I've tried other AYCE places that were way better. Third, the ventilation is really bad here. The smoke kept blowing into our faces while we were cooking, so our eyes really hurt! We asked if they could do anything about it, but they just switched the cooking plate - which didn't really help. Fourth, the pork belly smelled and tasted funky. Maybe it was just me. But we ordered the miso pork belly. It was super salty and had a weird smell to it. Didn't seem fresh at all.

I really tried to like this place, but I just can't. I really don't know what the hype is all about!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sawyeh S.
review text:
Kevin (#hipsterkevin) is a total sweetheart and so is #Paulogen. Managment should reward this guys. It looks like alot of work to be a server here and they were always on top of their game.
And shout out to Gene! This wasnt his section and he still brought out me and my friend's food!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dipesh A.
review text: Something was off about this place today. They were out of hot sauce. What kind of Asian restaurant runs out of hot sauce on Friday evening. I had to use kimchi as hot sauce.  Not only that they were missing couple of things more. No dried shrimps in the spicy tofu soup and no cajun pork belly. Normally gen bbq never disappoints but this time it wasn't up to the mark.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Eliicia V.
review text: It was my first time here and I absolutely loved it. I like the setting, the decor, the servers, the food, the Macaroons, EVERYTHING. Our server stayed on top of everything, I don't know how many times he came to refill our drinks but his customer service skills were great! I tried all kinds of meat, and I loved the green tea macaroon. I'll definitely be back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Andy O.
review text: Great place to eat been here so many and the $16 all you can eat is so worth it please enjoy

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Joy C.
review text:
I am glad that Rancho has a KBBQ place. The service was impeccable. Nicole and Kelly were very attentive. Come to think about it every single team member was amazing. They were on point with the banchan refills and the grill change. The free refills on coke was a bonus.

Must order: pork cheek, Hawaiian steak, garlic chicken (with its own fondue sauce YUMMO).

The service, team work, and work flow was very EFFECTIVE!! Two thumbs up for Nicole, Kelly, and Jesse!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mario L.
review text: Great place, I did learn to have a reservation on Fridays and Saturday nights at this place. I had to wait 45min to get seated on a Saturday night. It was well worth it though our server was great. The price is well worth it, this place is good for kids with patience since you do have to cook your food.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Helen Y.
review text:
I ate at the location in Santa Ana when I was first introduced to Gen. back then, there was only about 3 locations? Now they've expanded everywhere!! Torrance, Cerritos, Rancho, you name it!!

20.99 all you can eat with a huge selection you can choose from. You always have to order the brisket lol, that is a staple Korean BBQ meat. They also have kalbi, and bulgogi. More variety includes intestines, beef tongue, shrimp, squid steak (surprisingly really good, give it a try), etc.

I personally like their Hawaiian steak, beef belly, pork cheeks, and kalbi fingerlings.

Service here was great!!! We ordered and in a blink of an eye, our meat was at our table. We always have full plates of sides and salads which is great because I can concentrate on stuffing my face than ask for more sides lol.

Great service, great food and great vibe! Our server was Sandra and she did an excellent job of taking care of us.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Abdulrahman A.
review text:
It is my first experience in this place. Very clean and the quality of food is the top. Jerry helped me to prepare the food and provided us with helpful info., tips and how to make the best tasty meat.
This is must go experience and ask for Jerry. Everybody there are friendly and nice .

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Annie T.
review text:
Cost and food: 4.5 stars, Kbbq ayce common price $19.99 I was impressed. I loved everything except the size of the table. The table was too small for all the yummy side dishes and tasty meats. The brisket, bulgogi, pork belly, pork cheek, tofu soup, salad, kimchi, other sides all tasted better than I expected and better than many other ayce kbbq places. We did buy three (strawberry, vanilla, and green tea) macaroon ice cream after our meal for $3.25 each and these were (pricey but) so good too. Just waiting for their liquor license.
Service: 5 stars, very nice and attentive, refilled drinks and sides often
Atmosphere: 5 stars, open, clean, and good music (I even felt comfortable having my chatty 2 year old there and not worried about him being too loud to neighboring tables)

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Uyen L.
review text:
This restaurant was huge which meant a lot of seatings and the wait isn't too bad. My friends and I came here for a birthday and we were seated instantly (probably because it was only a party of 4). Our hostess was extremely attentive and made some good recommendations on how to cook the intestines if we were going to order them.

At our table were side dishes & a huge bowl of house salad. Our waitress, Loren was super friendly and was constantly asking us if we needed any refills or anymore orders. For our first round, we ordered: spicy pork bulgogi, spicy pork belly, large intestines, & beef bulgogi. The food came out quickly & it didn't take long before we demolish all of our meat! My personal favorite was the spicy beef bulgogi & the spicy pork belly for round 1. While the intestine were crispy, it wasn't much of anything to me and it took a bit too long to cook. The beef bulgogi was also good, however, I did not enjoy the sweetness to it as much. I mean it was still pretty bomb!

For our second round, we ordered: garlic pork belly, regular pork belly, kalbi short ribs, chicken bulgogi, & some glass noodles w/ vegetables. Once again, all the meats were delicious. I liked the original pork belly a lot better than the garlic pork belly. However, my housemates seem to enjoyed the garlic pork belly a lot more. It all comes down to reference! I like my pork belly cooked w/ a sprinkle of salt, that's why I prefer the original one. However, I do like the spicy pork belly more than the original. But like I said, it's really your personal preference! The glass noodles was a bit TOO chewy for my liking.  

For our third and last round, we had more spicy pork bulgogi, pork belly, spicy rice cakes, & this time we tried the small intestines. I wasn't a fan of the small intestines since it had a bitter taste to it and it was super chewy. I really like the spicy rice cakes since it was all fried and chewy but I could use it without the sauce.

Since it was my friends birthday, the waiters/waitress came to sing her a song & gave her some pineapples while they held up a match so she can blow it out. It was awesome, ghetto, & hilarious @ the same time!

Overall I would give this place a 4/5 stars because the food was delicious & the service was friendly! However, the portions of the meat were little & only fed up to 2 people. So if you had a party of 2+ you would have to order double & it is only recommended that you order 4 dishes per round! Also, it was only $19.99 per person for dinner & they had such a large meau compare to other AYCE Korean BBQ, it was def worth it!

I would definitely come back next time ;)

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jessy M.
review text:
Love this place! Before I came here the first time, I was convinced I hated Korean BBQ, but this place completely changed my mind (I'm pretty sure I was doing it wrong). Being here the second time, I gotta say it was not just the food, the service is impeccable.

Even the hosts are professional. Sean, who seated us was incredibly helpful and funny, as we sat down he kept it light and offered plenty of information while having us ready quickly before our servers arrived. He also presented himself very professionally and projected his voice so we were able to hear him through the entryway crowd.

Francis and Alice were our servers. Francis spoke very eloquently and was easy to understand, communicating the menu impressively with plenty of suggestions. Alice brought out our meats quickly and it was quite impressive, as a couple of times we ordered some fried items.

I will also include a massively impressive side note: we were sitting near a couple of older ladies who seem to have never been here before and had several questions regarding the menu. As our servers in the area were able to maintain attentively to existing customers, the manager came right over to tend to them.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Melissa R.
review text:
I dined at Gen last night for the first time, and I feel ashamed to say that I went in with reservations about eating "nothing but meat." Thankfully, I was wrong to have these reservations.  While I had eaten Korean BBQ once before, for some reason I had forgotten how delicious it is and that you can have more than just meats.  

Following are some tips for first-time visitors:
-Make sure your whole party is there by the time they call your name because you will not be seated until everyone is present.
-You can wait at the bar, but let the person who took your name down where you will be.
-It's "all you can eat," so do not be afraid to try anything! Have an open mind, and when in doubt, dip your meats in the sauces provided!
-If you drink alcohol, try the yogurt soju!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sophia Z.
review text:
Never let me down!

I come here often with my bf and im always satisfied with the food and service!
We came recently and our server Marc was AMAZING, he kept checking on us frequently making sure we had everything we needed! He has been the best server we have had yet. (:

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Priscilla C.
review text:
After a 12 hour shift I battle a 30 minute wait (not too bad) to satisfy my cravings. But tonight has to be the worst service I've ever received and not by any means the fault of our server (Tommy)  but instead his team. After our first round, Ashley, whom took our drink orders still hasn't brought us our water. Our grill burned after the first round and bussers have been dropping off and taking away dishes only to leave the empty grill burning.; sucks for the person who has to clean this in the back. My banchan is gone and all of Tom's help including his trainee is passing us by. But here comes a collared shirt manager to somewhat save the day and get things going. Too late though, my patience has gone as has my appetite.

Oops 5 minutes later someone pokes a tray of drinks next to our table and splashes me.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Joven S.
review text:
I've been to a few all you can eat Korean BBQ restaurants and Gen's was one of the better ones. Came here with my wife while visiting my cousin and on our way back from Palm Springs.

First thing, the restaurant looked new and was very clean. The staff and servers were all friendly, and very attentive. We ate here during lunch, so there were a few items that were on the menu that were not available as they were only served during dinner (such as the bone in short rib), but that wasn't a big deal. The menu still had a good selections of meats and seafood. The food was excellent and tasted great! If you've never been to an all you can eat Korean BBQ restaurant, please be advised that you cook your own food.

The only complaint I have, and a minor complaint at that, is the servers forgot some of our orders and at one point brought over food we didn't even order. Other than that, I recommend giving this place a try, the food is great!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: 小花 V.
review text:
We were 6 and asked for 2 grill table since we have a lunch time limit. They asked us to wait 10-15 minutes to sit us. But I'm posting pictures of how empty the place was. And then they sit us at 2 different tables when there are tables together that have 2 grills. Does it even make sense? Calling out the host name: Mariella

Everytime we come here, meat is also brought every 30 minutes, and another 10 minutes to wait for the check. Service is as bad as it can be.

Meat is not the best quality but out of options in Rancho/Ontario area. The side dishes are sometimes foul smelling.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: H G.
review text:
Not that this place is in need of anymore 5 star reviews, but I felt they absolutely deserve one more.
*exceptional service
*delicious and flavorful food
*flavors on point with every dish
*fun trendy ambiance
*reasonable prices
*I repeat: delicious and flavorful food!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Linda G.
review text: Fun time with family trying out lots of different meats. The only thing that we tried and didn't like was the intestine, but maybe we overcooked it because it was super chewy and unpleasant. Great service and surprisingly for a Sunday afternoon it wasn't super crowded. We waited about 20 minutes to be seated. I'm sure we'll be going back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Laura W.
review text:
Love the $15.99 AYCE lunch special. Our favorite meats are the pork belly, beef brisket and pork jowel....but we also had the beef and pork bulgogi which are tasty. Side dishes are awesome. Come hungry because everything is so delicious....you won't want to stop eating!!!!!  

Service was good. Air ventilation system was pretty decent, but I still smelled like Korean bbq after I left.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sam L.
review text:
Having been to the Gen KBBQ before, I was looking forward to coming to this location for dinner. However, this visit was not what I was expecting.

I walked to check-in and the greeter was talking to a server and didn't even acknowledge me until after they were done with their conversation. Then, when the hostess, Michelle, called us over to guide us to our table, she didn't even introduce herself and walked so far ahead I wasn't sure if I was suppose to follow her. Next, I had to request for clean plates because the ones that were provided had stains on them and were so dirty. The waitress (didn't catch her name) even had the audacity to check the plates and try to scrape off the stain before agreeing to bring us another one. The utensils definitely had to be wiped down before using too. To top it off, my salad had a piece of foil!  This was so awful! Upon looking around, I even noticed a lot of workers just hanging out by the bar.

A little after, our experience turned around thanks to two different servers, Alan and Billie, who provided excellent service getting our order out to us promptly.

Food: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Cleanliness: 1/5

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Cam C.
review text:
This place is different worth the wait. The interior décor reminds you of a club, but the quality of service & food is reminiscent of a top notch restaurant.

We made a reservation for 6 people and asked for 2 grills and they delivered. We were seated in the back corner in a timely manner and even though they were short staffed and one of the dish washing machines broke, the servers were on point. It took them some time to bring out our 2 sodas, and they ended up providing it free of charge due to the delay.

The meat quality here just seems so much better than the one in Tustin and even some other Korea AYCE spots in OC and LA. We even love their seafood more.

Can't wait to come back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Wendy L.
review text:
After a year and a couple visits, I've waited to review Gen Korean BBQ House. Gen has several locations in Southern California and offers a good selection of meats to grill at your table.

LOCATION / PARKING
You'll find this Gen on Foothill Blvd, just west of Victoria Gardens. It shares the same lot as Wabi Sabi Steak House & Sushi Bar. It's always hard to find parking in the area so prepare to easily find a spot further from the restaurant.

WAIT TIME
My first visit here was for a birthday so we had a good amount of tables reserved for us on the upper level with zero wait time! We literally walked in and told them we had reservations, and we walked right up to our reserved area---and our entire party wasn't there yet! Second visit was a little longer for myself and one other person. Third visit was no more than 15 minutes! All times I've visited were during dinner hours.

AMBIENCE / ATMOSPHERE
If you're looking for a loud, club-like feel for dinner, then Gen KBBQ will deliver! The bright neon lights make for a fun and lively atmosphere on the main, lower level. While still loud, the upper level seating provides less lighting--although you still see some of the lights coming through from below. This is not the place for a quiet evening!

FOOD / PRICE
For the quality of food offered, the price is great. Some meats come out plain while some are marinated. My favorite are the spicy ones. Also, this is a place where you'll have to cook your own food. You choose which meats you like (about 3-4 items at a time) and a server will bring them out to you (raw) to cook on the grill. They will not cook it for you so, if you don't feel like grilling your own meal, Gen may not be where you want to go.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
We had excellent service on our first visit at the upper level. Someone kept changing out our grill, refilling our drinks, and asking if we needed anything else. My second visit here was horrible. We had seats in the lower corner and our orders were mixed up with 3 other tables! So the table next to us got our orders while we got the orders placed by the other table next to us. It was a mess between the 4 tables. When I came with a group of friends on my third visit and ended up sitting in the same lower corner, I was a bit apprehensive due to the prior visit. Fortunately, it actually was quite the opposite! The only thing I don't like about Gen is how the suited guys wearing the 2-way earpieces were rather boorish to the servers. I know they're there to help keep guests eating within a time frame (2 hours) but it's obvious their sense of authority goes a bit overboard. We witnessed one guy talking down to one of the servers like some jerk. So rude! I don't like seeing that while having dinner. Perhaps go to the back (away from customers) and talk to the server politely? Just a suggestion.

STROLLERS / WALKERS / WHEELCHAIRS
Personally, I wouldn't want to take young children or babies near KBBQ restaurants for safety measures. However, as far as space is concerned, they do have spacious aisles to move around for all strollers, walkers, and wheelchairs. I'm not sure there is elevator access to the upper level, however, as I only recall taking stairs to get up there.

Pros:
- Iced Green Tea is delicious!
- Price
- Food
- Modern, club-like atmosphere
- Spacious
- Upper level seating
- Grills are changed out often
- Ice Cream Macarons!!

Cons:
- Grill your own food
- You will smell like KBBQ (clothes, hair, skin!)
- Suited guys wearing ear-pieces
- Access to upper level
- Loud
- Parking
- Wait time
- Not for quick-dining

There are a few things to consider but, overall, Gen KBBQ's food ranks more superior than their inadequacy.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Amanda R.
review text: My hubby took me for the first time for my birthday. Food was amazing but our server Marc was beyond amazing.  I can honestly say he is the best server I have ever come across in my dinning years! I wouldn't ask for anyone else when I do return !!! Marc is amazing.  He definitely has got to be one of their best servers !!!! Asking to be seated with Marc will make every experience the best experience!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Araceli R.
review text:
Went there last night to celebrate my dad and sisters bday...we were a party of 13 and we all enjoyed it...

Our server was David (awesome guy) he really took care of us, it was everyone's 1st time there and he was more than helpful...he answered all of our questions and even made some meat suggestions that we all LOVED....& he was super funny...

I would totally recommend this place....great service great food, great ambiance...deff coming back!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jessica L.
review text:
THE ABSOLUTE BEST THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD
my first time having Korean BBQ and I am not disappointed one bit
Joshua the best waiter and thank you to the one person cleaning the tables that lighted the fire for us
I'm very impressed that the staff is friendly and fast

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: David G.
review text:
Oh Eric. Eric Eric Eric. It seems like anything in life that's too good to be true (like AYCE KBBQ for instance) has to come with a rotten egg. I'd been coming to this Gen since it opened a year ago, but the lousy service we received yesterday from you at the bar will make me think twice about coming back. Lesson learned: don't settle for bar seating.

Let me start out with the positives. I like Gen. I've been a regular for many years and have been to multiple locations, from Cerritos to Pasadena to the new one that opened up in Torrance recently. If you look at the glowing reviews for all of these locations, they usually share at least 4 stars or higher on Yelp. Why is that? It's easy: Gen has established a reputation for itself for delivering amazing KBBQ. I'd be kidding myself though if I gave credit solely to the food. It's the SERVICE that will make or break any experience, regardless of how good the food tastes. And quite frankly Eric, your service made the whole experience tasteless.

- For starters, we couldn't barbecue our food. Initially we just awkwardly stared for 5 minutes at the flaccid beef brisket you gave us as it lay motionless on the grill, waiting for it to sizzle. It never did. The grill you gave us didn't allow enough air circulation and suffocated whatever flame that was trying to spark. After hailing you several times, you finally changed the grill without an apology. Thanks. This is getting off to a great start.

- It took forever to get any service. Whereas the parties surrounding us were getting prompt grill changes and having their water refilled on the dot, your lack of service made us believe we were no where to be seen. We actually had to hail other waiters to get our meal moving along. Would it have been too much to ask for to replace our charcoal-stained grill? Oh wait, no, that would involve being proactive.

- Where was the check? We talked to another waiter serving us if we could have the bill, who then gestured to you while you were taking a sip of water at the bar to come over. I understand not to mistake neglect for being busy when it comes to waitering, but honestly it didn't seem like you were attending to anyone at that moment. And if you were, you didn't tell us--no apologizes, no explanation. Just the bill, 10 minutes later after the fact.

It's unfortunate this happened, because I honestly liked going here up until yesterday. It's not the end of the world though, my girlfriend and I will probably just go to another Gen that delivers the same respectful and amazing service that's been consistent with all the previous experiences I've had throughout the years. It won't be at this location though.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lillian C.
review text:
How do I even begin to describe a KBBQ place that has hawaiian steak with pineapple that melts in your mouth from its tender quality and explodes on your taste buds from its mindblowing flavor.

Gen has a wide variety of meats that you get 2 hours to consume. We went on New Year's Day, and the wait wasn't too bad considering it had just opened.

For a $15 lunch or $20 dinner, this is the best KBBQ joint I've ever been to. Thinking about it makes my mouth salivate and has made every other KBBQ place I've been to seem inadequate.

HIGHLY recommend Gen if you're craving some tender, premium meat!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christina H.
review text: First time here, came for dinner all you can eat. Excellent service, we had Josh and Santos as our servers, both were very helpful and friendly and gave great recommendations! The Pork Belly was amazing as well as the Shrimp! Very clean and fun environment, would recommend to anyone looking for great food and a new experience!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Skylar M.
review text:
A very uncomfortable experience this evening. Made a reservation for 50 about 2 mths. for a family reunion. Unfortunate timing of a heatwave this weekend made certain planned activities a little trying, but dinner should not be one of them.

The air conditioner had broke at Gen, according to one of the waiters a couple of days ago. The solution the general manager came up with was to bring in 2 portable AC units for each floor. Those units brought the bottom floor down to 84, & the top floor which we were on fluctuated between 87-89 degrees. If that AC unit had broken that day, it would be understandable but the fact that it had been broken, during a heat wave and our party was not informed is extremely rude. We should have been informed of the issue & then we could decide what we wanted to do.

I dealt with two floor managers, one manager had zero concept of customer service while the other floor manager Chris was very professional. I explained to him my frustration with the situation & he was very understanding to how uncomfortable my party was during dinner. He spoke with the general manager, which refused to come out of the office to deal with the situation. She offered little compensation for the issue. They took off $80 in alcohol charges & gave us 10 free macaroon ice creams for the kids. But our bill was over a $1000 while we had to sweat while we ate! With a party of 50 very difficult to just get up and leave.

The last straw was when we were informed the reason the AC unit will not be fixed until Monday was because corporate would not authorize the budget to get someone out in an emergency. The solution for corporate was to allow their employees to suffer in long sleeve black shirts, while its 90 degrees in the restaurant, all so they can save some $$$. I will never eat there again, the way this corporation treats their customers & employees is unacceptable. U-grill is right down the street & they have very good food!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sinh V.
review text:
Hands down THEEEE BEST Korean BBQ joint I've been to.....ever! I'm from Sacramento and the Korean BBQ joints in my town pale in comparison to this place. I wanted to come here after seeing all the rave reviews on Yelp, and I'm so glad I did!! I came here for the AYCE dinner after work with 4 of my coworkers. Most of them have never tried Korean BBQ and they all said they loved it!!

The dinner was $19.95/person and there were tons....and I mean TONSSSS of meat choices. What a steal!!! We had several different types of steak, pork belly, short ribs, shrimp, calamari, etc.etc. The jap chae was really good along with all the banchan. We were soooo full and I had every intention of trying the macaron ice cream before we came, but I couldn't. At that moment, I literally wished I had an extra stomach just so i'd be able to try everything.  Oh sweet, sweet gluttony!

Although service was kinda slow, I loved the trendy atmosphere, lighting, and decor. Overall, it was a great experience. The next time I'm in Rancho Cucamonga, I'll definitely be coming back here.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: RJ W.
review text:
I happen to be in the are for a campus tour. Unknowing to me almost every place on Loma linda is vegan. That was not got to work.

So let's get to it!

THE BAD
I had to wait 10 minutes for a one person table. And thats not even a complaint. I just could not find anything bad.

THE FANTASTIC.
The amount of options to pick is over 30. All you can sample for 19.99 for dinner. That is crazy. I made half orders so I could try more stuff. I think I did half the menu. Nothing was bad. It was better and best.

The icing on the cake was the wait staff. It was some of the best service I have had in any restaurant. Between suggestions, to grill changes, to how fast they got the proteins out to me was awesome. Trina and her tag team partner paulo!

ETC
if you want quiet you will not be happy. Loud music rocking out with a very fun vibe. Just loud enough it's perfect first date stuff. If I am ever back in the area I will come again for sure!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Bernardo M.
review text:
Let me start by saying that the food here is amazing! The tri-tip and the brisket are out of this world good! We never walk out of here disappointed...we do walk out about two, maybe three pounds heavier though. Gen has a very sophisticated ambience in my opinion. Its definitely one of the nicer Korean BBQ restaurants that I've been to. We always ask to be seated in Steve's section. He's very down to earth and is always on top of his tables.

Now the reasons for the 4 star rating instead of 5: we've been here a handful of times and sometimes run into bad service. I understand that this place gets crowded, and the servers get slammed, but on occasion we'll be waiting several minutes for someone to take our order or even change up our grill.

Second, they treat their dipping sauces like gold here. My gf and I are constant dippers. We dip like its our last day on earth. We always have to ask several times for them to refill our trays, and every single time they fill it with the same small amount. But eh, that's no biggie.
Lastly, it seems like everyone in town comes here for their birthday. The servers have a way of singing happy birthday that I actually think is quite funny. They don't just sing it to you, they straight yell in your face. BUT, last night they did that eight times...and of course all of those tables were right around us, that's a lot of screaming. I know I can't blame the staff for this one, its not their fault that everyone wants to come here on their birthday.

I was there with my gf and thought it would be funny to tell the staff that it was her birthday too. She was so annoyed with all the singing/yelling that I just had to do it. Boy did that backfire on me! Thankfully all of our dogs our indoor dogs, because if they were outdoor dogs and had dog houses I would of definitely been sleeping in one of them last night.

Gen, you guys are awesome and we love your food! I'm taking my parents this weekend, so be prepared to sing for my mom...even though her birthday is in December.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lalaine D.
review text:
Decided to try this place before I start my long drive home. I  wanted a good meal before I hit the road, just hope I don't put myself into a food coma.  Favorites: Hawaiian sreak, fried calamari, pork and meat bulgogi.   garlic chichen was good too but really liked the steak.

Since lighting is minimal, good to cook all meats to a nice char, not burn... to ensure its cooked..  Also adds to the flavor.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Tam M.
review text:
My husband and I made the 43 mile trek from our home to Rancho last night for dinner with friends. I had no idea that not a single person in our group had ever eaten Korean BBQ (I forget it's not a regular thing for most black folks). This is the second GEN I've been to and it seems the decor is the same. It looks like a giant nightclub with music pumping in and loud conversations all over the room.

The first 15-20 minutes were a little sketchy because they sat our party waaaaaay in the back corner and little did we know, it was our waiter's first night on shift. I think his name was Xavier? Josh, the manager on duty did an amazing job making up for miscellaneous seating issues, slow or wrong drink orders and my broken chair (on of the legs just gave way...Lol my friends were mad that I didn't fall out on the floor lookin for a come up).

The food was amazing as I expected it to be and we all ate ourselves silly. Josh comped us 2 big bottles of Soju cocktails for the whole group (11 to be exact). Must try the "Hello Kitty" - its strawberry and yogurt flavor. Sooooo good!! I can't wait to go back, just to the one by my house in Cerritos instead!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Thuong T.
review text:
I am a huge fan of Gen Korean BBQ House, but it was my first time at this specific location.
They have about 7 locations total, by the way. I usually go to the ones in orange county.

PROS:
1. Plentiful of parking spaces
2. Nice shaded waiting area outside with seating
3. There was only about a 15 minute wait
4. Doesn't get too crowded on the weekends
5. They have a really cool upstairs dining area
6. The food quality is good

CONS:
1. For some odd reason, the person at the front desk did not write down the correct name for our table, so we waited a bit extra
2. Our waiter, Kevin, was very slow, he literally only came to our table once the whole time we were there. We kept having to look around for servers to flag down.
3. We were told that they were receiving a shipment of rice paper as soon as we sat down, but that supposedly never came, which sucks because we LOVE rice paper with our kbbq.
4. They gave very small portions of side dishes, so we had to keep asking for more.

Overall, the food is still good, but it takes forever just to order anything because the servers here do not frequently check up on you. They need to work on their customer service because it felt like they were understaffed and the servers were trying to avoid contact with the tables.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Juliet G.
review text: There's nothing like Korean BBQ marinade to bring flavor to a meal. This place is the perfect combination of sweet, savory and spicy... not only is the food very flavorful... service is great as well,,, go to the Rancho Cucamanga location and ask for DAVID!!! He's a wonderful host !!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mayra S.
review text:
First time at this Gen, the meat quality and sides like japchae and tofu stew are amamzing. But honestly it's the service that blew me away. They were super attentive bring our orders, refilling our cups, getting things out of the way and changing our grill before we asked.
Celebrated my birthday and it was AMAZING! We couldn't have asked for a better server than Tommy, thank you so much!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Carol R.
review text: Wow!  What an amazing customer service from Jay and  Santos. Food 5 drinks 5 . Absolutely amazing and very satisfied.  Make sure you order the calamari fritis.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sam C.
review text:
The food here is gold until a bug falls on your plate from the vent above your table.

Eating here on 7/20/2015 and as i was cutting a piece of meat over the grill, a very large bug fell from the ceiling vent o to my arm and then my plate. Not only did i let them know right away. The server looked at bug and said "i'll take care of that right away" and walked away for about 5 minutes and left the plate with the bug on it at my table... So i asked for the manager. She came over and was very polite and left the table, not only to return seconds later because she left the bug on our tale as well. And left us there waiting for the check for another 10/15 minutes.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Kaylee G.
review text: David was amazing!!!! It was our first time here and he really explained the process and helped cook our food and make sure everything tasted great! The food came out super fast and David made sure to check back in on us and make sure our food was cooked properly and our drinks were constantly refilled. All of the food tasted amazing but our favorite by far was the Hawaiian steak!! Sooo Yummy!! The managers were all super sweet and so was the girl helping David (I didn't catch her name!) Overall our first experience here was wonderful and we will definitely be back!! Ask for David!! He makes the experience so much better!! Thanks David we appreciate all you did for us!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Paul P.
review text:
Wow! If you like meat this is your place. Family birthday dinner when the first plates of meat came to our table oh no this is not enough food for 6 people wrong!. You get to order 8 meats for the two grills we had, after that they bring what you want  

Calamari steak. Hawaiian steak fantastic, Beef Bulgogi , Chicken and Korean Short Ribs first round. Follow by Smoke Garlic Pork Belly. Premium Chadol ( brisket ) Joomulluk, Prime Steak and just to much meat to talk about all great and lots of fun grilling your own.

Come early this place gets busy fast our service was good when our server was busy I just ask another to keep bringing the meat all about the meat. Don't ask for a knife they don't have one that is why you have scissors. Can't wait to go back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jill V.
review text: Had a great experience last night. We Had reservations at 6:30 for six guests and were seated by 6:30. The restaurant was packed but The staff was excellent and very professional, food was delicious.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Becky M.
review text: Great Korean BBQ!!!  Hawaiian Steak, Beef Bulgogi, Garlic Chicken , Spicy Chicken and the Galbi were our choices for the lunch buffett!!!  Salad and rice were included!!!!  Our service was great and they were patient with all of our questions.  Very Yummy!!!  We will come again!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Courtney V.
review text: Came here for my best friends birthday ! Got seated within 5 minutes and got sat in Ty 's section . By far the BEST waitress by far we've ever experienced. Ty went above and beyond with everything she did for our birthday experience today ! Get it girl !! (:

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Kathleene E.
review text:
This is the 2nd Gen I've visited - the first one being in Alhambra. We were in town the same weekend as Hard Summer and wanted to get our KBBQ So.Cal style fix before we headed back to the Bay. We were super close to this location, and the reviews were great so we figured why not! It was also a plus that they opened at 11am for lunch.

The location itself is within a plaza with very spacious parking. We got there around 1055am and there were literally 3-5 parties waiting to go inside. I had an inkling that they went to the music festival too B) We were seated immediately and we could see they were going to be very busy very quickly, and that they were. Phung, our server was very well-mannered at tried his best to serve us as quickly as possible. The boyfriend and I saw that he was slammed with more than 5 parties in his area so we're not knocking down any starts due to the (slow, but not as fast as it could've been) customer service.

The lunch price CANNOT be beat - $15.00 for AYCE KBBQ! My favorites were the beef bulgogi, short ribs, pineapple steak, angus beef, calamari and shrimp! Among the banchan, all the kimchi dishes were delish but my favorite was the mashed potatoes. Also, don't forget to order the seasonings on the side to give your meal a little bit more pizzazz (you'll see they're listed on the very bottom of the menu upon request only)

They changed the grill pretty often and the ventilation was very good, we didn't reek too much of KBBQ (which is to be expected when you dine at places like this). By the time we were finished with our meal (12:30 pm) the house was already packed and the wait was RIDICULOUS!

My tips - go here early, and expect a wait if you come in an hour or so after opening time.
Don't go for the macaroon ice cream sandwich ($3.50) - it's overpriced for this dinky little ice cream thing that's pretty flavorless. Other than that, everything was great. I definitely will be back!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Diem D.
review text:
I can't make my mind whether I like this place or not. Out of all the choices I had, I only liked the prime steak and shrimp. I came during lunch, so price was fairly cheap only 15$. This restaurant opened a little later; at 11am. I got inside at 12, and half of the restaurant was filled. I had a party of 6 and we were sat fairly quick. They sat all of us on tables where 6 people shared one grill. ONLY ONE.

Anyways, thats not why I'm indecisive about this place... The service was so slow. And the amount served for 6 people were so skimpy... Why you may ask? We got to chose 3 plates of whatever on the menu, after waitress brought it out we finished in seconds (yes we were hungry pigs). So we ordered more, and waited for 10/15 mins for it. I'm not sure why it took so long, but all the wait made me full. In the end, that cheap price ended up not being cheap at all. Probably better for 2 people in my opinion...

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Victoria M.
review text: Pretty tasty BBQ items.  Service was quick and decor was modern and music was upbeat.  Almost thought I was at a club.  Price was comparable to other Korean BBQ joints,     would definitely come back for more whenever  I'm in the areas and have an hankering for Korean grub.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Panda P.
review text:
Reasons:
1.sticky floor when you walk in.
2. Slow services.
3. Our clean glasses was put together with dirty dishes when we asked for refills.
4. After refill was given a dirty glass as my glass.
5. Our orders keep getting lost and have to be track down.
6. It's really hard to find the wait staff.
7. I had to stare at the grill for a long time because there was no meat.... it made me sad since it kbbq....

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jerry L.
review text:
I have been to GEN for nearly 20 times. I started to go there since its opening. Once I went to GEN three times in a week. Haha

waiting: GEN takes reservation for party one day in prior. Usually in weekdays, the waiting is about 5-10 minutes. But in weekend, the waiting is like longer than 40 minutes. Anyway, it's worthy to wait.

Price: the menu is affordable. For lunch on weekday is 15.99?? Dinner and weekends are 19.99.

Appetizers: they provides a variety of Korean appetizers for free. The kimchi is excellent. For me, the potatoes and salad are my favorite. They have special sauce for salad, which makes it tastes good.
 
Food : I have been to gen many times that I don't even need a menu. People usually order prime steak, the beef slice, beef tongue and beef brisket.  I always order pork cheek, regular pork belly, popcorn chicken and tofu soup. Usually I will warp the meat with the rice paper. I enjoy eating both meat and rice paper together.  The tofu in the tofu soup is soft, Although a little bit spicy.

Desert. They have macaron. Usually I can't eat macaron cuz I'm full:)

Service. The restaurant hires young adult, which makes their staffs energetic. In special occasions like birthday party, they will sing you a song. (They are sooooooooo loud that everyone in the restaurant will know that it's your birthday.)

Anyway, for health concern, eat more salad when you are eating meat. After the meal, people will usually smell like Korean bbq.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Rebecca D.
review text:
What a wonderful experience!!

Me and my boyfriend had our first adventure with Korean BBQ here tonight. We had no idea what we were doing. We were happy to find that it was $20/person for all you can eat dinner. Wow what a deal! We were told that we could pick 4 items at a time. We were not sure how to cook any of the meat and luckily Danny P came by our table and kindly asked us "can I help you with your meat?" He gave us numerous tips!! We were so thankful. Everything was delicious. Danny stopped by again later and we asked about the ice cream sandwiches. He helped us out with those too! He said the desserts are normally bought on the way out at the counter but he brought them to our table! We have never had such excellent customer service before!! We are coming back with our friends and family to show them how great the food and service is!

Thanks for everything Danny P!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brian F.
review text: Here for the first time with my baby! Never been before and well worth the trip! Cooking together such a great experience!! Jen our waitress was excellent and took very good care of us!! A must try for everyone!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Heather M.
review text:
I have been to the Gen in Tustin. I was excited to see that this location is significantly bigger and more accommodating.

The environment is really cool. Spacious seating. Booths and bar style seating. You're able to cook your own food which is super fun for friends or going on a date.

Unfortunately the dish they were out of is my absolute favorite (Hawaiian steak). We had the brisket, Cajun shrimp, garlic chicken, top sirloin and the veggie plate.

We had two glasses of Chardonnay. One was delivered really get with our food the other took some time.

I love the food and the environment that's why I keep coming back. Perhaps it was the luck of the draw and the service will be better next time. Overall satisfaction gets 4 stars. The first server we had was fabulous and when our second server came back from his break it was a feeling of wanting to close and we were an inconvenience. (They close at 11:30 and we were there till 10:45)

I would completely recommend Gen to anyone. Servers change but the food, vibe, and drinks are constant! Total win in my book to go back!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Aileen E.
review text:
Hands down, this has to be some of the BEST Korean BBQ I've ever had. Came on a Saturday evening with a 1 1/2 hour wait.  I normally don't have the patience to wait this long to sit at a restaurant but I'd been craving KBBQ all day and if we had to wait 1 1/2 hours, then we had to wait 1 1/2 hours.  It ended up being an hour wait by the time we were seated.

AYCE is $20 per person and there is quite a bit of selection when it comes to meats. Honestly, I can't really remember the specific meats we had as it's been a few weeks since I've eaten there.  I remember everything being delicious.

Once you're seated at your table, your side dishes are waiting for you, and each person is given their own side dishes (4-5) so you don't have to share.  I remember the mashed potatoes.  I want more of those mashed potatoes.  They were sweet, with little bits of corn & carrots.  

Hands down, food is easily 5 stars for this place, but I'm knocking a star down because of service.  Our server was really nice, but they just seemed to be understaffed when we went.  It took awhile to receive our drinks.  We got our 1st round of meats before we even received our drinks.  Rice here doesn't seem to be a given.  We had to ask for that, and that even took awhile to get.  We asked for more radish and rice paper. That never came.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Hennessy B.
review text: My husband and I went for a date night. I was online looking in the Rancho Cucamonga  area and Asian food of course and I came across this on yelp. I read the reviews and saw pictures and immediately I was drawn to this restaurant. The food was so fresh and delicious. My husband really enjoyed it. One thing I would say is that our waiter was not as attentive as others that I saw. Kept forgetting things we asked for but thankfully the other waiters were coming to our table and brought what we asked. Overall we loved it and would love to go back and get a different server. Lol

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Joanne C.
review text: Food was delicious & staff were awesome. Had great customer service especially to our waiter #BBQBOYGEN.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Renee O.
review text: On Tuesday (9-19-2017) My sister an I were in Rancho Cucamonga looking for a place to have  lunch when we came across GEN Korean barbecue house. Neither of us had ever eaten at a place like this (where you cook your own food.) not really knowing how it all works our waiter Francis was very very helpful... explained everything to us and offered to give us popular foods ideas... which we ordered. ... not only was the food extremely delicious Francis and his assistant manager Adam were very attentive to our table making sure we had everything we needed. Like if we wanted more  food..making sure drinks were always full and just general conversation...It was a very fun and delicious experience. The service was superb! The Hawaiian Steak and Garlic Chicken were the Bomb! And Francis rocked!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Justin L.
review text: Gen KBBQ is one of the best kbbq places I have been to! The only thing is the service isn't that great. Other than that, I have no other complains. The food is great and they play music that livens up the environment! I think the price is like any other kbbq place.. about $15 for lunch and $20 for dinner. I would recommend trying Gen if you haven't already!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Terr M.
review text: My 2-star rating purely goes to the type of service delivered to the recent visit we made. First, we arranged for birthday greeting from the attending person who helped us seated but we already finished our dinner and no staff showed up to sing. We again tried to ask another staff yet nothing happened. Secondly, we ordered the meats & seafoods & twice they served the wrong ones. And lastly, I approached the manager discreetly & handed over my card in the middle of our stay so that I did not have to struggle with my group for the bill but when I one of my friends asked for the check the waiter came with 2 receipts one on me & another one generated :/ It did show how poorly the staff corresponded to each other in order to provide a satisfying service to customers. I understood their "busyness" but other branches of Gen had the same volume of customers & yet they still did their work timely & correctly. Hope this brach improve in this area because a business is always streghtened by the quality not by quantity.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brittney S.
review text: Loved the atmosphere of this place. We came on a Friday night and waited about 20 minutes which wasn't too bad. Jen &Alexis were our servers. They were both so sweet and attentive. Never once did we have to track them down. They made sure that we always had drinks and were ready for each order for the next round as we did all you can eat. This really surprised me because of how busy the restaurant. The all you can eat was $20.99 for dinner. Worth it for the amount of food you get. Thank you Jen & Alexis for the amazing customer service!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Maritza H.
review text:
Will never return! Expect to wait forever to be served and only to be told that they're out of everything you ordered! How can they be sold out of eggs and beef on a Wednesday evening? This place really needs to get it together. 20 minutes to be told that they have to run across the street to buy more eggs.

Meats are not fresh and served rock frozen and super salty once they finally melt and get cooked.

The salt is so old in the little dipping dishes that is rock hard and cant be used for the meats! Disgusting.

Garlic and jalapeños come minced by a broken food processor.
Clearly this place is not aiming for quality.
The kitchen staff must be made up of one-handed blind folded Neanderthals.

The servers have tablets to take orders but they forget to bring you the food. What is the point of all you can eat if you don't get any food?

We ordered one of the pork dishes and got enough for 2 bites, then we ordered chicken and they brought a gigantic plate...
Talk about looking to fill up the customers on the cheapest meats.

Bad service, bad taste and bad quality.
Don't judge Korean BBQ based on this place!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Todd N.
review text:
An AYCE place in the IE??? Yum!!!! I recently moved out here from the DTLA area, so I was craving for a delicious kbbq place.  I was kind of spoiled with the K-town right next door. I've heard great things about this chain as I know they have locations throughout the SoCal region. This is a newer location which just opened in December, so I was super excited to try it out.

The interior is definitely very hip; you can just imagine a nice club but kbbq grills everywhere.  The restaurant space is huge with dual level dining; my party of 4 was seated in the upper area for lunch.  

I want to first say, I had 2 great waiters, Brandon and Josh.  They were absolutely amazing and were very knowledgeable about all the different meats and service was very on par! The lunch price is $14.99 for an advertised 30+ items (keep a note that includes extra side dishes).  

The meat was very fresh, and I enjoyed the wide selection of marinated meats but some that really stood out for me were the following: Hawaiian steak, Beef Bulgolgi, Garlic Chicken, and Boneless Pork Ribs.  They also have Jap Chae noodles which is one of my favorite dishes, so I really appreciated that.  

I would definitely come back to Gen! If you guys are coming here request Brandon and Josh (if the manager is reading this, please pass along my name and comment to them!).

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sandra R.
review text: It was our second time at this location and we really enjoyed our visit. Our servers aj and Billy were really attentive and the manager Chris came by our table continuously to check up on us. We were offered refills multiple times and were attended in a timely manner. Overall, the customer service experience was great and we will definitely be back. Our favorite dishes are the Hawaiian steak and the beef brisket. If it is your first time here try wrapping the beef in rice paper. Thanks guy keep up the awesome work!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christianne L.
review text:
Pros:   $20 AYCE KBBQ.   Ambiance is super cool. Hostess was nice and patient.  Our tag team of servers, Josh and Rony, were great, friendly, always with a smile and apologetic about the backed up kitchen.  They take reservations (for parties of 10 +).  They have veggies to grill including green onions, and beef with pineapple.  Cheese garlic,jalapeño, fondue with chicken. Brick macaron ice cream .

Cons:  Nearly a two hour wait for 6 people on Saturday night.  They should give out buzzers for waiting. Didn't have their liquor license (yet). Banchan was ok.  Had to ask for green salad, our sauce/oil/salt  and rice papers.  Food came out a little slow.  Had to repeat our orders a few times.  We were sat upstairs in the corner where the tables are too close together making it awkward for the server to change our grills. Could use better ventilation. Parking sucks.

Food quality was good- not the best I've had. You get what you pay for.  If the wait wasn't so long, I'd eat here again and I'd ask for Josh and Rony!

Killed time at the 909 bar where they do have alcohol.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ashley P.
review text:
We originally were going to the Teppan house next door but my family and I walked into Gen and immediately decided this was a better choice!

Eric was our server very helpful and kind a real delight to sit in a new restaurant and feel like family.  

Thank you Eric for always checking to see if we needed anything you are very kind.  My daughter enjoyed the ice cream Macaroons.  My husband loved the atmosphere & the food was amazing!

From our family to yours thank you Eric for making us feel at home! You deserves a promotion! We will be back just because of the service!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ron V.
review text: Prime steak is really good but I really love the premium Chardol. A must try. Fast and friendly service.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jeanette C.
review text: The food and ambience is great here.  My only complaint is the service is super slow and some of the hostesses can be quite rude. The price for all you can eat is a great deal.  A must try for a good Korean Barbecue experience.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ruel G.
review text:
Finally ... delicious Korean BBQ in Rancho Cucamonga! After Seafood City (Filipino supermarket) opened over a year ago and Star Crab (Boiling Crab knockoff) began serving a few months ago, my wife and I were wondering when a decent KBBQ joint would show up in town. We love all of the Asian eateries in the San Gabriel Valley, but we don't always feel like making the half-hour drive. When we learned that GEN was opening after Christmas in our neck of the woods, we were excited, to say the least.

GEN went beyond our expectations in every aspect: food, service, value, and atmosphere. We began the new year with family visiting from out of town and took them here for lunch. Every person in our party was impressed with the restaurant's decor: it's hip and trendy, words that aren't usually associated with Rancho Cucamonga. It has a club-like feel to it, with good music in the background.

For our initial visit, service was close to overbearing: it seemed like every few minutes a server was checking on us and it felt like we were barely finishing a mouthful of food before somebody was asking if we needed anything else. The servers were friendly and helpful, though, so I chalked it up to a new crew still finding its legs. I'd rather have too-eager-to-please servers, though, than ones who drop off your food and disappear until it's time to pay the bill.

That being said, the service for dinner the next night (yes, we enjoyed it so much, we went on consecutive days) was more in line with what I expected. Again, our servers were helpful and attentive, but didn't hover during our meal. Since this is a new restaurant in the area, I appreciated how helpful the staff was; even though I came here with KBBQ veterans, the servers clearly explained all of the dishes and offered good recommendations. They were quick to change out our grills and refill our drinks.

During both of our meals, we liked all of the meats we tried: pork belly, premium chadol (ribeye), prime sirloin, spicy pork bulgogi, galbi, garlic pork belly, garlic chicken, cajun shrimp, and the hawaiian steak. My favorites so far are the galbi, pork belly, and prime sirloin, and I also enjoyed the jap chae (glass noodles with veggies). All of the banchan were good, if not spectacular. The meat was definitely the star of the show, as it should be when you're happily grilling away. For $20 all-you-can-eat, this is a superb value and there are a lot of choices (by my count, 31 different meats; there are also some veggies, soups, and noodles available). You order four meats at a time and the portions are generous and served quickly. You won't leave hungry, but if possible, save a little room for one of their tasty macaron ice cream sandwiches.

Overall, a superb addition to the growing number of Asian restaurants in the area. Highly recommended.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nate J.
review text:
Pretty decent price for lunch $14.99 M-F. Came in on 1/2 around 2pm for a party of 7 (3 kids under 10) seated right away. Prime steak and pork cheek was real good. I dont get why they dont just serve the regular steamed eggs, and should have moar banchan. I'm givin it 3 stars bc each time we ask for a Chadol refill, the portion gets smaller & smaller, and less fattier. Cmon whats up w that Gen? wifey & I can kill 2lbs of Chadol eaaaasily

ps: I also wanna add, reason for the 3 stars, we kept asking for Chadol and it takes more than 5min to bring it out. Cmon, it's Chadol u know errrrryone's gon order it, they should be ready and piled high on a huge serving plate - AND, not get smaller as we keep asking for it. Just as a courtesy: at least ask us if we want a smaller order, otherwise keep it the same as our first order and serve the joocy fatty ones too please .... not too much to ask, amirite?

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Trissa A.
review text: Marc & Gene were the BEST servers. We came hangy and left happy! Food was served fast, great suggestions and food was GREAT!  Can't wait to come back again. You won't be disappointed especially for $20.99 AYCE!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Hannah O.
review text:
First I have to say the food was delicious....  I mean it was BOMB.com

HOWEVER. I'm a little concerned about their cleanliness and customer service.

Our table was given not just one but TWO dirty tongs for our food. I mean the tongs still had sauce and meat on them and we had just sat down. Gross right? I don't doubt this place is clean but man those waiters need to pay attention that was gross.

Also the waitress she was really nice however, we hardly got tended to unless we flagged someone down, and we didn't do that too often we're arent the picky type of people, but when we finally did flag someone down, as I was talking to her the MANAGER started talking to her and pulled her for about 2 min to tell her who knows what.. Personally I think he could've waited for her to be done with her customers, I'm totally not blaming her for that one, I get it... But shame on the boss for not being considerate.. Especially since we had been waiting.

We were there for two hours and only got our water cups filled once.

Like I said food is amazing, good job for that guys but please pay attention to the utensils you are handing out and some more water refills would be nice. Is that too much to ask?

I'm gonna give this place another shot

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Kameron T.
review text: Great service from Jeremy and jennifer! Definitely coming back real soon!!! If you want great service recommend these two!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ryn A.
review text: We've been wanting to come here for a while and finally got a chance. We had a great time at Gen. We recommend the Beef Bulgoge and the ribs. Call early in the day to make reservations if you're coming on the weekend. We had great service from Phung (I think I spelled correctly).

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Chris S.
review text: Billy was amazing. We sat at the bar for our first time here. Couldn't have enjoyed it more. The food was great, Billy recommend  some awesome choices for us . The drinks were strong and good. Would def. Come again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Justin C.
review text:
Okay, let's get this straight. This gen Rancho location isn't a Korean bbq. Its more like an American bbq that is serving Korean parts of meats.
Most of the servers aren't Korean so I feel like they don't understand the speed of Korean bbq culture. There shouldn't be a wait in between cooking and ordering. There should be meat constantly. It takes a long time to just get started cooking.
The quality of the meat here are good but the service needs to show more urgency. Kbbq is all about speed and gen ain't showing it lol. The servers here are nice and friendly but being nice and friendly doesn't make a successful restaurant

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nelson N.
review text:
So if I ever want to go to a Korean BBQ that completely satisfies my needs of all the good tasting food, this is it. All you eat and very freshly served meats and vegetables. They put all the spices on the table and you decide what you want to put on your food. Make it well done or rare, you decide. You cook it the way you want it. So, when it comes to variety, fresh, and all you can eat. I would absolutely recommend this place.
As for service, I am glad to say that the level of service matches my satisfaction as well. Our waiter (Marc) was professional and friendly. He made recommendations that made us order more and he was always enthusiastic when coming to service our table. He is indeed an asset to this restaurant and will hope to be served by him again when coming back. The general manage (Gerry) sold my daughter and I the delicious macaroon ice cream. It is a must when you're all done with the main course. Gerry introduced himself and was very polite and professional as well. Thank you for the great service and the delicious food.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Don R.
review text: We went to eat lunch there and the food was so delicious and the most was the customer service was five stars. That two waiters were servicing Was was so cool. #bbqboygen #minhtygen I thank you guys will be coming back soon

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christina J.
review text: #remarcablegen did a great job serving our table . He was very attentive of our orders and drinks.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Omakase T.
review text:
I am writing this review in comparison to the following Korean BBQ AYCE.
Wang Cho - Chino Hill
Bulgogi House - Rowland Heights
Cham Sut Gol - Rowland Heights
I was going to include Kang Hodong Baekjeong, but Kang Hodong Baekjeong is not AYCE, so I will skip this place.

I have this place 5 stars based on:
- Very nice decoration
- Very nice ambient lighting
- Very nice air conditioning
- Very nice service
- Very nice and spacious sitting
- Very nice grill system
- Very nice food selections
- Very reasonable pricing

In comparison to the places I mentioned:
Decoration Related
#1. GEN Rancho - good looking, night club atmosphere, great temperature control.
#2. Wang Cho - young feeling, ok decoration.
#3. Bulgogi House and Cham Sut Gol - not very nice

Sitting Related
#1. GEN Rancho - very spacious sitting, table to table distance, comfortable
#2. All other three are very tight, uncomfortable.

Food Related
#1. GEN Rancho - you can choose everything on the menu.
#2. Other place has combo limitation, you can only choose within the combo you selected.

Pricing Related
#about the same, but GEN is in Rancho, save some gas.

Service Related
#1 GEN Rancho - super service!  Waiters are trying to built up relationship with you.
#2 Wang Cho - speaks English, easy to communicate.
#3 The other 2 places.... If you don't speak Korean, you are not going to receive their best service.

The only bad thing about GEN is that they don't have free ice cream like Cham Sut Gol does.  GEN also put an ice cream machine near the checking counter to trick you, but it's not free. lol.  That's the only thing I don't like.

Special recommend a waiter, his name is Justin.  He was very prompt and provided very best service I have had.  His service is better than some of the very expensive steak house. Keep up the good work.

In conclusion, this place is wonderful, and it's in Rancho Cucamonga.  I am really happy we got REAL Korean BBQ here in Inland Empire.  I finally have some presentable place to bring my friend to when they visit this area. Please keep the quality and service like this, I will update my review if service goes down.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Matthew R.
review text: This wasn't first time there for the dinner service.  Amazing service 10 out of 10 ! All the food was brought out very quickly along with the drinks. Everything was exactly as it sounded and I'm good portion. Beer and Sake were decent prices. Josh and Gene I think his name was were our waiters. But any employe was more than happy to help. I highly recommend this restaurant and these waiters, Friendly knowledge and helpful to say the lease. Make sure to visit !

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jackie W.
review text: It's a gorgeous spot I love the decor and the ability to grill at the bar. Service is prompt, portions are big cuts as opposed to thin sliced, and they have a better than most beer, sake and soju selection. We skipped breakfast to enjoy the AYCE lunch at $14.95 pp it was a great deal.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Richard B.
review text: Valentine's Day dinner with family. Garlic chicken, spicy chicken, cajun shrimp and beef bulgogi. Yum!! Thank you Sandra and Christian. You two were fantastic and so helpful.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Andy T.
review text: I've been to other Gens but I like this one the most! The food at all Gens is amazing but this one was the best cause of the service. Shout out to this one server named Randy. He was attentive and always asking my group how we were. You're the man Randy...we'll definitely be coming back. #randisimogen

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mr. V.
review text:
We normally go to Bulgogi House in Rowland, but now we have discovered Gen in Rancho I don't think we will be back to Bulgogi House. We visited the first evening it opened and the place already had a line despite the cold windy weather. If you go I recommend asking for the Ronny and Casey team of servers. Also I was given a tip from a KBBQ connoisseur friend of mine (Tino), "ask for the (off the menu) steamed egg". So in a nutshell, if you like:

-Nice ambiance
-Good music
-Good quality
-Excellent service
-Good prices

This might be the place!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Aj B.
review text: The food was great - especially the $20 all you can eat meat selection. The Chadol beef brisket was awesome! But the best part was our servers Josh and Ji who drank us under the table... jk. But they did provide great service so that my friends needed to Uber it home. Hope the parking doesn't tow overnight.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Alicia G.
review text: Our experience was awesome we loved our waiters Thomas C & Minh they were awesome could not ask for anybody better really enjoy their food at a five-star

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Vicky A.
review text: My family and I came here to celebrate a birthday and it was fantastic. The Manager and the waiters were so friendly and awesome! Great service, good food, kid friendly, great price. Endless food. Overall what made the experience so great was the waiters, sadly I can't remember their names but I did get photo of them and one took a selfie by accident.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ronald M.
review text:
Finally an all you can eat Korean BBQ place in Rancho Cucamonga. I've been waiting for something like this since I've moved here. I've been to the Tustin branch when that first opened and this place is just as great (even better actually).  

I love the set up and atmosphere of the place. Very modern.

Our servers were Jen, Calvin, and terry? I highly recommend you ask to be in their area when you come. They were very attentive and approachable. They made sure our requests were completed in a timely manner. Jen especially was great and even had a small conversation with us just to get to know a little more about us. I definitely would come here again and request to be placed in their section if they are working that night.

Highly suggest coming here asap before things pick up in the next couple of weeks. Have a feeling this place will be crowded soon. However, if you're looking to drink and eat I suggest you wait till mid January because they are still in the process of getting their liquor license. Only other all you can eat Kbbq place I know of is Wang Cho in chino hills. Hate to say I probably won't be going back there since this is only 2 minutes from my place. Also better meat selections here at Gen for a similar price.

Food wise I wish I didn't get so full so fast so I would be able to try the different types of meat they have to offer. Since I've been to the Tustin one the food was pretty much similar. I loved it all. Definitely will come back to try some of their other things.

Management was good. The manager actually came in and checked in on us to make sure everything was going well. I've been to many other kbbq places and this is the first time the manager introduced himself to us. Thought it was great so keep it up.Just a little critique for the front of the house staff (I know they were little busy) but at least put a smile on and remember to greet/say bye appropriately to each of the customers.

Overall will definitely come back soon.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Annie H.
review text:
3.5 stars. I'm really excited about this place being so close to home. We first went mid-week Wednesday for dinner and were told it was a full house and there'd be a 45 minute wait! We chose to go across the way for Vietnamese instead and came back for dessert.

We decided to come back today for my husband's birthday lunch. The food was definitely yummy!  All well marinated and flavorful meats. The atmosphere was hip and modern...club-like. Trendy, fer sure.

I'm sorry to say, however, that although they've been open for 4 weeks...one would think they just opened a week ago.
