They do not have their act together, yet.   To me, at a well established KBBQ place, you should be continuously grilling then eating or simultaneously grilling and eating. There shouldn't be an in between 20 minute break where there's no food to grill or eat.  And it's poor excuse to tell me the kitchen is backed up. I'm sorry, but if you're bringing out raw food...where might the hold-up be in the kitchen?

That in-between-wait was the most annoying thing to me. More so than the fact that they brought us dishes we didn't order or only brought 2 waters when we asked for 3 ...then had to wave down 3 other servers for the 3rd glass...or forgot to bring us spoons for the soondooboo...then leave us with a peach tea we didn't ask for, lol. They just slipped it to us! I can't imagine what the current dinner service is like.

Yes, I'm still excited for this place and we will come back...but not any time soon. The food is great, the price is fair, and the staff/servers are friendly. Hopefully, 6-8 months from now when the rush dies down and they get their routine on lock, our next experience can be a lot smoother.

I look forward to when I can update this review.

...with this new KBBQ place in RC/IE... I sure hope a decent Ramen spot to opens up here soon!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Leah H.
review text:
We had a great time with our huge party of ten.
NIC took such good care of us. He went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of: the food kept coming, water was topped off, and made sure to help cut the meat when needed.
We are looking forward to the next visit. THANKS NIC!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Karen L.
review text:
Let me start off by saying I've been to the Gen location in West Covina and Rowland and had never experienced such terrible service as I experience today. I should have expected the service to match the customer service provided by the hostess. She had the nastiest attitude and did not greet us and when she walked us over to the bar seat she slammed the menus, we asked her if we could get a booth and she said that would be a wait which we said was fine. While we were waiting the hostess and her co worker were talking and looking back at us. A wait started to build in the lobby and she never acknowledged us or placed us on the list. She even gave attitude when asked if we could have the booth that opened up. She didn't call us over even when the other hostess was seating a party that came in after us.

So we're finally seated and our server comes over and asks what we'd like to drink so we order and maybe 10 minutes later he comes back to take our food order. It's 4 of us total and they said we were only allowed a total of 4 food items at a time, we order the first round & it doesn't take long to arrive. We grill it and we finished our food and drinks and no one has came to check up on us. We flag someone down & we ask for more meat. Again we finish it and no ones checked on us. We have no napkins and no water at this point. We have to flag down again, another person who was NOT our server. At this point it had gotten ridiculous our server had not checked up on us ONCE. He walked past us plenty of times but did not even glance at our table. We also had to flag down an employee to ask for our check. It took a good 20 minutes for them to bring us back our cards and receipt, which was charged incorrectly. We were over it and decided to figure out the money situation between us pals. I'd give the service a negative star if I could, the two stars are only because of how good he food was and because of the good music playing.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Samuel F.
review text:
Good Korean BBQ

Not the best I have had but it was good. It's a new establishment and they have no liquor license so that ruined the night a bit lol. The servers were on point very nice friendly and attentive. Nice selection of meat to choose from. All the sides were pretty tasty tofu soup was great. But the #1 resin this place was a "miss" for me. Was the steamed egg. You have to make it yourself on the grill and it takes FOREVER!!!! Literally about 50mins for a tiny tiny steamed egg portion. Horrible. But food and great workers saved this review.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Suzie V.
review text:
90+ reviews after a week of its grand opening is what did it for me.....I had to try this place out. We love AYCE Korean BBQ restaurants and the fact that this one is close to home, made it a MUST.

The place just opened last Friday (Dec 26th) and it truly is a beautiful restaurant. The entryway, waiting area, ambiance with blue lights everywhere makes it a warm welcome. The hostess and waitresses were awesome. I really liked how the waitress and waiters were constantly asking if we needed anything. Our food came out timely and the grill was constantly being changed to avoid the smokiness. Our drinks were kept filled and our needs were definitely met with the outstanding taste of their meat. We especially liked their GEN Signature Steak....delicious! We ended the dinner with a yummy macaroon....mmmhhhh!

If you're in the area, stop by and check them out, trust me, they will not disappoint you.

BTW, dinner was $19.95 per person, AYCE...so you can order 4 items per table at a time, as many times as you want.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Gary P.
review text:
Great service from Jen, Casey, and Calvin!! Top Flight! That's my Gen Squad now they put in work for the hood! Lol very helping and always checking up on us making sure we got enough kimchi haha and always keep our grill fresh and flossy!  

Fresh meat, large selection. Very modern inside. Lots of room!! So call the squad to come eat!!! Great experience ! Love that we have a local spot now.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Alex T.
review text: I've been to one other Gen in tustin and I would have to say in terms of decor and size,this one is much better.In terms of the quality of the meat,I prefer other kbbq joints over Gen.Some cuts of beef are really good like the short rib but the brisket was a little fatty and chewy.We came on a sunday night and it was PACKED! Don't forget to grab a mini macaroon ice cream sandwich on your way out.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ray B.
review text: I tried GEN for the first time tonight. Full service Korean BBQ - all you can eat. I've been driving to Koreantown or San Gabriel Valley for food like this, but now they have a place right on Foothill and Rochester. GEN's selection and quality of meats is comparable to all the good Korean BBQ places in LA. Prices are reasonable for the quality and location. The staff is friendly, fast and helpful. Colin and Peter did a great job keeping up with our order and refills. I will definitely come back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jose A.
review text:
The best Korean BBQ I have ever been best service best food best prices the second time I have coming here and I have got the best service ever I recommend this restaurant to everybody its all you can eat Korean BBQ very fresh and delicious if you need to make a reservation I recommend to call in advance the manager Vince   is very good customer service I am very impressed would like to thank all the staff in Gen Korean BBQ dinner is $19.99 lunch $14.99 tku

When you come in ask for Trina,  Kevin and Kalani they're the best of the best

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: T W.
review text: Gen's is an amazing food experience! First, the level of customer service rivals the best restaurants in town and is consistent at every Gen's across  the  country. Our server Marc was amazing! He helped us order and took care of us well during our two hour meal! We felt welcomed by Marc  and the whole team! It was an amazing experience!   I have been to Gen's in Nevada and the experience was the same. The food was perfect, the atmosphere  is  upbeat and modern with tv screens and music that add to the dining experience, and the restrooms were pristine with fresh linens for customers! The dining rooms and  seating are comfortable and inviting with enough space to accommodate large groups.  This place is worth a two hour drive from San Diego! We will be back for more! Thanks again to Marc and the whole Gen team!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ashley G.
review text: Just left after having a delicious dinner with my husband. We were seated in a comfortable booth and served by Billy. Hands down the best service we have ever had  Thanks Billy for the good food and amazing service! We will definitely be coming back again and again and again

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Steven Y.
review text: Adlai was amazing !!! Went out of his way to accommodate AND snuck in a great photo bomb !!! Loved it !!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jessica L.
review text:
I don't have regrets.
Not only is this place really spacious, it also has an upper level seating area away from all the noise and waiting area downstairs.

The prices are very reasonable and the food is delicious. There are 37 different meats and treats to choose from on the dinner menu as well as soju, beer, and sake.

The macaroons are pretty good, they're crunchy but soft at the same time.
The staff was very nice and attentive.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dustin C.
review text:
Alright alright alright -- I'm pretty fair and reasonable! So I decided to eat here twice in order to write a review since my first visit was absolutly disappointing, so here is a review based on multiple experiences.

I'm going to say my first ever experience was HORRIBLE, bad service, bad management! I came in with my wife, a friend and his girlfriend. We were seated and waited a LONG time 20+ minutes until we decided that we likely were forgotten about entirely. So I approached a random guy, told him if he could help us which then explained he wasn't our waiter but he would find the person to service us, after a few minutes a gentleman comes by and sincerely apologizes and says that he didn't know he was covering our table and that there was miscommunication on their side. i said no worries, not a problem (thinking things would sail smoothly from there). He asked for the drinks we desired, put them into his ipad, then took our food order which also went into his ipad. He also mentioned due to delay, the sodas were on the house (made me feel good that he sincerely apologized and also threw in the drinks) -- only right thing to do right?

I also thought the ordering process with advanced technology was neat, first ever KBBQ i seen take orders like that.

Problem is, our drinks never came... And we asked for three sides of rice and only received two and brought it to one of the waiters attention which then promised to bring it (never did) so my friend and his girlfriend decided to share theirs.

We get the food, we're starving and ready to eat and we start cooking. The grill just isn't hot enough, so i inquired and he said keep the food off the holes and we'll be good (I told him oh, ok) my bad! But after doing so, I realized this didn't do much. I was disappointed with how slow things were to cook, but i moved on and tried to keep going. (I also read later via yelp reviews for this location that it's a known issue as well)

Anyhow, fast forward we begin eating after some time of the food cooking and I enjoy the taste of the food, no disappointment in taste, but WHERE'S OUR DRINKS? I flag the manager tell him, and he asked what we'd like and that he'd bring them. He never brought them :( Another guy eventually came and asked if we got our drinks, i said no the manager is bringing them. The waiter that inquired said that he'd be taking the order (our third time giving our drink order now) and he luckily followed through and brought them. I assume the first waiter obviously forgot, the manager then grabbed our order but likely forgot what we wanted so sent the third person to inquire and fulfill our drink request. Just wow....

Throughout our stay, the lack of service, and changing of grills was disappointing. I had to inquire many things from the manager such as changing the grill etc as well as ordering more food due to lack of proper service.

Fast forward some more, we eventually decided it'd be time to depart so we asked for the check, got it 15 minutes later and instantly provided the credit card and told them to ring us out (no reductions in price aside from the drinks for all the disappointment).... We waited another 20 minutes to get the credit card back and check so we could tip and leave. I still decided to tip $10 when in reality the entire meal for all four should of been on the house, and no tip was necessary.

NOTE: On my first visit, i noticed their spicy tofu soup was inconsistent, one was edible while the other was not (very oily and spicy, and heavily concentrated) you can see the pics attached to the reviews to see the difference....

FAST FORWARD to my second visit (today), we arrive and wait ~15 minutes and then are seated and quite instantly are asked about what drinks we want and if we've been there before and if we're ready to order. I said yes :) Service was better this time, food was just as good as my first visit. So I see some positive things which will allow me an opportunity to try it for the third time.

Overall I am giving them three stars, and i hope i can up the rating during my future visits. From my current experience, all I can say is BAD SERVICE, TASTY GOOD. I hope my future experiences outweigh the first one enough for me to forget about it :P

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Coni M.
review text: This place is Fantastic just as most of the yelpers reviewed!  100% quality of meats, food Taste and of course presentation; what a fun time cooking our Cajun Shrimp, Spicey garlic Chicken, Hawaiian Flank Steak & Beef Bulgogi.  Phung & Tommy "you guys are so professional, fun & simply Joy to have as waiters" Ty.  For all my Rdlns buddies, this place is like Rok n Fondue, but better.  However, no shade or disrespect on the Rok.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Elizabeth E.
review text: We come to Gen often, and have been to many different locations and always enjoy them all. Today was the first day where i was completely disappointed in our experience. Because we come so often, we have our favorite meats that we stick to every time. After a couple of different options during the first couple rounds, we like to stick to brisket for the remainder rounds. Once we wanted just brisket for the next round, we ordered double brisket, but the waiter we had said he couldn't do a double plate. The many times we've been here, we have NEVER heard that we can't do a double plate. I was shocked to hear that because that was the only meat we ordered. We had a party of four and he expects ONE plate of brisket to be enough for four people? Very disappointed, probably won't visit this location anymore, taking my business to Chino Hills. Food was still good though.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Amanda M.
review text:
Was here last night with my coworkers and we had a blast! We made reservations and were seated a little bit later than 730 but they made sure we were accomodated as soon as possible and made up for it as soon as we sat down.
Jed was our main server and he was amazing! He was very polite because we had a few first timers and gave us some very good suggestions.
When you're here definitely order the Hawaiian steak and the pork ribs!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Darren H.
review text:
FINALLY a Korean BBQ restaurant in the IE and thankfully it was Gen! I have been a fan of it for a while now, but making the trek to the Tustin location was more of a chore because it was always so busy and alas the time for Gen to unload on the IE has arrived and unload it has!

We did attempt to make reservations, but the main number seemed to get directed to a fax number which seemed odd, but their sister location in Cerritos was the same way so maybe there's a coincidence there. Regardless the wait was minimal to get a table and that was even on a busy Saturday night too..It did seem like amongst the traffic they do shuffle in and out people at a very efficient pace..We waited at most 15 minutes or so and the hostess actually held the booth for us which I thought was a rarity given the influx of diners.

Compared to the Tustin location the Rancho location is quite immense and certainly can house quite a bit of BBQ connoisseurs..I hate to mention it, but yes the decor does resemble a night club and has a futuristic appeal to it..It reminded me of eating with Aliens or even dining with the 3 breasted woman in total recall (ok that was a bit much, but just know the decor was something out of the norm and it worked)..=OP

Food wise, the quality of the meat (especially being AYCE) is one of the better compared to many of the OC establishments I have tried..The best part of it was that you cook it yourself so if it comes out short of your liking you can only blame yourself and not that of Gen!

Some standouts of the meal are the Gen Bulgogi, Hawaiian Steak, Bistro Harami (Marinated Spicy Pork), and Jap Chae (Glass Noodles)..Certainly must haves by any means and at $19.95 per person your wallet and tummy will think you're the bees knees once the smoke clears!

The only mixed feeling was the service as it honestly was hit or miss..It seemed some of the waiters looked like chickens with no head running around and most of the "lackeys" are the ones who saved the meal..They were accommodating and very apologetic in the times of error (i.e. drinks empty, cooking utensils forgotten, and an order of Spicy Pork not put in with the kitchen)..With the hustle and bustle of Gen it's hard to not have a soft spot for that stuff..Did it kill the meal? No. Is it going to prevent me from coming back? No. Can you sense that they were genuinely sorry? Yes.

All in all, job well done Gen and welcome finally to the IE..May you spread your wings and fly meaty goodness to one and all!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mike L.
review text: Solid Korean BBQ spot in the IE. It's similar to the other Gen spots around so cal. There's a wide variety of meats, the restaurant is clean and trendy, and the customer service is pretty good. Although service is good and attentive, it's not as smooth as other Gen locations. The banchan at Gen is also pretty basic. Gen gets really busy Friday and Saturday nights, so expect a long wait. Overall, solid Korean BBQ.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Elena R.
review text:
First time here and I am SO GLAD that AYCE KBBQ is in Rancho!

Came on a Friday night, party of 5, 30-40 min wait.
SERVICE: Lauren was our server and Sandra (Saundra? Sorry!) was Lauren's runner who helped us with all our sides. Lauren was absolutely great from the start! Loved her personality, always helpful, knew just the right times to stop by to ask us if we needed anything. Made helpful suggestions and was really easy to talk to! Will definitely be asking for her next time I come back. Sandra was also very helpful with cooking/cutting meats and came back real quick with all our sides. Thank you to both you ladies! Keep up the good work and attitude please!

FOOD: Everything was absolutely delicious. Beef bulgogi, garlic pork belly, and boneless galbi were a must. Only complaint I had was that the spicy pork bulgogi and spicy calamari were coated a little too much in the sauce, but had good flavor and texture.

I'm about to slip in a food coma, this place is great, recommended and for only $20?! Stop it. Will definitely definitely be coming back to stuff my face!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Minh N.
review text: Friendly customer service! The waiter who served us checked on us many times to see if we were doing okay, wish I got his name :( This place is usually packed during the weekends so it's best to make a reservation. I would recommend their brisket meat and rice cakes

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Rowell T.
review text: Brought my family here to try out their food. The place looks like a high end bar, clean, and very spacious. The staff Josh S. and Thomas were our servers. Both provided excellent cust service on top of excellent delicious food! Service was quick! Will definitely reco to more friends and come back to chow down again!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Peter C.
review text: Was looking for a good place to eat Korean BBQ in the Inland Empire that offer good quality meats. I usually go to the Gen in Tustin and more recently gave the Gen in Corona a try. I realized that not all Gen's are created equally. Came with a party of 10 people and the wait was not too bad and we were all seated in the same area. We got the brisket, pork belly, red wine pork belly, burgolgi, kalbi, calamari steak, Hawaiian steak, squid, beef tongue, tofu soup and japchae. All the meats here had the perfect texture and was not too rough which was a huge plus. They also make your tofu soup and japchae fresh which is why they take longer to get to your table. The downside was the red wine pork belly which tasted a bit funny like Chinese cured pork belly. The service here was quick and attentive and the waiters refilled our banchan and salad constantly throughout our meal. Knowing that were hungry college students, they double the portions of our banchan without asking and offered use huge stacks of rice paper. Overall a good experience and will make the extra drive to this Gen location for their food and service.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jes M.
review text: First time here and I'd say not too shabby. Had a party of six and was told check could only be split in two but then at the end was told it could be split in four instead. Anyhow, food was good. I tried too many things from menu since it was unlimited and they kept bringing what you ordered, which consisted of 30+ items. I had two different Japanese beers. I'd definitely come back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Amber W.
review text: My favorite place for Korean BBQ!!! Went Friday night was told a 45 minute wait definitely did not wait 45 minutes... The service at Gen is amazing especially Jen she is awesome and very tentative always on top of it. For all you can eat this place is worth it, a must try!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brenda R.
review text: Came to Gen with a party of 13. David was our server and he was AMAZING. He was on top of drinks, food, and had us laughing every time he came by! He seriously made our visit awesome!!! 5 stars for him!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: E K.
review text: Great place for the price during dinner. Service is good, I do recommend getting a booth rather than bar. I have went there a total of 3 times - once at the bar (with party of 2), booth (party of 2-server Jean), and booth (party of 3-server Joshua). The last 2 times was amazing, and had a very fulfilling dinner. The grills were constantly changed, and the service was very attentive. Sides were great, and we left very content with the meal. Recommend short ribs, beef bulgogi, Hawaiian steak, shrimp.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mark V.
review text: "Damn Daniel" Amazing service by Danny P and Josh wow! Not once did I see the bottom of my cup and coming right back to back with the meat and great suggestions! I'm happy and so are the other 5 ppl with me.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Justin G.
review text: Just got back from an amazing birthday lunch and got an even bigger surprise when Danny P. and his crew scared the crap outta me, followed by the crew singing to me and serving me birthday pineapple. I will not forget the experience.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Minh N.
review text: Friendly customer service! The waiter who served us checked on us many times to see if we were doing okay, wish I got his name :( This place is usually packed during the weekends so it's best to make a reservation. I would recommend their brisket meat and rice cakes

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Devon P.
review text: I had an amazing night tonight at Gen and my server Jen made it even more wonderful.My friends and I will be coming back all the time.Great atmosphere!Thank you Jen for making our night extra special.And that's Jen With a J not a G. ;)

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Calvin W.
review text:
very very very rare to five korean bbq place with a grill that can actually cook! only other place i ever knew of was manna grill in little Tokyo and this place blasts that place way out.  food cooks quickly and the waiters are on hand for your orders.

only bad thing is that on weekends even for lunch they charge you for dinner prices.  but the food selection is great that is a good value for your buck considering it's ayce (all you can eat)

if your in the mood for more than what gyu can offer, hit this place up.  it looks like it gets packed at peak hours but since it opens earlier than most places come early and get your grub on

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brandon U.
review text: This place is AMAZING! The food is awesome. Beats Korean BBQ I've been too. Something that really stood out was the service, if you ever get the chance, ask for Danny P and Mihn. Extremely attentive, some of the best service I've ever had. I'll be going back really soon!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Cara S.
review text: Came here to celebrate Mother's Day early.. Service was awesome!! Thomas was very helpful and attentive! That boy needs a raise!  oh and food tastes great as well.. Will definitely be back!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mercedes H.
review text: I love this kbbq ayce. I usually go here or towards LA because there are more food options and everything taste great. I also like that their pork belly comes in thick, not frozen slices. It's $20 a person so I always eat as much as I can and am never unhappy with the food or amounts.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Keyla J.
review text: Ate here for the first time on Wednesday and already back! Dinner  prices can't be beat at $19.99 for the full menu and $15.99 for lunch!!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Carly W.
review text: My friends and I came here to celebrate the end of our quarter of school. Some of us were first-timers and Thomas treated us great and was very helpful! The food was delicious and we really loved the vibe of the restaurant. I will definitely come back here!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Kathy S.
review text: Okay, I've been here many times and always the service is amazing and the food is delicious. But yesterday 9/4/17 I took my mother for her birthday and it was AWESOME!!! The waiters as always were attentive to our needs. They explained everything to my mother since it was her first time. The place is always clean and the music is wonderful. They even sang happy birthday (really really loud) to my mother and lol the whole experience was epic. I've never had bad service at Gen House. Absolutely 5 stars  oh and not to mention how great the Apple Soju was lol my mother enjoyed that the most lol

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Brynn T.
review text: All you could ever want in a Korean barbecue place, the wait is long even if you do have a reservation but well worth it! The service was great and meat fresh not frozen and the side dishes just kept coming

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sean D.
review text: Thomas and Danny were excellent while they kept on checking to see if we were doing good. Great service and good recommendation on the meat selections.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christina T.
review text: This was an awesome dining experience. It was our first time and we had been looking forward to eating here. We were seated within about 10 minutes and we chose to sit at the bar. It was an excellent choice. Our waiter Anthony was amazing! We found out he was a bartender and server at the bar. We had the "all you can eat" dinner which came with a salad and variety of little sides and rices. We ordered various beef, chicken and shrimp. Everything was delicious. Anthony made sure we knew how to cook our food, changed out our grill tops regularly and kept our drinks full. He and the service were outstanding. I highly recommend eating here. We will definitely be back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sasha M.
review text: We went around 830 pm on a Sunday night. It was busy. We had to wait about 40 mins for a group of 7. Once seated we ordered right away. The meat and drinks came out in a timely manner. It took longer to get the rice and seasonings. The surrounding grills were smoking pretty bad causing my young children to cough. I give this place 4 stars for the large portions of meat and the servers readiness to bring more. I knocked one star because of the smoke, only one toilet was working in the restroom and they didn't have Dr. Pepper or Pibb.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Nicole T.
review text:
MEH. Gen KBBQ House is like a pretty girl with no personality...nice to look at, amazing to be in, but when it comes down to it not worth your time.

Came with some of my coworkers on a weekday night for dinner. $20 for AYCE, pretty standard. The wait wasn't too terrible but sheeeesh standing outside in the cold was a bitch! When we finally got called I had such high expectations for this place, I loved the decor. It has a lounge/clubby vibe to it. But I didn't come here for the ambiance, so on to the food.

FOOD: First of all, our waiter told us that some of the meats on the menu weren't available because they had run out. I almost laughed! This is an AYCE place, and on a weeknight. None of the KBBQ restaurants I've frequented have ever told us they were out of anything. With that being said, we ordered some of the meats (you're allowed to choose 4 at a time, also standard for any KBBQ place) and waited. WOWWW was all I thought when they started dropping off our food. There were 4 of us at the table (and one of my friend's daughters), and the amount of meat they give you is ridiculously small. If there are 4 adults at a table why don't you accommodate that amount in the food you bring us? We ran out in like 10 minutes. I mean shit, I'm no pig (most of the time) but ya girl was hungry! I guess they were scared of running out of more meat so they underfed us. Don't get me wrong the meats were good (maybe 'cus I was a little faded but who knows), but it didn't make up for the amount we were gipped of. The sides they gave were scarce as well. Kimchi was okay, which was sad because that's my favorite thing everrr.

SERVICE: Again, nothing special, extremely sub-par. Our waiter was cool but he messed up our drink order twice, and we had to flag down another waiter because he was MIA. Took forever for them to check on us & get our next order, forgot to bring more of whatever sides we asked for, etc. And it wasn't like we were mean or rude either, all of us are waitresses so we were super nice.

OVERALL: This place is OKAY. 1 star for the ambiance, 1 star for the food, and 1 more star because of the okay service. Come if you wanna impress a girl who's never been here/had KBBQ before & you're trying to get it in. Would I come back? Maybe if someone offered to pay for my meal. Otherwise I'll make the trip to Rowland Heights or K-Town for my KBBQ fix.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Lisa E.
review text: Many friends told us how great this place was, but today we realized that was an understatement. The dinner meals are $20.95 per person. That sounds kind of pricey, especially if you are not a big eater. My daughter and I went and we loved everything we ate. Our favorite was the premium steak! The shrimp is a bit of a mess to order so we don't recommend that. You have to take the heads off and shell them. The Hawaiian steak was awesome and the meats are great when accompanied by the assorted veggies. There's no dessert offered but lots of cocktail variety and drinks, especially teas. The staff is very helpful, we had Kelly and Gwen and they were great, answered any questions we had and had delicious recommendations. The side dishes were also really good, we liked the pickled radish. Overall, we had a great time and enjoyed everything we ate. We aren't big eaters, but we went really hungry and got through two rounds.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Josue R.
review text: Obed was a great host. He made sure we were always pleased and he never let my cup go dry. We always had brisket running on the grill. He honestly made my day with his good charm and charisma. Because of his great service I definitely will be coming back to Gen.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Yaima M.
review text:
Basics: All you can eat, self cooked, Korean BBQ.

All I can say is "wow"! The service was excellent, their food was delicious and prices are great! They also have happy hour on Saturdays!

The only reason this I didn't give Gen five stars was due to the wait. It is understandable that in oh-so boring Rancho Cucamonga the latest place is going to be extremely busy. However, their "wait list" is outdated for such a modern place. Maybe look into getting a system that texts the customer when their table is ready. This way, a two-hour wait time is able to be endured a bit easier.

Overall, amazing place for good food, ambiance and service!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Ma V.
review text: First time here and I really liked it. I give it a four star because I didn't like some of the meat seasoning. Overall it was a pretty good experience. Brandon is the best server! He is proactive and friendly!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Yvonne Y.
review text: First time here. Very edgy decor and relaxing music. Food was amazing and our server Kim was the best! We asked him to order for us...:whatever he recommended ... And we were not disappointed! He really knows his stuff  all you can eat dinner for $20! Not bad at all . Give that boy a raise!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Elizabeth McSwain M.
review text: This was a WONDERFUL dining experience for me and my friend Zina.  V. The gorgeous manager was fantastic! Professional yet very welcoming. She answered all of our questions without making us feel like they were an inconvenience.  The assistant mgr. Josh was also very accommodating he and Jesse our server were very attentive. I LOVE this place.  Great food, the customer service was exemplary and the decor is amazing!  I definitely recommend this restaurant... If I'm not eating at my own restaurant Maple House Chicken and Waffles I will be here.. Great 1st impression.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Stacey V.
review text: Delicious, and services are fast.  I will definitely recommend anyone to come here. It is all you can eat Korean bbq. The server we had was on point with his recommendations.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Cassandra L.
review text: Great atmosphere, great food, and great service. Our server, Kim, was so attentive and would swing by before our food or drinks ever needed a refil! This place is even better than the kbbq spots in Korea town. All you can eat for $20?!?! We'll be coming back again VERY soon!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Aaron H.
review text: Just finished eating at Gen. Never had korean bbq. The service was amazing. Had the best server ever Gerry. Super attentive and offered spot on recommendations for our meal. I swear my beverage never dropped below the halfway mark. The other servers that assisted were just as attentive. The food was amazing and the ambience was perfect. The whole restaurant design was awesome. And the price you cant beat it. Will definitely be going back again. Just waiting to recover from my food coma.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jaime L.
review text: My wife and I went to Gen for the first time today. We both loved it. The restaurant is beautiful inside and the food selection is amazing. We don't eat seafood so we stuck to the beef and chicken. Our waiter Brandon was extremely helpful and very knowledgeable on all the menu items. He was also very attentive  I swear our drinks never were more than half empty before he topped them off. We used to go the other "bbq" style restaurant in town but I think we found our new place.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: kevin t.
review text: Today we tried # 5 Hawaiian Steak, #13 Samgyubsal, #23 Chicken Bulgogi (fantastic by the way), Assorted veggies, and # 24 Garlic Chicken. Kim was our server..FANTASTIC SERVICE!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jay N.
review text: Came here because I love GEN BBQ but Wasn't pleased with the service here, I think the trainee that was helping the server was way better than the server himself. The most hilarious thing was that my party thought the trainee took over our table because we didn't see the server once after he took our drinks. Then we realized Kim was still the server he brought out things we didn't order and kept bringing out side orders of rice cake and chap jae twice. the meat quality wasn't good either we had thin pieces of beef tongue and it looked like pure fat. I'm giving it 2 stars because you should just hire the trainee (Jesse I believe his name) that helped because he made our experience that much better. I would rather drive to Tustin or Huntington Beach because they are pretty consistent there.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Angel A.
review text: We had an amazing time here..... The food was excellent and Josh ( the waiter) was an awesome server. I've been to Korea and this place is hands down authentic. The restaurant look very classy and the blue lights make it look incredibly welcoming.  I highly recommend this place.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Marco L.
review text: Awesome food great service specifically if u get a server like Billy great guy n if it's your first time like it was mine then u will have a great experience. Im the kind of guy that love's food, n going to different places to try new things and so far he has been the best server I've ever experienced.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Karry B.
review text: We came in we a giant party of 15-20 people for a birthday party. Our waiters were Sam and Josh. They were awesome! Very attentive, fast, and helpful! The food was delishious as well!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: David B.
review text: Came for dinner with my wife and the place is awesome no complaints. The price is 15 before 3 pm after 3 goes up 5 bucks that's nothing it's affordable and delicious. Will be coming back and asking for Kim to help us again he was an awesome server made our experience an A+

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Christine N.
review text: We came here about two weeks ago exhausted after Tough Mudder. We were seated after about 20 minutes but our server never showed up to our table. We didn't even have the sides, plates, or water and by then we were starting to consider leaving and going somewhere else. Luckily one of the other servers noticed our anxiety and took care of us right away. He was already swamped with other tables but the fact that he made time to make sure we got our order, drinks, and sides was really thoughtful. He checked up on us constantly even though he wasn't our server and I think other servers started to notice because all of a sudden everyone started coming to us but we only wanted to order from our pseudo server, DAVID T. Thank you David for taking care of us even though you were heavily swamped and for being so thoughtful and accommodating for our needs. And thank you to our other server Xavier for introducing us to the other staff and helping us out towards the end.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dj M.
review text: Finally, an ayce kbbq in Rancho! Their liquor license is still pending so it's still their "soft opening".  They took over the old cucamonga brewery and did a great job with the interior.  There's plenty of booths, there's a second story and even a small room off to the side.  They had good quality meats, great service (our server today was Teri and she was very attentive and pleasant), and the restaurant looked clean.  They also had ice cream macaron sandwiches for $3.25 in different flavors.  Just a couple things though, the parking lot is shared with other businesses so it can be hard to find a spot and the wait for a table can be long.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Jake T.
review text: A fantastic restaurant option for curious families and groups looking to get into Korean bbq. Great option for children as they offer simple meat options and a delicious set of side dishes. The only downside is that you have to cook your own meats and have to prepare almost everything yourself. But as long as you know how to do that. You are set for a fantastic meal and great restaurant experience.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Dang H.
review text: Long wait. I had a party of 15 and the 45 minute wait turned into 2 hours. Which was understandable. My group becoming antsy and impatient was all relieved when we had our server, Andy, provide exceptional service that made that whole waiting process worth it. Big shout out to him for making the experience worthwhile. I will be back because of that single reason. Best service I have ever had at a Korean BBQ ayce. Thanks again Andy

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Oznur A.
review text: Not authentic but pretty damn good! Kim and kelly is the bomb servers and the service is awesome! Will forever come back here!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Gabriel H.
review text: This is the most amazing Korean BBQ.... Granted I admit I haven't been to many but for $20 it's AYCE and they offer 37 varieties of delicious meat morsels! The vibe is like a Hollywood club l... Super modern and obnoxious but it doesn't take away from the food!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sarah M.
review text: Absolutely fabulous! My favorite restaurant in rancho. They r fast, reasonably priced, and all the employees are pleasant. The location use to be such a cursed spot , from Compass Creek... Omaha jacks... Cucamonga brewery... I hope this place makes it.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Gabriel C.
review text: 4 Taylor Swift songs during dinner!! Can't beat that plus I like the food and the prices. 19.99 dinner price for adults and 9.99 for kids.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Kim T.
review text: It's good.  The difference between this Gen and the locations in Orange County is that this one does not have Kobe cuts on the menu for $20 AYCE.  They also give smaller portions on the plates.  Which is not a big deal, since you can keep ordering.  I like the club-like atmosphere and décor.  Service was pretty good and the restaurant is huge.  We came for an early Sunday dinner and there was no wait but by the time we were leaving, it was packed.  Favorites are the beef tongue, bulgogi, and rib fingers.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Eric I.
review text: Probably one of the best service I've had at a Korean bbq joint. I prefer this GEN over the one in Cerritos. When I first walked in, I was amazed with the decor and how classy it looks. The design is very upscale and the ambiance is dark. One made me enjoy my experience here was the fact the music section was way better than the other GENs. And I love how dark it is. Our server was William and he was really attentive and nice. Him and his coworkers treated us really well on New Years Eve. I wish I could get service like this at most places. Maybe because it's dead and not busy but he still was on top of it with the orders and bringing us everything we wanted. I wish I could go to this GEN more often but I live so far away. Thank you William for being a great service. Yaaasssss

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Sharayah M.
review text: The vibe is amazing and all you can eat for $19.99!! We've been to a lot of Korean bbq places but this one is by far the best. Near freeways and in a great area too!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Xano W.
review text: NIC was our server, he's fast, courteous and always smiling. Love the food and everything else. We'll be back.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Amy K.
review text: For the $20 price point meat quality was pretty good. The ban chan was meh. My biggest complaint at this point is their logistics were slow and scattered. We didn't get things that we ordered. They didn't take the used plates away. They need to work out the kinks.... Basically too many chiefs, not enough indians.   They couldn't figure out how to sell me an ice cream macaron for 10 min. because they couldn't figure out their computer system.  I really want this place to do well, but at this point more hype than substance.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Mr. A.
review text:
How this place has 2000+ reviews, 4.5 stars I will never know. Service was terrible. We had multiple servers and it was still terrible. We had to ask for brisket at least 3x before we received any. "Bottomless" drinks sat unfilled for over 30 minutes. RICE, a staple in any asian restaurant, came 1 hour into the meal even though we asked for it when we got there and asked again multiple times. Asked for two orders of galbi (you can order up to 4 plates at a time) and received two small pieces that look like someone just threw it on a plate from 10 ft away... lucky shot. See pic. Got radish paper and waitress knocked over a glass of water onto it. Didn't clean up the water on the table and didn't bring more radish paper. See pic. I think they didn't change the grill often because they were trying to smoke us out. Servers more concentrated on singing happy birthday than actually serving. It would have been a very special occasion if we received our orders.

2 stars because the meat did taste good and well marinated when you eventually get it. I suspect at least 4 of our orders were never fulfilled. Not worth the hassle..

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Joselyn P.
review text: joe and jade are the best! ask for them!!! they are so nice and genuine! definitely coming back for the home boy and home girl!!! he called me a "shawtaaay". best experience ever!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Paul R.
review text: Wonderful, wonderful place! The cuts of meat and the seasonings/marinades are phenomenal. The seafood is awesome - we had the spicy garlic shrimp and spicy calamari. The pork small intestines were earthy and very delicious - we cooked them until they were nice and crispy. The pork belly choices and pork cheek were all amazing as well as the beef belly. Hard to pick a favorite. For $19.99 all you can eat for dinner - you really get your money's worth. All the accompaniments were good as well - the miso garlic sauce, sesame oil dressing, seaweed seasoning, kimchee, rice wrappers, and spicy chili paste. Words cannot express how happy my buddy and I were. The service was incredible. I never once had to ask for a thing and our server was nice enough to help cook and prepare the pork intestine. He also made all the recommendations for what meats to get - was not disappointed with any of the choices. The Hite was also ice cold - perfect accompaniment with dinner. I will be back soon and save some room for a macaron ice cream sandwich...maybe! Well done Gen! The cool ambience, amazing food, and very friendly service leaves little competition in the Korean barbecue department.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Chaneesays A.
review text: My favorite Korean Bbq spot in Rancho Cucamonga.  Staff is friendly and professional.  Ambiance is amazing.  Love the music and lighting in the establishment.  I recommend the Mango Soju is refreshing and sure to give you a light buzz to set the mood.  Meats and produce are high quality.  Love the pork bulgogi, hawaiian steak, as well as the prime steak.  If you're in the mood for Korean Bbq, by all means stop by Gen.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Diana J.
review text: Came here again and the service and food definitely improved since the last time. The brisket wasn't 60% fat and the service was a lot more attentive.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Wolf P.
review text: other than the ridiculous wait to get seated in (45 mins), it is a saturday, maybe call ahead..experience is pretty good.  ambience is good, the meats are good, the sides are just average.  worth 20 bones?, hell yeah!!

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Vikki R.
review text: I love korean BBQ and since I was visiting family nearby, my cousin took me out to eat at this location since it was very close by and just recently opened. I do like the fact that they encouraged to yelp the servers. We had two people serving us, Jade and Phung. When we were ordering, we only saw Jade come by twice and she even passed by our table like she was ignoring us so I thought this was going to be a bad experience. However it got better when Phung started serving and the food came out quickly and was always making sure we had what we need for a satisfied meal. Phung is a friendly server so I definitely recommend sitting in his section if you can.  Despite how busy the place is, I think it's good to place to eat and you want nice servers to give you a great customer experience. Obviously the variety of meat has a wide range and the flavored soju is awesome. I would definitely come here again.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Geraldine K.
review text: Awesome new place to hang out. Great food. Our server Billy was nice & accommodating and very attentive. Will definitely come back with more friends & family.

address:
11837 E Foothill Blvd
Ste A
Rancho Cucamonga, CA 91730
author: Heidi M.
review text: As a avid GEN Korean barbecue attendee and enthusiast!!  I could not be more ecstatic to know that they finally opened one close to home. Personally I have been enjoying this establishment for a little over a year. I have had to travel to orange county to Cerrito's just to enjoy this fun experience and great food. Now we go we do not mess around we do not play games we go hard we go protein crazy and we go heavy on the meats. What I enjoy about this place is the flat rate for all you can eat. If you can put it away it's at a good price the meet and the quality is always good I have not once had a bad experience at any location. I have yet to have eaten at this new location because granted I just found out that it's been open but from personal experience I can tell you that if you love group eating, if you love a place where you can have a good experience, food, and just good ambience - usually great service and you enjoy Korean barbecue, this is the spot. I love GEN it's great.

author: Elizabeth G.
review text:
Their ventilation system DOES NOT WORK!!! We were literally inhaling ALL THE SMOKE while waiting for the grill to be changed. By the time we left, my nose and throat was HURTING so bad, and my bf had been tearing up all the way til we got home. We literally ESCAPED the place. Of course, it took them 20 mins to get our check back.
My throat still hurts when I'm writing this review (literally an hour later), and I've been coughing and feeling nauseous ever since. Disclaimer: WE DON'T HAVE COVID. I'm surprised that they didn't get sued for this. Imagine all the toxic smoke that's been going into your system. Anyone who cares about their own health shouldn't be coming here.

Not gonna lie, WORST kbbq experience ever. We've always been coming to this location since it opened, and everything has been going down in the past few years. Meat quality, services & overall experience really are getting significantly worse. The meats for some reason are hard to chew on. On top of that, they don't have beef tongue, corn cheese or steamed egg that other kbbq places typically offer.
I swear this will be the last time we come here. They are EXTREMELY understaffed. Our server was literally running between tables and we still couldn't get a hold of him. It takes on average 15 - 20 mins for everything we asked for to arrive. That includes grill changes. Our grill was literally burning for 10 mins straight until they finally came around and changed it for us. A lot of things didn't come at the end, and we simply didn't bother asking for them cuz we wanted to leave so badly.

Ima drink more water and see if it gets better. If not let's see what's gonna happen.

author: YuTong L.
review text:
This review is only meant for Doordash Delivery.

Thinnest Galbi ever had in life, only three pieces.
Chicken only had like few bites. taste is alright, but definitely not worth for the money you paid. I mean $13 for like a kids meal basically.

author: Ally S.
review text: Delicious food. Truly helpful and fun staff. The environment was wonderful. The drinks were on point! The flavor was in the food. Not much words cause words can't describe the experience and the food we consumed. It was ever so delicious and we can't wait to go back. 1000% recommend this place.

author: Alex E.
review text: You can only get one meat a time and it takes 10 minutes for the waiter to come to table  . Zero refill in 30 min wait .I will continue to eat at different locations but NEVER at this location

author: Mushashi M.
review text: Our mozzarella sticks came with a free stainless screw, Manager couldn't even give us a reason.

author: Zoey M.
review text:
This location was so packed that there wasn't even parking. The wait time to eat inside was about an hour and a half. But outside dinning was on the spot. We chose to eat outside and we were seated right away. From the looks of it COVID regulations were being followed throughout the establishment.

This was our first time at this location, but it wasn't very different from other gens. The menu and over all atmosphere was the same.

The manager was very friendly and attentive with us. The server and busboy on the other hand were running around our table, and at one point we had no food on our table and the busboy could not take our order. We waited a good 15 minutes, literally just sat there with nothing to eat. And when our order was taken and finally came out they gave us extra meat we didn't order and it went to waste. The food was good, and overall satisfying.

author: Paprika M.
review text:
Taste :4.5/5
Environment: 4.3/5
Service/: 4.6/5

A great place for all you can eat Korean BBQ but it's really busy over the weekend.pls make reservation

The waiters are attentive any they come to your table to serve you and take care your grilled pan  .

The order is very quick as all
Food taste tasty yummy and fresh .

Recommend
Beef tongue
Canji Shrimp
Spicy squid
Pork cheek
Spicy pork bulgogi

author: Ken R.
review text:
We just finished what was a pathetic excuse for korean bbq. The appetizers took forever and came out towards the end. The 4 meat per order is a joke when it takes forever to get your order. You literally have to order in between since it takes so long to get your first order.
I remember going to the Gen in Rowland Heights before it closed...I think this place needs to follow suit..the meat is low quality, the tofu stew came with no tofu and barely cooked squash. Taste like they added Shin Ramen packets for the flavoring.

I would give this place less than a star if possible.  I recommend finding somewhere in Rowland or LA( if you can make it out there)

author: Linda N.
review text:
I was craving galbi short ribs so we decide to come here for lunch. To our surprise, their indoor dining was open.  Yay!

They have two menus to choose from:  lunch menu ($19.95) and a dinner menu ($24.95).  Since I wanted galbi short ribs, we had to order the dinner menu.

We weren't aware that they only give 2 pieces of galbi short ribs at a time, regardless of how many orders you tell them, so it took a long time for us to get our orders. The servers were really friendly and tried to accommodate my many orders of galbi, but just be aware of this, if you love galbi as much as I do.  

The meat quality is good here. You definitely get your bang for your buck. I'm not a fan of other Gen locations, such as Alhambra or Rowland, but this is definitely one of the better Gen locations.  Great value and great friendly service, so if you decide to go to Gen, come to this location.

author: Mico L.
review text:
I use several app to order the food from here .
I order raw and Benton item for several time (over 10times)
They was pretty on time before(3months before)
They just don't prepare the to go food if you don't show up in store.
I already have over 5 times that when arrive the store but the food not ready yet.  I matter I arrive on time or even 5-20minutes after the the schedule time.

Quick advise: once place your order just go to the restaurant because it doesn't matter you go on time or not. Because they start prepare your food after you show up in the restaurant. (No latter the order need to be cook or not)

author: Rachel I.
review text:
Omg !!!! I'm a first timer here and I was completely blown away !!! So delicious!!

The gentlemen on the phone who took my order ( who I think also brought out my order) was super awesome and really nice! What great customer service is all about!!

Super fast service
Quick and safe curbside pick up
Reasonable price
Quality food

author: Justin S.
review text:
During the Covid era with dining restrictions, Gen still offers outdoor dining via a partially repurposed parking lot adorned with tables and chairs, tents, and tarps. Each table has a portable gas stove and a heavy iron grill plate.

Fridays and weekends offer all-you-can-eat at $25/person. Per the usual arrangement, each table may only order 4 meats at once. The meats now arrived half-cooked to compensate for the comparatively weaker outdoor grill.

Service has increased in responsiveness, seemingly due to the reduction of patrons. Otherwise, the outdoor experience does not drastically differ from the normal experience.

author: Therese P.
review text:
I will first mention all the good things about this place before getting into the meat of it. The hostess was lovely and got us seated promptly as soon as our entire party arrived. The end. Onto the bad. We came here yesterday 09/27 and were seated at 6:19 PM table 34. It was moderately busy, of course it was a Sunday night and around dinner time. One of the people helping us mentioned that they were a bit understaffed and I get it- I've worked in restaurants for 5 years being understaffed is stressful and not everything is going to be perfect. I don't really expect perfect or smiles all around anyway. What I expect to do is to be able to eat. Anything. Something. Throughout the whole time we were there almost 2 hours as we got our check at 7:48. Not one person came to our table and said "hello my name is ---- and I'll be helping you today" though I saw many tables adjacent to us receive this courtesy. I've also included a notated picture of our receipt and we received less than half of what's tabulated on there, and what made it on there wasn't even everything we ordered (make it make sense). It was one thing after the other- "the kitchen lost your ticket" "sorry it probably didn't go through" "we're really backed up tonight (said in a thoroughly irate tone of voice)" ok! Cool! But now why are you getting irritated at us! For asking for the third time in 30 minutes why we haven't received our order of 4 items. Basically we were there for 1.5 hours and received 10 plates of protein overall. I've never had service affect a meal to this degree, and it was so frustrating especially seeing as this was supposed to be an outing for my mom's birthday. Anyway, Gen is popular enough that whoever likes going there is going to continue going there. This is the review for anyone in the fence about trying it anytime soon. My advice? Don't. You're going to be unsatisfied, unhappy, and most of all hungry by the end of it.

Quick aside about the food quality- it's standard kbbq nothing special, but one thing I will say is the beef belly that did make it to our table was really hit or miss. Some of it decent, perfectly edible. The last couple plates- D R Y as all heck.

author: Ellen M.
review text:
I heard many great things about this place and I realize they are doing what they can with outside dining, but several things made it just "ok" for be rather than great.  Upon entry to the restaurant, there is an optional temperature check.  It is unclear that you need to first order inside then go outside to be seated.  We waited a while to find out as it took a long time to get greeted.  The hostess was a bit rude, assuming we should know what to do which irritated me.  One bright spot was our server Shauna who was on the mark, checking on us frequently and making sure the food kept coming. The runner was hurried and confused, forgetting the stuff we repeatedly asked for. Apparently the dishwasher didn't show up to work.  It bothered me that the runners asked to use our tongs to move the meat onto our grill then gave it back to us. Doesn't seem very sanitary with Covid.

The good was ok but didn't come out raw as normal. We think they cook it slightly in the kitchen then bring it out to speed things up outside. Also the sides of the tent were not rolled up earlier in the day with diners inside. Didn't seem like a good situation for ventilation.

author: Phil Y.
review text:
The COVID-19 deal was great!  7 meats and 5 side dishes for $22 when I went there in early May.  They even threw in a roll of toilet paper.  I called them up early before 5 PM and told them that I didn't want to pick it up until 6 PM.  The woman who answered the phone told me, "No problem!  We will text you when it is done!"  Then everything went downhill.  I received a text at 5:30 telling me that me food was ready for pick-up.  What happened to my 6 PM pick-up?  I guess 5:30 was close enough to 6 PM so I didn't make a big deal out of it.  Besides, before leaving, the nice cashier gave me a roll of commercial grade "Monogram" toilet paper!  Feeling happy, I paid and left for home.  

When I got home, I opened up the boxes and saw my banchans and the 7 meats.  The banchans were okay since the servers (cooks) didn't have to do anything with them.  But, the meats.  The non-marinated meats were okay.  The marinated meats(pork belly) were all burnt!  If I wanted to eat burnt meats, I would've went to H-Mart to buy the meats and let my daughter cook it.  The portion of food was very good, if only it wasn't burnt.  

Service sounded good, but, they can't follow instructions.  It may be a communication problem between the order takers/cashiers and the ones that do the cooking.  Either way, the people that cook don't do a very good job.  Best of all, I now know that Kirkland Signature toilet paper is much better than their commercial grade "Monogram" toilet paper, or at least that is what my body tells me.  

Lastly, the $22 deal just went up to $23 for the Memorial Day holiday.

author: Michele J.
review text:
We had a wonderful dinner tonight. We made reservations for our party of 10 and they had our table ready. It was pretty busy, which is great to see.

The service was fantastic!! Jacob and Joseph regularly took our meat/seafood orders to grill and gave some great recommendations. They were attentive and had a great attitude. The grills were also changed whenever we needed it due to them constantly checking throughout our meal.

The food was great!! So delicious!! We all came hungry and they did not disappoint.

A big group of their servers cheerfully sang Happy Birthday!! It was a perfect ending to our celebration.

author: J B.
review text:
I have come before oftenand left 5 stars .. Friday night was the absolute WORST dinner I have ever been to ! I have waitressed and am sympathetic to the things that can go wrong and be patient but this was absolutely the worst! We sat down with 15 people for our reservation and was seated outside
. We sat down and When we asked for water they said they were running low on cups but will try to see how at they can get . They were out of plates for over half hour. We didn't get sides for over an hour , rice for at least that 30 min since they were out then we got mushy rice . We couldn't order meat for 30 min but didn't get it for almost an hour but only after we asked for a manager . They said they were out of rice paper then received it at the end of our dinner . The bathrooms were dirty and trash spilling out with things out of order .
What was out of order was the whole place ! We changed our own canisters removed our own plates refilled our own sauces and the only good thing about this whole place was josh who was a manager who tried when he could. We had started our dinner at 8 and rice paper came at 10 . There were roaches on the ground and will never go there again

author: Monica B.
review text:
VEGAN UN-INCLUSIVE.
I landed here for a party.  Obviously not my choice given the name, but unless you're vegan and feeling like maybe the world has become vegan-friendly enough for you and you decide to venture into this place for a little change you'll feel completely out of place.  They do offer a 50% off your tab but given that only 1 out of 38 things on the menu is vegan friendly it's a slap in the face with a "Silly vegan!  You think we care about you?  Ha ha!" message.

author: Téa F.
review text: Was good at first! But then managed to find a lot of plastic in my brisket. Server didn't do much, oh well:(

author: Sally M.
review text: It was very busy on a Friday night with a 40 minute wait. It's a typical AYCE Korean BBQ with many locations of this restaurant. Our waiter was missing for about 15 minutes. So service was not good. There are other choice out there.

author: Bea Y.
review text: Ordered to go and I feel so gipped!!!!! Paid an extra $ for the bbq ribs and where's the meat?! How does this equate to $30?????! There's no meat on the bones at all besides 1 piece.

author: David L.
review text:
This location recently opened patio dine-in and I was there with my family yesterday. My experience was so infuriating I wrote to the corporate office about it.

Bulletpointing what went wrong:

- We sat down, waiting for meat menu. no one mentioned about having to scan QR code for menu, so we sat there for about 10 minutes before the server asked us if we know what we want

- We aren't allowed to cook ourselves and all grilling is done in the kitchen. Waited 25 minutes before our first round of 3 items: brisket, hawaiian steak, bulgogi.

- They used home style frying pan where they just dumped all 3 meat, juices mixed up, unflavored brisket was marinated in bulgogi sauce as a result. It was soaggy mess. the presentation was pathetic. see pictures.

- Our 2nd batch came about 30 minutes after we ordered. We sat down at  12:15, got our 2nd batch around 1:20. By then we were no longer hungry

- We were charged full price came out to $85 including undeserved 20% tip for me and my wife + 2 kids aged 3 and 6.

I've been a fan of the chain since Tustin location opened 10 years ago. Never coming back again.

author: Nathan P.
review text: Don't believe any 4-star reviews .. Keala and Ryan killed it last time we were here for dinner and Keala again today for Memorial Day! It was super busy but they were on it and had super fast service. Last time people were complaining because they had to wait for a table on a Saturday night when it's busy? It's a weekend what do you expect. The servers don't get enough credit for their hard work, 10/10 service. The food was great, hats off to the chef. But be will be back because of the awesome staff

author: Michael J.
review text: We had the Blue fin belly, the sashimi sampler platter and a few other specialty dishes. The Blue fin belly, which is probably the most expensive dish they serve... proved worth it. Exemplary. Wonderful. Came with a raw quail egg and adorned with gold flake and fish roe. Dine in is back and the service was wonderful. Very friendly staff. Couldn't sit at the bar yet but we had quick, responsive service and really... it's a sushi place.... the fish was wonderful. And the cost is right on par with good fish.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Don't order takeout from this place!

We ordered two 7 meat meals from Gen that should've included 14 portions of meat.  When the food was delivered, we only received 4-5 servings.  Honest mistake, I thought.

I called to explain the situation and the person who answered, Veronica, seemed annoyed that we had a problem with our order.  She told us that since we had the food delivered by DoorDash that she won't help us and we're out of luck without offering any solutions, options or any type of customer service.  Veronica was condescending in the way she spoke to me, as if we were trying to cheat them out of a few pieces of meat.  She clearly wasn't equipped to handle customer issues.

Zero stars for this experience and a bad mark for Gen.

author: K T.
review text:
Haven't had kbbq in awhile and decided to try this location. The take out deal that they are having is great. Plenty of meat, rice and sides for $11 ($23 for more meat).

Unfortunately, it seems I had my bad luck strike again and I found a strand of hair in my food. After I pulled out the long hair that was halfway going white, I pretty much lost my appetite. With the pandemic going on, I would had hope this place would at least try to be sanitary and cautious.

I'm sure that this isn't a recurring thing that happens, but would likely not try this place again. I'll stick to grilling my own meat and venture out to my usual kbbq spot.

author: Julie N.
review text:
Always a nice, nearby place to go for KBBQ! What's great about this gen location is that the wait is never too bad. I arrived with a party of 9 at around 8pm on a Saturday and the wait was only 20 minutes. The servers were also really attentive and quickly changed the grill or gave us more sides whenever we needed it.

My favorite meats here are the galbi, brisket, bulgogi, and the beef tongue! The potato salad and kimchi are also great to have refills of. Pro tip, you can ask for rice paper as well - I always eat the meat with the rice paper.

author: Lishya H.
review text: Haven't been to Gen for a while and tonight it was a great night. The Hawaiian steak, kalbi, beef tongue, everything was delish. Service was very attentive. My two daughters were asking for more of the Hawaiian steak. Very moist, juicy, and flavorful! Thank you to our waitress, JOY, for such a great service, as usual ...!!!!

author: John T.
review text:
This is on their takeout what WAS $22 for 7 meats and 5 sides. The price is now $23, and o ordered 2 briskets, 2 Galbi (upcharge $1/ea = $2), smoked pork belly , spicy pork bulgogi, and cajun shrimp. With all the hype about Gen is why I got for tonight's dinner.  But disappointed...the brisket was more like 1 order and the Galbi was only 1 piece!

The plus was nice hostess and found out that they're now open for dine-in. But leaves a bad taste for my first time at this location, and unfortunately heard that the Rowland Heights location is permanently closed.

author: Reanna Kealle P.
review text: DO NOT EAT HERE!!! I've been here a few times & every experience is horrible. They lack customer service. You will literally have to get a servers attention to get anything you want. None of them will just check in on you to see how your meal is going. Some of the servers are just rude & impatient & it SHOWS! Today will be the last time I will EVER dine at this location. My husband & I went in for lunch & noticed that there were numerous clear strands in our meat. The only reason we noticed was because my husband pulled one out of his mouth. Mind you, as this was happening, our grill was burning; in need of a grill change. I COUNTED TWO SERVERS WHO MADE EYE CONTACT WITH ME BUT THEY JUST WALKED AWAY. It came to the point where I had to ask the bartender for a manager. The manager came & apologized for the inconvenience. He mentioned that the strands we found in our meat was "just plastic" & honestly didn't sound too concerned. Like what do you mean it's "JUST PLASTIC?!" That is not ok. He offered to change out our plates & etc. I'm sorry, but if I were him, I would've just comped the entire meal. But nope, he offered a new table setting even after I mentioned I had already lost my appetite. By the way one of our meats never came until I mentioned it to the manager as I was complaining. Seriously the WORST restaurant to eat at. DO NOT EAT HERE!

author: Ryan M.
review text: This restaurant is intentionally deceptive and purposely serves less food than stated on the menu. I ordered a meal from Uber Eats on August 5th. There's an option to add a 4 oz side of green tea salt. The container is marked only 3.25 oz, therefore the restaurant never intended to deliver the order volume. It was then only 3/4 full. Furthermore, the container only weighed 1.48 ounces. If this is representative of their integrity, I'm scared to see what goes on in the food prep areas. Avoid at all costs.

author: Steven C.
review text:
This review is based on the take out I just bought.

First off I appreciate that they are trying to stay open amidst the stay at home order and I wanted to show my support for local businesses. I had come here multiple times in the past for ayce kbbq and it was very decent for the price.

So when I saw that they were selling take out I wanted to satisfy my kbbq craving as well as reminisce about those by gone days of in person dining. However it is far from what I had expected.

I had ordered the 7 meat dinner with brisket, kalbi, steak and pork belly. I saw that the workers were cooking the food at the tables in lieu of the guests and was hoping it would taste like what I used to have. Wrong. All the meats were overcooked, tough and dry. Particularly the kalbi and steak which were burnt to a crisp and tasted more like Korean beef jerky.

I really did hope it would be relatively close to in person bbq but I think after today I'll just have to wait for when they reopen.

author: Naomi G.
review text: I was very impressed by how Gen updated their safety protocols to protect customers during the COVID-19 pandemic. There was a 6ft space among groups, plexi glass among tables, and temperature check before you walk in. There was limited seating capacity and I felt that there was less staff available to serve the tables. This made getting our food and sides a little slower than what I'm used to here. Overall the dishes were good and for the 16.99 lunch deal this can't be beat!

author: Raeanna D.
review text: I'm person dining is great and so are the servers but take out is such a rip off. This is supposed to be 6 meats for $26?! The garlic pork belly was 3 small pieces and the spicy pork belly was 3 pieces too! I'm having a hard time believing that this is actually the serving size. I'm really disappointed because I usually am really satisfied with this place.

author: Jacob T.
review text: They are doing amazing with everything during this pandemic!!! Sanitation, customer satisfaction, speed, service everything is amazing. Yeah it takes a while to get your seating but that's because they are booming with customers and have to clean everything for your safety. 10/10 highly recommend!!!

author: Elizabeth M.
review text: Really cool environment and perfect for large groups, and very big portions of food. I'm not really big on Korean BBQ and tonight this place was okay the meats were very gamy and no flavor. The  only thing I really liked was the salad appetizer. The rice was too sticky. I've had better to be honest. The atmosphere is cool tho for large groups and enjoy the experience of cooking together.

author: Anjanette G.
review text: Extremely slow service. Took forever to get our meat, they also placed uncooked chicken with beef on same plate... then cooked chicken with uncooked chicken. /: . Servers were nice and smiled , but this outside seating just doesn't work here. Check took a while to come and be picked up, had to take it inside to pay so we could leave. Food was good! Rice paper was fresh! Just wish things went back to normal already! #RecallGavinNewsom

author: Norman S.
review text:
Last meal of the trip! It's was hella quiet in the restaurant. Not sure if it was too early or something but it was nice.

There were 8 of us and we sat four and four with two burners. I'm always amazed at how much selection American buffets and AYCE has to offer and this place didn't disappoint! The meats that came out were amazing and the portions were generous!

The service was prompt and they replaced the burners regularly without having to be asked.  There were only maybe 3 servers max but never had to really wait for anything.

Love how they have Macaron ice cream sandwiches at the front you could order! That was a nice feature and the kids were dying to eat them.
