One thing that happened was the server dropped a cup of water and it spilled some over my daughters chair and clothes. It wasn't a big deal but something to be noted.

author: Watkins L.
review text:
This a AYCE Korean bbq joint with the same name in many cities all around so cal. I was disappointed to see my experience this time, as I decided to come here to try again after visiting the location in Alhambra. Maybe it was New Year Eve, but the service was just lacking. Maybe there was too many tables to one server, or maybe it was just the waiter that we had. I want to give everyone a heads up, if you do plan to come here, to know that most of the dishes and Ban Chan is spicy.  Even the side salad was spicy. Don't expect to get any green tea ice cream after, at least if there was, it wasn't offered to us.

Food
For $23 a person, the choices you are offered isnt bad at all. Some of the things that you ordered that was good was the Galbi, Brisket and Rice Cake. Note that they no longer serve steam egg, and any soup you order will be spicy and not have much ingredients inside. A few of the plates we got food served to us was broken, and it just felt like there was a lack of quality of service. There was many times that we asked for more ban Chan, or Daikon, but it never came. Also the fact that NO one else would stop to help besides our own server was frustrating. If that was the case, I would hope that the server only had a few tables. It was to a point where the bus boys seem to be more helpful, and genuinely thoughtful. It joust felt like everyone would do things the lazy way. Like I saw a a worker refilling cups that stacked what looked like 20 water cups high,  so that they wouldn't have to walk back to grab the rest. I was more worried that they would fall.

Ambiance
This place has plenty of parking, sharing parking with other locations, and it is a pretty big place, but when we went, a whole other section was closed, maybe due to the amount of workers. If you are into watching sports, there are multiple TV'a for your entertainment.

Like I mentioned before, maybe it was just an off night, where they didn't have much people working, but I experienced what I did. Food is good for the price, just hope that the service improves. Maybe we will try it again some time in the future. Until then.

author: Emmett T.
review text:
I have been to this spot twice now, and each time there was no wait for seating. The interior was dark with neon blue lighting as if you were walking into a nightclub. The menu for proteins and seafood was very extensive with about 30 different choices available (about eight fewer selections for lunch). The dinner price of $21.99 per adult was a great deal compared to other AYCE Korean BBQ places I have visited in SoCal.

There were a couple of areas that I thought could use improvement. First, the tables at the booths seemed rather small. For our party of four, we seemed to run out of space quickly for plates when the meats and banchan were brought out from the kitchen. Speaking of banchan, that was another weakness as the variety was below average compared to its competitors. I did like the rice paper and rice cake though.

I can't wait until they open up their first restaurant in the greater San Diego area within the next several weeks. The demand there will be tremendous so I hope the servers can keep up. Maybe they will employ robots to bring items out of the kitchen as has been done at some Gen Korean BBQ House locations.

author: Benedict A.
review text:
So similar to the one in Rancho Cucamonga but so different in their customer service.  I can now see what half a star difference really means now.  Because the food at both is the same.  Same prices, same set up, same drinks, only thing difference is customer service.  And man did they bring it!!!  Several employees handling the same table asking us if we were ready to order if we wanted our grill to be changed out, getting us more water.  They were just really on it, even for a busy sunday night.  They must've changed out our grill 6 or 7 times in less than 2 hours, keeping it nice and clean with no burnt flavors.  Portion sizes maybe a little bit smaller, but they're both all you can eat.  So no biggie.  But they brought out the bulgogi or the brisket out so fast and regularly that our table was never without protein.  
Customer service was so on point, that it elevated the entire dinner.  I would not mind driving all the way out here for my korean bbq fix because its so much better than the one in Rancho Cucamonga!!

author: Jessica C.
review text: Came here for lunch around 1:30 on a Sunday and it was a 45 min wait. Covid precautions: a machine scans your temperature, staff wears masks, plastic barrier in certain places but they still seat people without like skipping tables. When something is AYCE, it's just a busy place and feels hectic but all the employees come by and try to be attentive and efficient without grumbling and didn't ever show that they are overwhelmed though I'm sure they felt it. Our waiter Alex was very friendly. The reason I'm really giving five stars is bc I'm glad this Gen hasn't increased their prices unlike other AYCE restaurants--especially since I'm sure Covid has made things harder but I think the price is super reasonable. Gen first came out to be known for their meat quality and variety and nothing has changed. Still pretty good quality at way better prices than other places. I really hope they don't change it. It was $24.99 for weekend (same price for holiday and dinner). I hadn't been to Gen forever even before the pandemic, but with this location's service, price, uncomplicated menu, and quality, I'll definitely be returning.

author: Razi M.
review text: First off I'm happy that they are still open during this whole quarantine thing. Called in and spoke to Hallie she was very friendly and helpful. I told her I saw this $10 deal on IG and she said yes what two meats would you like and named all the meats. Also helped me pick out sides, told me it would take 10 minutes. I walked in and Hallie was in front cleaning so I knew they were taking everything serious. She had a big smile and proceeded to check me out and even gave me a roll of toilet paper. I appreciate this kind of service and would definitely recommend this place to anyone who misses Korean bbq during these times. (They should make Hallie the manager if she isn't already.)

author: Genise S.
review text: Ordering to go was a pain. I had to repeat myself at least 3 times as they were having technical difficulties on their end which happens and it's fine, but the guy who was helping me was impatient. I was asking questions on how the to go menu works to which he says, "ok, first time ordering." My mom even commented on how it seemed like he was bothered taking my order. Had a little trouble picking up as well from an error on their side. They asked if I've already paid since the order was closed. Had to wait for them to fix it. I think biggest disappointment is that the to go order was definitely skimpy. I get that it won't be piles of food, but to get 3 PCs of shrimp, 3 PCs of pork belly? And not to top off the container for the sides? Also, the plain japchae counts as a meat and not a side, lol. I am still avoiding indoor and outdoor dining for now and would rather order for take out, but won't be ordering here again.

author: Jenny L.
review text:
I've been to plenty of Gens before but this was my first time at this location. The decor is what you would expect from Gens, it's dark and it smells amazing inside. We probably waited for 10-15 minutes before we got seated but after we got seated we were able to get our order in quickly.

The marinated kalbi was my favorite. It is just so good! It was my friend's first time at a KBBQ place and she loved it. Her favorite was bulgogi. There's plenty of meat on each plate and I believe we ate our $22 dollars back.

The service was amazing. The waiter replenished our sides and salads very quickly. The grill was changed whenever it got smoky. They did leave an item off our order but that was quickly addressed when we talked to our waiter.

I love going to Gens and this one was no exception!

author: Nadine S.
review text: Joy is so attentive & on point! Thank you for recommending the best apps and sake! She was there to deliver all the sauces and sides I needed and brought salads constantly!! We enjoyed our time & will be back

author: Ray L.
review text:
Decor 3.7 stars
Service 4.3 stars
Food 4 stars

Located in a plaza in Chino Hills.
On the day of Thanksgiving, my uncle's family and I decided to have AYCE Korean BBQ for lunch before we have turkey for dinner. ( no wonder I had food coma)

The servers were friendly, prompt and attentive.
We ordered Soondoboo / Spicy Tofu stew ( recommended), Cajun Shrimp ( is a must), Chicken, Fried Calamari, Beef tongue, Bulgogi .(try to eat with rice wrapper/rice paper and salad)

I was amazed how I didn't smell BBQ on my clothes after. And thanks to Dave , we definitely enjoyed our family time there.

Happy Grilling!!!!

author: Manuel P.
review text: Overall 5 stars all around! Everything tasted amazing and a big shout out to my servers Kyle and Dre! This was my first experience at Korean BBQ and they were extremely helpful and very friendly! I'll definitely be back just cause of the amazing service!

author: Arian R.
review text: This was overall such a great experience. The food was amazing and our Servers totally killed it. Thank you so much Erick, Brian and Hyelee for making our night rememberable and a lot of fun. They also recommended us some awesome food & were super quick to serve it. We will be back!!

author: Liz N.
review text:
Awesome!
Shout out to our server Alex H. And the rest of the staff you guys were wonderful. Our family didn't dine for that long but the staff changed our grill plate 3 times (and a 4th was going to happen if I let him). Food was equally as awesome. My 3 kiddos all said they loved the place. One even mentioned how good the service was and how nice everyone was there.
Can't wait to go back if we are ever in the area ;)

author: Bbchi C.
review text: Horrible. No service. Everything was freaking slow. Waited more than an hour for our table, that's fine. We understand No salad, no side dish until we asked for it. Took forever for the meat to come. Never change our grill either. I ended up spending 4 hours for this meal, that gave you an idea how slow and bad they are. Also, the staffs are wearing their face mask incorrectly, I saw their noses. Such a terrible experience!

author: Kenny C.
review text:
This place was fantastic.
We had to choose between Thai and Korean BBQ, and we had a group of 4 people. My wife insisted we go to Gen Korean BBQ. We all grudgingly agreed and went to Gen Korean BBQ.
We arrive. Great atmosphere. Nice tint of blue light around the whole restaurant.
Sit down. And we have a stove in front of us. We choose to do the all you can eat, and our waiter gave us his simple recommendations and we were on our way. He brings out the food uncooked, and we started cooking and then.... game over.
This place knocked our socks off. We tried EVERYTHING! Cajun shrimp, volcano chicken, steak, red wine pork, Hawaiian pork, and even cow tongue.
Food was fresh and delicious.
Let me just say, I loved being the chef and cooking my food. I probably ate too much raw food tonight because of my inexperience, but I enjoyed every minute and every bite.
Thank you. Thank you for pleasing my appetite and most importantly my soul.

author: Ray C.
review text: The orders we got was very disappointing.  When I called they told me that they make everything well done, but is burnt to a crisp.  Horrible service because when I called she started to laugh and thought it was funny.

author: Jen K.
review text: Came here for an early dinner... they were very understaffed at the time and it took us over ten minutes to be seated even though only 2 tables were sat. Our waitress was very nice and the one manager there seemed to really try, though the outcome was very poor service. Although another manager did show up eventually as well as another server, wait time for any service did not improve. A manager mopped the floors in front of the kitchen in front of us for about 15-20 min as our table grew more and more covered in dirty dishes, our old plates and napkins were not picked up once, and we waited with empty glasses. The air must have been having issues as it was very hot, even the employees paced around fanning themselves. Food was good but service was unacceptable. When a simple task such as clearing plates and napkins goes ignored, not much else matters.

author: Brian L.
review text:
Came in last weekend, and they're still running promotions to advertise their grand opening. We happily left the restaurant with some free pins and Sapporo Beer bottle opener keychains. Perhaps even better than that were the free samples of fruit flavored soju that kept coming around the restaurant. We're slated to get a Gen down in Hawaii soon, and I hope it was at least as good as this.

It's very trendy (and loud) in here, and you can probably tell your food is going to taste good from the slick of grease on the floor when you enter the dining area. The selection of meat is really good here, and the banchan don't taste too bad either.

We really enjoyed the beef tongue, although it was a little on the thin side. After a few shots of soju, if you're not paying attention, your tongue is donezos. Other items worth mentioning were the garlic samgyeopsal and the Hawaiian steak, Hawaiian in name and pineapple garnish  only of course. Make sure you order the samjang bean paste and ask for garlic to throw onto the grill with the meat. Gen has different types of bossam to wrap your food in including daikon and ddeok aside from the traditional lettuce.

The only thing off putting here was the staff. The only person on shift who was legitimately friendly and helpful was Rebecca. Lawrence, who was introduced as our server, was essentially MIA for most of the night. On top of that, he said the name of the restaurant incorrectly. This other guy, who seemed to be in charge was pretty cocky and arrogant. He also kept changing the grills way too often, something I'd never imagined I'd complain about in my life. He was really good at coming in at the perfect time to ruin the char on your meat, tossing your almost grilled items onto a new unheated grill, essentially sentencing them to boil and steam to death. Keep the Rebeccas, trash the rest of them.

author: Adrian T.
review text: One of the worst Korean places I've been to. Service was bad. 3 guys waiting on us , so you know there was lots of confusion cuz they take your order by memory then got to another tables & do the same. Some things we asked for never came. There bon chon sucks! 3 measly bowls with baby servings. The clean grill on pic was us waiting to put SUMTHING on it after our second order. measly portions of meat you saw for four hungry adults! & how are to mix your salt & oil when there in one plate with a divider, one on each side. If you want better service & food. Go across the 71 & eat @ wang cho! We thot we'd try gen cuz of all the hype.

author: Jacqueline H.
review text:
Came in tonight for the grand opening and have never been to a Gen KBBQ before. Surprised that they decided to open in this location because Wang Cho is just down the street, but it was pretty good!

Great, fast and efficient service - especially due to the amount of people in here tonight. It's a great place for dinner because they have tons of drink options - not good if you don't like loud restaurants though.

Food wise, it was pretty good. The steak and pork belly were the best on the dinner menu!

author: Joyce H.
review text:
I had family visiting from out of town, and wanted to pick a fun place for dinner.  I thought this would be a solid choice since I've been to other Gen locations before.  The staff was friendly.  That's probably the best thing of the night.  

1.  Our salad had plastic bag fragments in it.  The restaurant lighting is dim, and this could probably be easily missed.  How many people have unknowningly ingested plastic?
2.  They were out of radish.  Initially, they said it was thawing out in the back and would take time.  Then, they said they were out.
3.  They were out of japchae scraps.  We asked for a plate of the noodles (which is usually included in the banchan at places like Wang Cho), and the plate came out with short pieces of scraps.  When we wanted more, we were told that they were out for the evening.  I guess it's only made once a day?
4.  Rice was not ready.  This was a surprise.  My cousin asked for rice, and we were told they had to cook it.  We reminded them in between courses, and it was still cooking until we were almost done with our meal.
5.  Dishes forgotten.  We ordered about 8 meat dishes for 3 people at the start of the meal.  They brought 3 and forgot the rest.  I had to remind them about a few things.  At the end of the night, we still never got the beef tongue or marinated pork that we asked for.
6.  No steamed egg.  Ok, this one isn't anyone's fault.  They said it was removed from the menu because people were not ordering it.  But my friends and I love this stuff so I'm going to have to find a place that serves it next time.

The atmosphere was ok.  The bathrooms were clean, though one was out of order.  The staff was nice.  I still enjoyed catching up with family, and some of the meat dishes were tasty.  However, this didn't impress me the way I expected.  Korean bbq isn't an everyday affair, and I think it should always be a great experience when people do go.  Please find a system to get orders right, to have rice and sides in stock, and to ensure inedible materials are not left in the food that is served!

author: Cheryl H.
review text:
Our server Tim the Asian "Tim" was our best server experience since I've been coming here.
I will be sure to return and hope that he is here again!
His attentive service has def deserved all 5 *****

author: Carol N.
review text:
The boyfriend and I have tried all three Korean BBQ all you can eat places that we found in Chino. This place is our favorite of the 3, we also tried Wang Cho and Gangnam. This place is more reasonable priced than Wang Cho, being $21 for dinner. For $21, you have more than 30 items to choose from, which is more than you can eat in one sitting. They have sides at the table, as well as some others you can ask for too, such as rice paper, japchae, and rice. They also have hot sides such as popcorn  chicken and calamari, both of which are delicious! We ended up having the same waiter, Eric, both times we went. He was great, friendly and brought out things and took our order as soon as he could. Second time was much more busy... so some things took longer. I like that even though you have a primary waiter, all the workers here will tend to you! They all grab empty plates from your table, bring you your meats, and refill your drinks. Some other places that we've been to, they plates sit at your table, stacked up until your waiter comes to take it... I also like that they constantly change your grills when it needs to be changed. My favorite things to get here are the brisket, short ribs, popcorn chicken, calamari, pork belly, shrimp, japchae, bulgoli, and I'm pretty sure a few others that I cannot think of at the moment.

The vibe here is very hipster. There's always pop music playing and a mood lighting. I would say it's like eating Korean BBQ at a club! If you come for your birthday, be prepared for the staff to be super energized and sign out loud to you!! It seems like they really have fun with it! Lunch prices are a little cheaper, I think like $15, and obviously the selection is a bit less.

This is our favorite Korean BBQ place in the Chino area. You'll find us here again in the future!

author: Mac L.
review text:
Excellent choice. Kyle our server was great. Great attitude, staff were all friendly and upbeat. Food was fantastic.   Awesome place‼
The ambiance was excellent. Price was reasonable..

author: Frank Z.
review text:
One of the best korean bbq places anywhere near LA.

Nothing beats Gen for its combination of value, quality and service. The few times I've been here, it has never left me unsatisfied. First of all, for the price, Gen offers a HUGE menu during lunch and dinner times. You can get so many different meats, my favorite are the Hawaiian steak and the beef cheek.

The quality of the meat, the banchan (sides) and everything else is 10/10. Also, the service is outstanding. Never before have I had a waiter who never complained or showed any sign of annoyance when me and my table would be constantly asking for more sides, rice, meat, or rice paper. Every time we asked, the waiter brought it out with no hesitation.

Gen is a true all you can eat kbbq joint and it is definitely worth your time and money. P.S. try the cajun sauce, it literally goes well with any meat.

author: Tiffany N.
review text: I'm baaaaack, but at a different location haha. Great service once again, food is always amazing! Grabbed some beers with some friends too!

author: Sherry G.
review text: This was amazing!  The servers work in teams and they run their area very efficiently.  The meats looked fresh and clean.  The table is pre-set with all the condiments.  Awesome for just two but also looks like fun for a group!  Definitely recommend...just know that you will smell like BBQ after..

author: Anthony P.
review text:
A solid KBBQ joint. I've been here probably 3 times now. The decor is nice, modern, and feels upscale. The service is generally pretty good. This last time I went it wasn't very good at all. Thankfully a server, David, who wasn't our server kept coming through and saving the day. Whenever we eat KBBQ we don't eat all day then come and eat everything. The first round of meat too so long we ended up eating all of our sides before anything got to us. Then they brought out the brisket but not the steak we ordered. We ate the brisket and had some major down time till the other stuff came out. This was the first time the service was slow like this. Normally there isn't much down time between plates of meat.

The music they had playing was very inappropriate in my opinion. They were playing very ratchet trap music mostly. Every now and then a calm song would come on but it was mostly loud trap music which I did not enjoy. It made having a conversation difficult.

My friend and I were quite extra, always asking for extra sides and what not and they did bring out a large bowl of kimchi, potato salad, and cabbage which was very nice. The premium steak was a very large piece, probably 8 ounces. Meat quality was on point, can't complain about that at all. The sides were also very good. Generally we pick this KBBQ place because of the sides.

All in all this is a good place. Service was bad one out of three times which isn't too bad. I will most likely return when I'm in the area and want KBBQ.

author: Briana R.
review text:
Excellent experience. The staff was extremely friendly, and the food was amazing.
I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The atmosphere is very kick back, with hip-hop/rap music playing in the background, and relaxing dim lighting.
We will definitely be coming back!
Thanks Marlon and Matt! You guys were great.

author: Marijane R.
review text:
This was our first time dining here. Nice atmosphere not too smoky like at other bbq joints I've been to.

The person at the front desk needs to be a bit happier and welcoming when greetong guests. Otherwise, the staff there was helpful and always tended to our table. We were a party of 5 seated right away on a Wednesday.  

Erick was our server and he was AWESOME.  He always came back to check on us and made sure our grill was always fresh. This is probably what is going to differentiate other Bbq places is the customer service and the quality of the food. There was a wide variety of meat selections.  And it was more meat than fat.  The marinated meats were not drenched in marination so it wasn't too sweet and blackened when grilled. There was no up charge for different meats or seafood. One price -Cost per adult was $20.99 and kids 5-10 were half off.  4 and under ate free.

We will definitely be back to eat here.  Great place for family gatherings too.

author: Sheryll R.
review text:
We went there today. Staff was really slow. We were so hungry but we have to wait for the meat. Second round of meat was even worst. We have to wait for almost 30-40 minutes for the meat to be served. I also ordered a chicken pop for my toddler, geez my toddler has no appetite by the time the order was served. Not kids friendly. The staff even told us that there was only 1 person in the kitchen! we came there to eat and we expect a better service specially they charge us $21 per person, to think it was an early brunch.
In terms of cleanliness, yikes the floor was filthy and sleepery. We were seated at the left side, I almost slip! I think its an oil build up. The table was filthy and not clean! When you touch the table it was sticky and yucky! Our griller was filthy and dirty and so the waiter changed it when the black liquid start coming out feom the griller plate when the fire was on. I have been here multiple times. I am dissappointed and I hope they will take action so the they can maintain a good review.

author: Angelica L.
review text:
Came here for my grandma's birthday with 20 of my family members. Neil did a great job handling all 5 tables! The food was super good & it came out promptly after being prepared. Grill changes were fast and just overall customer service was amazing. If you try anything here get crazy sauce brisket. It's not on the menu, but it was something Neil recommended!

Will come here again for another party!

author: Selena W.
review text: Usually I don't have any trouble with this gen bbq, but on Wednesday March 27 at around 9pm, my family and I decided to go eat, and let me tell you that the service was unbearably slow. I thought they were short staffed, but there were clearly 4 servers and a manager out that day. Our server was no where to be found most of the time, so we were there for 2 hours because we couldn't order more food most of the time. Not to mention we were playing Tetris with our dishes. The employees would walk by our table several times and would not take our plates. They even brought more plates of meat out for us and tried to fit it on our cluttered table. Our server didn't even take the plates for us when we ordered food. I don't know if it was an off night for them, but I just think this was unacceptable. At least we entertained ourselves with stacking plates as high as we could that day!

author: Joi B.
review text:
FIRST OF ALL! Shout out to the best server, NIEL. Everytime I go to this place, I always get him and I leave satisfied with his accommodating service and the GREAT food!!!

Place is NEAT.
Food is GREAT.
Price is AFFORDABLE
Service is PHENOMENAL.
People are AWESOME.

I would give more stars if I could. Ill add it to my comments!

author: Jasmine C.
review text:
Sticky rice cakeeeee! Lub!
We had 2 kinds of soju, lychee+yogurt & peach, very girlie and tasty! Love love !
Specially shout out to Buddha, (well I work overseas now, and don't come back very often) and you made my day! Thanks !!!

author: Nirmeen S.
review text:
The quality of the meat was good and the service was amazing. We had two people waiting on us, and both were very nice, but one was exceptionally great. Our server Matthew was so attentive and eager to help us with anything that we asked for. He was polite, fast, and friendly. If every server was like Matthew, all businesses would flourish. Keep up the great work:)

The restaurant was very  clean.  The peach soju was delicious! The portions were pretty small last time I went, but this time they were decent. It is AYCE, so it shouldn't matter but I don't like asking for things several times. The bulgogi & the brisket are my personal favorite. Since we went with a few friends we expanded our horizons and tried beef tongue (wasn't a fan) and pork belly. The pork belly was very tasty but does have a lot of fat!

Overall, we had a pleasant experience and would recommend GEN & come back again. Thanks again Matthew!

author: Leonard A.
review text: Making a good impression usually keeps them coming back,I'm definitely coming back.The hostess was very friendly and gave us a detailed run down on the menu.The decor had a lounge feel to it and very clean.Panda Alex was taking care of us that night.He must of worked at a fine dining place because he was on point like point can be.He was very welcoming and his interaction with us made me feel like we were buds.I came in with a large party so we ordered almost everything.The food was great,no complaints.Panda Alex did recommend to cook the pork cheek with kimchi.Dude,that was probably the highlight of my night,really tasty.We also ordered the macaroons for dessert but by the time they came out,we were tapped out.If food here is good,I'm pretty sure the macaroons are too.Thanks to Panda Alex for making our dining experience here a memorable one.

author: Cam C.
review text:
I give this place 3.5 stars, but that's not an option so I will round up.

Chino Hills Gen has the best service I have ever encountered at any AYCE Korean BBQ establishment to date. I came with my family on a Friday evening after work and it was slowly getting busier as the night went on, but everything we ordered came out in an expedited manner and anything we needed was brought out to us in a blink an eye.

37 items on the menu, but I tried no more than 10.

Minus .5 stars because even though their cajun shrimp was something I ordered on every round, it was clear it was on the older side since it was pasty instead of firm.

Minus 1 star because they don't have the pre-made egg soup, you have to cook it yourself over the grill. And also because their fermented bean stew is heavily oversalted (to the point of being inedible), and their tofu soup is beyond bland.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Man, so I'm sitting here in GEN and I just finished eating what seemed to be everything, but everything was so good.. I mean everything.
I really want to emphasize how great the food is, you literally can not go wrong with anything on the menu!
We lucked out and got "Neil" as our waiter, he pretty much picked everything for us since it was our first time and everything her selected rocked and he showed us neat ways of cooking the meats.
The best part tho was leaving and having that Thanks-Giving feeling!

author: Tuyen H.
review text:
Experience at this Gen has to be the best ones I've been to. Service was quick and the staff always made sure we were comfortable and satisfied! Nicole and Paul were the best servers anyone can ask for. For a place only opened for about two months pretty effieicient! I would definitely recommend coming here for AYCE kkbq. Huge selection and their prices are pretty cheap compared to other places! Dunner$19.99 and lunch I believe was $13-14.99

Recommendations:
- Pork cheek
- Cajun shrimp
- pork tongue
- bulgogi
- garlic shrimp
- half Cajun pork belly
- kalbi

author: Quinn C.
review text:
Came here for date night with the wife to our favorite restaurant. We got seated promptly and our server Ryan was friendly and easy to talk to. As we were walking to our table, I noticed that the floor is extremely slippery from possible grease. This is a possible issue in the future for a customer to slip and fall. I've been to other Korean bbq spots and their floors tend to be slippery too. So I don't know what they can do to manage the grease spills throughout the day.

When we got our food, everything was on point. The only negative was the rice paper. This was my first time ever at any gen where the edges of the rice paper were hard and stale and not soft like the rest of the paper.

The service from Ryan was initially great. However, as the night went on, Ryan had more tables to wait on in his section which caused him to be less attentive to our table. This isn't a knock on him, but on management to have less tables that waiters are responsible for. At the end of our meal, the wife wanted a half order of brisket since we were both getting full. We waited close to 15 minutes for that small plate to come out. Ryan came to us about 3 times saying he was going to check on that order. Then we had 2 other staff ask if we were done eating, since we were just sitting there, but told them we were still waiting on another order. They said they will check on our order but still, nothing came out. All this was happening as tables right next to us were placing their order and getting it right away.

With the exception of the rice paper and last order, everything else is good and you get what gen has become famous for.

With any restaurant, there will always be off days but hopefully they see this review and continue to make improvements in all areas since they are brand new.

Will today's experience stop me from coming again? Of course not. I just hope the service and quality of food does not diminish causing gen to become just another restaurant.

author: Michael M.
review text:
All I can say is WOW! WOW! WOW!

I hate to let the cat out of the bag... I really would like to keep GEN Korean BBQ in Chino Hills a secret because once everyone finds out about this place it will be packed!

My friend Mike and I were honored today by being the very first customers of the Chino Hills location. I have been to the GEN's in Fountain Valley, Corona, Rancho Cucamonga, and let me tell you that the Chino Hills location was every bit as good as the other locations and better!

If you have never been to a GEN's you have to go! I rate it a 5 Star but would actually give them a 10 Star if it was available. GEN is not just a restaurant, it is an Experience! Here is why:

First the ambiance and decor are elegantly beautiful and the background music is hip yet suitable for any age. It is obvious that the design was well thought, planned, and an investment.

The food items served for you to cook at your table are fresh, flavorful, quality, and eye appealing. Yes I did say "cook at your table!" That is what makes GEN different from other restaurants and a fun and great experience for family and friends.

Service was Amazing! Our server was right on top of everything from greeting us right away to suggesting items, taking our orders, and even teaching us about the rice paper and cooking. The General manager "Vince" came by and introduced himself along with Madelene a manger in training... to me this is something every manager should do and both of them did it well! We also met a gentleman by the name Eric who gave us a history on how GEN came to be.

The best part is the price. At only $14.99 for lunch and $19.99 for dinner it is a True Value! Remember this is for "All You Can Eat" and I mean "All You Can Eat". You can order as much as you want from a selection of 38 items at dinner and 27 items at lunch. All items are plentiful and i promise you will not leave GEN's hungry.

Chino Hills get on over to GEN's before the rest of the surrounding communities find the secret and hidden GEM!

author: Jaypee W.
review text:
1. Service = perfect (jeffrey)

2. Ambiance = perfect

3. Food = very good

4. Overall = 5stars..

author: Heather S.
review text: I live in St. George utah and stop by this place every time I'm in town! Been to two other locations and this is by far the best location! Food is fresh and so yummy! Glass noodle are good and so is the Hawaiian steak! The staff is always on top of grill changes and refilling cups! Like there selection of veggies although my husband and I aren't fans of onions so we always opt out of onions on the veggies

author: Don C.
review text:
The new Korean BBQ spot is here. Im starving and it looks like Im customer #3. Hawaiian Steak and Chadol as always!

They even cooked it for me. :)

author: Kaitlyn L.
review text:
My husband and I just moved to chino hills and we were very excited to try the Korean BBQ places around here.
Tonight we had a great experience with everything about this place. I'm a pretty picky eater, but I loved everything I ordered. The garlic pork belly was phenomenal!
And Our server Ethan was very helpful and paid close attention to our table. If we needed anything, he got it for us immediately. Ethan even offered to take the shell off the shrimp for us! Very friendly and driven. I would definitely ask to be seated in his area next time I come!!
#ethanfromgen

author: Daniel L.
review text: Came here for dinner amd it was so good! Yvette the waitress was amazing! She was fast and so sweet. Gave us everything we needed with a smile. So bomb!

author: Kamilla G.
review text: The place is big and modern. They were pretty busy but the wait staff was on it, they really hustled. They were literally running to make sure everyone got their stuff. They checked back often and changed the grills as soon as it got any charr on it. I have been to many Korean BBQs  and have never seen the grill top changed so often. The service was really good! It's an all you can eat and they have no limit on the amount of Bone-in Short Ribs you can order but the short ribs are only available for diner. The variety of food was good and it all tasted great. Everything was flavorful and tasty. My husband loved that there was no limit on short ribs as it's his favorite and he loves the flavor but he thought the short ribs were a bit though. Definitely coming back again!!!

author: Remy B.
review text:
They say happiness is a warm cow. A fierce one it is. A thin one, it lays. In multiple marinades, it comes.. And it doesn't stop coming. Bed after bed after each bedded cow waits to be fired into perfection.
And when you thought there was only one animal on the farm, there's more.
Look at all those chickens. Especially the yummy popcorn chicken! 5 stars for the impeccable service and thank you GEN, for bringing your town, to us.
*Try the popcorn chicken and the chadol !!/ Lychee Soju is the best*

author: Marwin L.
review text:
Originally a 4-star review. But our server Jeko took this place to a whole 'nother level.

Recommend: #1, beef tongue, and pork belly

The brisket was very fatty. And some of the meat was clearly frozen and less than the top quality stuff we've associated GEN with.

Fortunately, Jeko was our server.

He was there before we needed him and he even poured our pitcher of beer into glasses for our table of six. After the evening we all took pictures with Jeko because he was such a pleasant fellow.

Thank you for the great evening, buddy!

author: Muziq U.
review text:
Big Shout-Out to the wait staff: Nicole, Remy, Michael and MIT Andy!!!!

Waiters: Cordial, friendly, ALWAYS attentive and not "O.A." Like some other places...

Food: Better than the Torrance location, bolgogi and smoked pork belly were the favorites at our table! Jalapeños and fresh Garlic please!?

Price: Priced to perfection...$10 for kids 10 and under...can't beat that!

Happy Hour: Haven't tried it but that Soju doe....

author: JC D.
review text:
Not happy at this place ....
Wang cho is better for me...portion is ridiculous ...we are four people and would not feed you at all even though you can order but the time wasted cooking a small portion....the place is busy...few choices of appetizer mostly hot and spicy and only the potato salad you can munch while waiting for your food....they have more choices of meat  and a good selection ... The calamari was good but the feeling of coming back here is not that great for me......the place is too dark ... Lights on the table is hitting your eyes..have been to GEN in Cerritos and have a good time at that place...I believe the service at wang cho is better ... My opinion...

author: Ryan D.
review text:
This is our second visit in 2 weeks lol. This location has quickly rose to the top of my favorite Korean BBQ spots. We used to frequent Roland Heights but glad that Chino Hills opened up since we live nearby, no longer needing to head west. Also, the service is second to none. During Our first visit we had the pleasure of meeting the manager Maddy, she's the best! Always asking us if we needed anything and how our experience was, clearly customer service is high on her priority list. Our server Keanu, he is the epitome of good customer service---always attentive and never hesitated to get us anything we requested and in a timely manner. During our second visit, the servers that took care of us were Jeffrey, Randy & Mike ---another great addition to the company. He was very attentive and always topped off our water and requests in a timely manner.

Thank you Again Maddy for always taking care of our big family and kids Hahahaha. The two boys Ryan & Rafa (6mos old) absolutely love coming here to see Maddy lol. Thank's for making our experience top notch always!

author: Elva Z.
review text:
Hello Gen!!!  Came here lunch today with my friends. Thought the wait will be at least 45 mins but guess what, we got seated right the way. Our server Jeffrey was Amazing!! He explained the menu, cut the meats, and recommend the meats for us.
We ordered brisket, red wine pork belly, beef tongue, Hawaiian steak, beef bulgogi, cajun shrimps, spicy chicken and dwenjang soup.
Everything was delicious just like all the other Gen that I have been to. Oh!! Did I mention that he peeled the shrimps for us? I will definitely be back for their lunch menu on weekdays. Since weekend is dinner price all day long. I will bring my friends too.

author: Amber S.
review text:
Kyle was assume!
Would love to come back!
Love this place
Great service!
Went on lunch sat us right away and understood we had limited time due to work. They were great!

author: Lily F.
review text:
I have to thank to our friends for inviting us to this amazing place!!!! I am thrilled with the great service, Erick was our waiter and he was absolutely amazing.

There is enough parking lot, the place is very well decorated and super clean. The music is great and all the personnel is incredibly friendly.

You can eat soooo much and with an incredible quality on food! It was delicious!

author: Peter C.
review text: I love Korean bbq and the AYCE is right up my alley. I had always ate at Wang but saw Gen and decided to check it out. As far as pricing it is about $2 more for more selection so I was thinking of switching my AYCE spot. The service was average but still gave  around 12% gratuity. The other day my wife asked how much was Gen I said around $63 something.. Well, Gen and their staff decided to help themselves to a 45% gratuity. Beware of shady things like this at Gen, keep your receipts! I gave them 2 stars because I like Korean BBQ. Other than that, giving yourself extra tip and trying to fool the credit card company that the customer approved it is Shady.. I wonder how many times they have tried this, doesn't sound very legal...

author: J J.
review text:
Second time visiting this GEN in CH. Ambiance is definitely nice and it's cool to see how they revamped a Denny's to look like this. Now onto the review...

This is the second time I sat in the bar area. The first time I sat in the bar area, there was a constant water drip hitting me on the shoulder and hat. This occurred throughout the entire meal. Then the second time we visited the bar, we were dripped on by water drops in another seat. There appears to clearly be an issue with their A/C directly above!

As far as the food, it was good and the quality was to be expected in an AYCE. Now, if you compare the food to Young Dong or some of the other legitimate korean restaurants in town, you might get disappointed. However, for $19.xx this is probably what you can expect. The service was also good. I believe the bartender for the evening was Cole. He was extremely attentive and helpful with both meat and beer selections. Also, he was apologetic when we notified him of the drip overhead.

In comparison, I've been to both Wang Cho and GEN now. It's hard to say which is better. There are meats at Wang Cho that just seem to be better than GEN. As customers, we pay very close attention to this. Management, if you're reading this, please know that we are constantly rating your meat and you will always hear about it on the Yelp! platform. Finally, I would definitely come back to GEN. However, next time I won't be sitting at the bar unless I decide to bring my umbrella.

author: Jackie N.
review text:
Shout out to my server Kyle!! Did an awesome job serving me and my girlfriends. Would definitely consider of coming back!
#youwereawesomekyle

author: Linda C.
review text:
We celebrated our family's May Birthdays here (6 of them).  We had a large party of 17 and they accommodated and treated us great!  We came in hungry and starving (Bc when you plan on going to Korean bbq, you fast all day.  That's the rules...) and they put up with all 17 of our HANGRY demands with speed and efficiency (as good as guy can get with a chaotic group).   We had great servers and the food was delish.  

I took off a star Bc their restroom was out of order, but a particular wait staff said it was being cleaned.  He should have told me the truth rather than have me wait expecting it to be available in 10 min.  .  When a girl has to go, she has to go!  

I've included a pic of the best servers in Chino Hills, Richard and Daniel ... Lol

Also, I didn't like their rice cakes.  Should be in a spicy sauce, not a sweet chili sauce.  That I give a total

author: Maria R.
review text:
We just realized that Denny's is no more, fine by me. We came to celebrate my nieces first recital. Our server Nicole, and everyone, were awesome. They took great care of us, party of 10. Nicole made recommendations which turned out delicious.

We will definitely be returning the food was great. Atmosphere was fun, background music was fun. We are all stuffed now. Loved our first visit at Gen.

author: Mars D.
review text:
This was my first time eating at Gen and it did not disappoint! Kyle was our server and did an awesome job and made it a good experience. The atmosphere here is nice and the seating and tables are a lot nicer than most Korean BBQ places I've been to.
Food was great. We especially liked the beef bulgogi and red wine marinated pork belly. Their dipping sauces and green tea salt were great as well! Our grill was changed out often without having to ask and we were overall very pleased with the service at Gen. Thanks, Kyle and other Gen staff! :)

author: Mulan M.
review text: Dee was a fantastic server. He made sure our large party had everything we needed. He was on top of it all. He made our lunch great fun and delicious.

author: Michael K.
review text:
Although Gen KBBQ is always a popular go to place for everyone, and this restaurant is ALWAYS busy, they never fail to provide excellent customer service. Gabrielle did an amazing job running around the floor trying to attend to everybody. And if we had ever asked for something, she would always come back right away as she promised! :)

Also the manager Andy checked in with our table and made sure everything was running smoothly. He conversed with us so friendly, I immediately almost felt like I was his friend. We all appreciated his welcoming energy.

However, one of the problems that all of us did get really hot. Especially since summer is approaching, so be sure to dress light on the clothes!!!

Regardless, the one hour drive and half hour wait was definitely worth the trip to GEN KBBQ at Chino Hills!!! :)

author: Bryan M.
review text: Excellent Food and Excellent Service.... A MUST Try For Sure .... Great atmosphere and Everyone had a Great attitude.... Candice My waittress was the BEST .... For the Price the food was Bomb and All you can eat...

author: adda w.
review text: Throughout the handful of times I've been to GEN BBQ, this one failed to meet my expectation. Location is clean with a ton of tables. It can get tight when busy. The quality of meat went down. It used to be really good with a ton of marbling with good texture.

author: Liezl S.
review text:
Ok this is gonna be a very thorough review.

Environment and atmosphere: nice decor, nice lighting, nice set up. But needs better ventilation. It didn't seem like the vents were working very well as there was to much smoke that wasn't going anywhere. Careful when walking because the floors can be slippery. I've seen how they change the grills and they don't hold it over a tray or anything, so the grease drips all over the floor. Management needs to implement on that because if someone falls...On a side note, their chairs are nice though.

Service: started off wonderfully. Got seated right away. Hostess was informative of the prices and menu items. Waitress introduced herself and got us started right away with the side dishes, drinks, and our first order. As the time progressed, they got more busy and less attentive. Other servers were trying to help each other out, but items were being forgotten, refills had to be asked for instead of keeping it half filled. It almost looked like there weren't enough servers. They were too busy, I even saw a server running across the hall:/ management should think about the staffing and the number of tables appropriate per server, especially if they want to maintain their customer service at a great consistency.

Quality of food and price: great price and wide variety to choose from. However, if you're a brisket lover, the quality on their brisket isn't so great. It's too fatty. But their Hawaiian steak and premium steak and beef belly were very good. I also love how you get your own set of side dishes rather than sharing. Not many side dishes, but their potato salad was delicious.

Restrooms: very neat and clean. I love how they have dry cotton hand towels and lotion in the women's rest room. Only three stalls though. Should have more for a big restaurant.

Overall, they could still use improvememt! I give a solid 3 stars for now. Would I go back? Yeah, probably. When I do, I hope to see the improvements.

author: Cat R.
review text:
I've been here before plenty of times and sometimes service can be a little off..
Today however it was different!
Edmond asked if we were celebrating any occasion. He also made it a point to ask my name, and shake my hand, as I was the celebrant. Plus usually they miss a couple of items and I have to keep asking .... Edmond was on top of everything.
Water, sides and grill changing.
He changed the grill not once, but so many times I honestly lost count.. The flavor of the meats depends on a clean grill so I appreciated that.

Gen. has comfortable plush seating and the inside almost reminds me of a swanky club.
There's plenty of parking as the building used to be the old Denny's on Grand.

AYCE doesn't mean you have to skimp on getting good customer service and quality.

Thank you Edmond for giving us just that!
It made the experience ten times better!

author: Ryan C.
review text:
I've been to Gen before but not this specific location, and I'm glad this store is now here. It's close by and just as great as the others!

Kevin and his team were great! Every time we cooked several plates they were spot on for when we needed grill changes! We even got a little entertainment by Kevin at the end of our meal while they were closing down.

The food was great and I love the fact that they were cheaper then their counter part down the street.

I will definitely be coming back here!

author: Alfonso C.
review text: This place was fantastic. Food kept coming and service was great. We left this place full and satisfied. If in the neighborhood, stop for a bite as you will not be disappointed.

author: Jessica G.
review text:
Great service and great food!! Our server Kyle was AWESOME!!!
The brisket was on point and we LOVED the Hawaiian steak!
Awesome music and environment.... Great for date night or a group outing!

author: Alberto V.
review text: Awesome spot to fill yourself up. If your going recommend taking a seat in Joel's section. Need a refill, need napkins, or just more food no problem he was on it. Even discovered Gens special sauce for marinating the meats. Thanks Joel.

author: Kirk L.
review text: Gen is my favorite kbbq spot. So whenever there's a special occasion we go here. It's actually our first time here in Chino hills location and we're happy for the service we got. Emmanuel is our server and is very nice and helpful. Even though they are only 3 servers with a lot of customers, emmanuel never forgets our table and always asking for our needs and orders. I would like to give him this 5 stars for the service. We will definitely come back here.

author: URY X.
review text: Our waiter "Louis "was pretty awesome gave us great costumer service by always giving us good recommendations and walking us thru the whole Gen experience thank you will be coming here soon

author: Victoria M.
review text: Love this Gen Korean  BBQ location!  The food was so good and fresh and our server Marc was so accommodating and on point.  He frequently checked on us,  providing whatever we needed or wanted at the moment.  I will definitely come back to this location and hopefully we get to have Marc as our wonderful server again!

author: Annie W.
review text:
Went there tonight at around 9:15 PM.  
Since it's a Sunday night the restaurant was very empty,  but still me and my friend got the smallest freaking table.. It was so crowded on the table that I had to place my sauce plate sideway.
Our waiter Ian sucks! I asked for a spoon, he bought me a fork...  Ok no biggie..  And then we waited 7 minutes for a grill change while Ian walked pass our table TWICE.
 We asked for salad,(the salad that supposed to come with everything else when you first sitting fown),  we waited 10 minutes then had to remind him again for a damn premade salad.  

Bad service usually don't bother me that much,   by the food quality went down hill since last time we visit. Angus beef side was too thin,  I felt like I was chewing rubber.. Rice cake wasnt crispy on the outside and just taste weid(ive had way better rice cake at Gen corona location), and the last thing...  What's wrong with their japchae?  It didn't have no "cooked veggies" as it was stated on their menu describtion...  (See picture)

TL; DR: waiter Ian sucks. Food quality lower than average. Go somewhere else.

author: Eunice H.
review text: Came here for my friend's birthday. Our server's name was Ethen, and he was great! He was kind and was always there to bring us anything else we needed. The service was amazing the whole time we were there, which was about two hours and we got everything we ordered fairly quickly. All of the servers were also very attentive and gave us the utmost respect. Ethen was especially super cool since he was our personal Shazam for the night!!

author: Richina B.
review text: My daughter's took me out for my birthday and wanting to do something different, this was our first dining experience at a Korean bbq restaurant. We had a great time and the food, atmosphere and the service was great. Our server Jonahs was awesome and help guide us along the way. My only concern is that I think they should offer 2-3 pairs of tongs; just because you are dealing with raw meats. We will definitely be back...and there are other locations.

author: Jessica Q.
review text: Food was delicious and service was good for my first time here! Our waiter Xu was attentive and nice!

author: Jade K.
review text: Decided to come to Gen and take my boyfriend for the first time! we both really enjoyed it!!! the meat is AMAZING!! the staff is so wonderful! and the atmosphere of the place is just so cool and vibrant! Hailey and Carlos were really amazing to us and my boyfriends first time one to remember! definitely will be coming back

author: Ryley G.
review text: Marc is daaa best server here  From meats to soups, grill changes to fire complaints, and running to cooking, Marc has achieved the best yelp reviews for this place! His eclecticism and keen senses gave us the best Gen KBBQ experience. Props to Marc!

author: Jennifer R.
review text:
My family and I frequent this restaurant pretty often. It was excellent when it first opened not too long ago, but the service is definitely going downhill. It takes quite a while before anyone notices an empty water cup. There's also a lot of fat on the meat. We put our order in with 4 meats. The first meat came out and about 5 min later, the waiter (Kyle) asked if we wanted to order more? We explained to him that we've only received one so far and he seemed confused. He literally had to check his Ipad to see what we had just ordered 5 min prior! Strange....

Then there's the music. I usually don't pay too attention to it, but I couldn't help it this time because the song playing literally dropped the "F" bomb every other word. Really? In a restaurant where people are bringing their families, including children? Not cool. I'm not a prude, but there should be a certain standard in restaurants. This isn't a club, after all.

author: Michelle C.
review text: I came in last week for dinner with some friends, I just have to say the food and service here was great, I love the atmosphere and the music they play, I definitely recommend the brisket, galbi, beef bugolgi, and Hawaiian steak, a big thanks to our server Joy who was very patient with all of our needs, and all the good recommendations, and always refilled our drinks without even asking. Definitely will be back!

author: Monica D.
review text: The ambiance of this restaurant was so amazing! It was my first time on a Friday night and it was very busy. However, my family and me were assisted and cared for the whoooooole night!!!!!! Best customer service from The Great Ethen (or Ethan....anyways my sister says HOLLA lol) ! This guy literally peeled my sisters shrimps, helped cook and cut our food, and worked steady and efficient from other different tables. Everyone had a great time at this restaurant. The employees show out a lot of hard work, props to them. But on top of that the food... HELLA bomb. We don't really have cool stuff like this in the Bay Area, so I was really impressed. Thank you Ethen and all the employees at Gen, y'all amaze balls.

author: Brian C.
review text:
Gen BBQ, a Korean BBQ restaurant that my girlfriend and I have been dying to try. Upon hearing that one would be opening in Chino Hills, we immediately set a time and date.

Let's start with the servers, Jabez and Marc were very attentive. They suggested us drinks when we weren't sure of what to get and upon receiving our Shirley Temple, sprite mixed with a special syrup, we realized the drink tasted odd. Our servers wasted no time hesitating and fixed the problem immediately. For the most part the rest of our time here was very smooth. Not once did we have a reason to complain.

Now let's move on to the meat quality, although I wasn't able to try each meat on the lunch menu. I can guarantee that the Premium Steak and Red Wine Pork Chops were our favorite. Although the brisket tasted wonderful, the quality is based on when it is served. Basically, they cut the meat based on orders and specific parts go out randomly. You can have tender meat on the first order, but have much tougher meat later on. Don't let that fool you though. This place is definitely a place you want to stop by and try.

author: Maria O.
review text: Thanks to June for bringing me to this Gen- by far the best Gen I've been to around the area. Very good service from Dave and Jeffrey! Super attentive and there was little to no wait for any of the meat. Jeffrey peeled our shrimp and made a cute lil face. As always the meat and variety are excellent. Really enjoyed dinner here.

author: Maribel M.
review text: We always love Ayce Korean BBQ, and this Gen location is our to go place especially during birthday celebrations. There's a large selection of marinated meats, and some seafood too. The food is always great and flavorful and the service is impeccable. A special shout out to our server KYLE, he's very attentive to his area, he changed our grill 3 times during the course of our lunch. Great guy and good conversationalist too!

author: Jeffrey M.
review text: I've been to this place a hand full of times and have never been disappointed but tonight was even better then usual cause our server Matthew was on point he was hustling to get order change grills and still managed to just check in on us a couple times to make sure we were all good.  So tonight is dedicated to Matthew cause he made this night the best for sure

author: Aurora J.
review text: Took my son there for his birthday and we loved it...want to give a big THANKS to panda Alex and Asseret for being by great waitresses..they were awesome!!!

author: Henry L.
review text: The best service I've ever received in my entire life. Marc was very friendly and treated our table very well. We're new to Gen and he guided us with the menu very thoroughly. If any of you guys get served by Marc, you'll definitely be in good hands.  and food was great too.

author: Steffanie P.
review text: Props to our wonderful server--Kyle! He was super attentive, but not overly so. He was super nice, but not awkwardly so. He was just our favorite part of the evening. I mean...the food was great too, but there's good food everywhere. This service (from everyone---busers, grill changers, everyone) is the best I've had in years.  P.S...don't forget to tell them it's your birthday  (I've never heard such a robust birthday chant...)

author: Marvin S.
review text: So me and my family end going to Gen a lot, and normally we go to the Cerritos one because it's our favorite in terms of flavor and service.  We all loved in harmony.  But it all changed when my man Xu served us.  He was seriously great.  He was on top if everything - I never once had to ask for a refill on anything.  Water getting low?  Instant refill.  Meat almost done cooking?  Here he comes to take the order for the next wave.  Rice paper almost out?  NO IT'S NOT!  By far the best service I've had at ANY kbbq as of yet.  Get Xu as your server and have your mind blown.

author: Rae G.
review text: My friends and I tried this for the first time on Sunday and it was the most delicious Korean BBQ ever.! The rice paper was perfect & the Bulgogi was sooo good. The service was great. The ambience was amazing. The dark lighting in this place was perfect, the music was popping! Lol... it's definitely a cool place to hang out

author: Diego U.
review text: Best place Eeeeeverrr!! If you come here make sure to get Marc Sanchez! He's literally the best server ever!!! Thanks Marc! I had a great birthday party dinner here!

author: Kalien S.
review text: Went to this location to check out what the 5 star fuss was about. Mind you my boyfriend and I love kbbq! The vibe was different. When you walk in it had this night club vibe. We were skeptical about it at first however after we got seated I must inform you that the service was amazing! Quality of meat was amazing. Everything about this experience was extremely mind blowing. Our server Mathew was great. He was on top of providing great service to our table along with 5-10 other tables he was serving. Thanks to this place my boyfriend and I have extremely high standards for kbbq. Overall our experience was great. Definitely will return when we visit the area. Keep up the good service guys!!

author: Abel F.
review text: It was my very first time coming here, I came with a couple of friends and it was a great experience! We had our waiters help us choosing the best dishes and boy were they right , it was so great to have FRAN SAUCE & MATHEW there to help us enjoy our meal , excellent customer service and promptness, they changed the grill as needed, cleared plates out the table and checked up on us to make sure everything was good, I loved this service for dinning, definitely coming back

author: Ian D.
review text: I love his Korean bbq joint. The music is great and the staff is always fast and friendly.  Tim has been my server multiple times with the help of Flores and i have never been disappointed by their service.  Hint: get the short ribs. Yea!

author: Melody P.
review text: The wait was short. The food was amazing!! I highly recommend the honey chicken and bulgogi beef! Sooo good... Major kudos to Ethan.. great waiter- ask for a table with him when you come in

author: Jenny C.
review text: Best Korean bbq place I've ever had! Our server Kyle was super friendly and attentive. Almost all flavor of meat and Korean dishes are seasoned or marinated on point. Everything made me and my friends very happy!

author: Paul Luna Memorial L.
review text: First time and took my 9 year old for date night. We loved it. The food was yummy and fun to cook ourselves with the help of Anthony and Edmond. They made it fun and eased our worries of first timers having no clue how this Korean BBQ works. We will definitely be back. You can get smaller portions if you want to just try something too. Great service and great price. Check it out.

author: Alberto G.
review text: Best bar service ever. Cole was an excellent server. Very patient. Quick what we need. Definitely would recommend the chino Gen Korean bbq. Not busy at all.

author: C D.
review text: This place is definitely one our best places to have Korean BBQ in Chino Hills / Chino. We love our waitress Joy. She always has our order by the time we get to our table. She is very attractive to us. Joy is the BEST!!!!!!

author: Floyd R.
review text: Wow what a great experience we had. I brought my sales team and regional for dinner we work for Sit'N Sleep in Chino Hills. We pride ourselves on great serve and we had a great experience that's what makes us successful and having great YELP  reviews. The food was fresh and delicious and service was great to we will be back!

author: Claire W.
review text: I've never written a yelp review before but today I'm writing my first one for Erick. Seriously, he's the best server I've ever met. He was super friendly and attentive: he peeled shrimps for us, changed the grill plate for us constantly, answered every questions/requests, chatted with us a lot.... etc. Besides the superb service, the quality of food is also excellent. Our favorite is Hawaiian Steak, it's very juicy and tender. The combination of amazing service and great food together provided us pleasant and wonderful dining experience. We will definitely come back and ask for Erick. This is now my fav Korean BBQ, hands down! :)

author: Joshua S.
review text: Honesly one of the best experiences I've ever had a Korean barbecue the server Erick and his runner Frances did a wonderful job along with the bartender Ashley. I will be dropping hundreds here again. Also great Pokémon spawn point

author: Matt D.
review text: Came here with my girl and everything was on point! Been to many Gen spots but Chino Hills is where it's at! Dee kept the brisket coming and thats what I like! His sevice was the best i have ever got! Will be back again!

author: Greg G.
review text: Today was the first time trying out this restaurant after seeing the field these locations popping up in the area... I'll tell you right now that's definitely a five-star experience coming here. Everyone here was very nice and even though  it was a full house that did not stop the quick and great service from the staff. Anthony was our server and he did a outstanding job very professional and helpful. The quality of the food was great, Atmosphere was good, and it's clean. I would definitely recommend this place 10 friends and deafly will be returning in future. 5 stars and shout out to Anthony for the amazing service on a Saturday night. Definitely recommend the beef bulgogi. Also they have happy hour on the weekends here as well .

author: Yubing T.
review text: Have been to this location twice，I like Gen BBQ because of the good quality of all kinds of meat and sea food ，and I like my waiter Ethen，always ask our need，change grill，and very efficient！

author: Thomas N.
review text: 1-8-17 Went here for sis-in-law's birthday, so it was about 14 of us about 4 tables/grills... Our server Marc was epic!!! He was like the Super Saiyan of servers... you tell him what you need and he's back in less than a minute... he once told us he had our backs, dude definitely did...

author: Maribel R.
review text: Very good service, out waiter was #TimXu and #Patrick this was my first time coming, love it. Patrick the manager was excellent two thumbs up

author: Dennis E.
review text:
This place was amazing. First time we were here and everything was absolutely delicious. Our servers Eric and Gabrielle were beyond exceptional. Even all the other servers or just passing by was concerned with making sure our dining experience was perfect. Even the general staff who were not assigned to our tables always popped in to see if we needed anything .
Great experience.  Highly recommend.  Try not to order to much plates since you will get full as the serving round is being cooked at your table ,  which is what this all you can eat place is about here.
A great change from the normal way to eat out !

author: Phillip P.
review text: As a connoisseur of kbbq, Gen is one of the top restaurants I've dined at in SoCal. Not only are all the amenities taken care of proper, but they shine bright like a diamond in comparison to all the other places in k-town. The factor that separates Gen from the rest is the consistent high level of service. Samantha and Tim blew me away by assisting me with all my kbbq'ing needs. Refills, Check. More sides, Check. Answering my questions and giving some valuable suggestions, Check, Check. Glad to be a regular at Gen :)

author: David N.
review text: Muy Bien! Mucho Fuego! GEN is always great. Came here for the grand opening and customer service was exceptional. Alex was on top of it and made sure we were taken care of. Really nice guy. Meat is always good. Mostly come here for the Galbi which is on their lower option. Most kbbq spots do not offer Korean short ribs until you pay a little bit extra for it. Their brisket is a little thinner and less fatty if you're into that. I rather go here than Wang Cho now that GEN is near me. Always busting missions to eat GEN. Now it's down the street!

author: 宇瞳
review text: The service and food was great! Or servers Kevin and Joel were awesome and showed great enthusiasm when bringing us our food! Definitely come here again!!!

author: Elena K.
review text:
I've tried the gen locations at both Alhambra and Rowland heights and was excited for one to be opening closer to me. The brisket at this location and the overall quality of the meat is a little bit better and it is also cleaner than the other locations.

My favorites to order are brisket, Hawaiian steak, and pork cheek. You have to wait a little bit longer for the pork cheek to get really crispy but it tastes the best cooked that way. The price at this ayce kbbq is pretty affordable but I wouldn't say their meat quality is the best, especially at their other locations.

author: Jennifer H.
review text:
Soooooooooo excited that Gen opened up in my hood!!!! It's time someone told Wang Cho to move aside and show them how it's done! Gen has far better meats and service! And now I don't have to drive to Rowland heights when I crave for ayce Korean bbq anymore!

Harold and Richard were our waiters and they made sure we were taken care of. Once we sat down, we asked for waters, extra rice paper, two bowls of rice as well as 4 orders of meat to start. They got right to it and made sure we were eating in no time! We normally order the beef brisket, beef bulgogi, marinated short rib fingers, galbi, Hawaiian steak and spicy pork bulgogi. I'm very pleased with the meat quality of this location, it's better than Rowland heights IMO. The brisket was fresh, unlike most other kbbq places where it's brought out frozen. Galbi was my favorite! It was very tender and juicy! I ate almost two orders just by myself! Note that galbi is only on the dinner menu. They have a lunch menu for $14.99 ayce (ayce = all you can eat) on Monday-Friday and a dinner menu for $19.99 for M-F dinner as well as all day on weekends. I think spending an extra $5 just for the galbi is totally worth it. Yes, it's THAT good lol.

I'm already planning to come back next weekend and you know what I'll be binge eating!

author: Stephanie P.
review text: My husband and I came in today for breakfast.. YES, I said breakfast. Best decision ever! This establishment is always clean and the food always comes out so quickly, even on the busiest of nights. Today our first server was Edmond, super rad, helpful and nice. Then we finished the duration of our meal with Neil, again, helpful and friendly. I've been to a lot of Gens, but I definitely have to say this is my favorite location yet. Plus the baby making music is so on point when shoving a bunch of meat in my mouth

author: Josh A.
review text: Love this place. The food was great but the service was spectacular. Our server Samantha was amazing. Can't wait to come back

author: Maria V.
review text:
Here at Gen BBQ Soft grand opening!!  Let me just say this place is on point! From the food, the vibe, the people!
Nothing short of amazing!! We were welcomed with high energy and great customer service all around! Thee bbq is just delish, we loved the shirt ribs, the Hawaiian steak, loved the jhap char, the sauces are flavorful... love the rice paper and radish,  along with the other condiments  Everyone and everything works in snychrony! Service is amazing!  Keanu is our amazing server, props to our guy! Along with Marc, and Manroop!  I've met the most gracious MITs Andy, Maddie, and the Big Man Vince!  You guys will do awesome! Love what they did with the space and they even have a bar area with screen TV's!  Just keep the the same level of service, top quality foods with the flavor and the vibe!!  Great place to celebrate bdays, anniversary dinner , or just to break bread with fsm and friends

author: Bojie d.
review text:
I was surprised to learn when I moved back to Chino Hills that they have another KBBQ place and it is Gen.  

I have been to the Gen KBBQ in Victoria Gardens area before but it is nice to have one that is close.

I still can't believe it used to be the boring old Denny's.  Everything in the restaurant was remodeled and does not even resemble Denny's except for the entrance outside.  

Inside looks like a posh almost club environment and loud music.  It has blue and red lighted that make the place pop.  

We came around 8pm after actually going to the gym.  It wasn't super busy for a Thursday night but there was a good amount.  I can't imaging how packed this place is on the weekends.  

The meat selection was as robust as the one in Rancho.  Our main server's name was Niel who took very good care of my and my gf.  He got our drinks promptly and first four orders.  We may had over ordered but that is what you do when you eat at KBBQ.  

I don't like to talk negatively about other places but I always felt the service at Wang Cho was a little bit slower and the portions were smaller.  Which makes a bit difference when you are super hungry and want to eat right away.

I wanted to try everything.  We had brisket of course and bugolgi.  Kalbi ribs, and angus steak.  The last orders where Cajun shrimp which cooks in it's own sauce and spicy squid.  

I thought it was great that Neil de-shelled the shrimp for us.  The other server Marc would check on us to change the grill and if we needed any additional sides.  

Overall, I would rate my first time experience at this Gen KNBQ as great.  I look forward for another day when I will have KBBQ cravings.

author: Vu N.
review text: I was pretty skeptical as to how this place could have a perfect 5/5 star rating but damn, skeptic no more. Got in there, got sat in a almost full restaurant in about 2 minutes and our table was decked out with sides from the moment we got there. We even had two servers but our second one, Neil, was legit the nicest guy that's ever served us. Homeboy held it down with the recommendations. Made a young Asian brother shed a tear.

author: William T.
review text: Keanu, yes I typed Keanu! He is the best server in the house!!! Oh and the food is awesome as well!!! In 2 hours you can do some serious damage

author: NicOle F.
review text: First time eating here at Gen Korean BBQ in Chino Hills, CA. My girlfriend and I tried this place for lunch. I WOULD RECOMMEND COMING HERE. Our server was Kyle!! He is super funny, friendly & he knows how to take care of you while u stay here eating. I'm definitely coming back here. #genkoreanbbq #yourockKYLE! #yourawesome #chinohills #california

author: Ryan C.
review text: Brand new Gen! Meat quality is great. Kalbi was sooo soft. We ate so much brisket we got to the fatty end. Wang Cho has better sides. This is THE most child friendly place I've been! Forget Disneyland! We had Jenny and Neil, but anyone and everyone passing by asked to help us. Definitely worth a stop in if you're into your ayce kbbq.

author: Michael H.
review text: First time at this location. Celebrating my in-laws Anniversary. Ask for Samantha and Joey, best servers there. Awesome duo team! Very attentive, happy and fast. Food was great. Samantha offered Cajun shrimp and she peeled it. Never has this happened at the Rancho location. The service was amazing, thank you. You both made our celebration wonderful.

author: Sara M.
review text: Finally tried out my hometown location today for my friends birthday and couldn't have had a better experience ! Neil and Cole were our servers and were on top of everything through out the whole meal. They always made sure we were taken care of and satisfied, they never kept us waiting long for anything, & they did a great job of catering to a large group. Definitely recommend ! So glad I don't have to go out of town anymore for a quality kbbq experience

author: Kimberly M.
review text: Our 1st time here! Our first serve was amazing but the second one was so so! All the food we had was amazing! I can't complain about any of the food at all! We had no idea what to do and the server helped us through it all! This was the best! I can't wait to go back!

author: Jeanny K.
review text: First time here in Chino Hills location...food was GREAT!!! Lots of varieties to choose from including flavor. If you live spicy food...just ask for their jalapeños... Its very spicy. Its a huge plus to have a very great waiter which is very rare. Especially at a Korean BBQ place. Keanu was our waiter. He is very persistent, quick, friendly. His customer service skills is above and beyond awesome! Like I said...very rare at a Korean BBQ place. Thanks Keanu!

author: Lauren F.
review text: Great service from our waiters Alex and Erick! They were very attentive and gave us everything we needed without having to wait. The food was delicious as always. Only complaint was that it was too cold at the far back tables, which I did not notice during my first visit. Other than that I'd recommend anyone to come to this location!

author: Xelina J.
review text: Came back here after a long day's work. My boyfriend and I were welcomed and seated quickly. Neil, our server, was fantastic!
