He kept checking in on us and made sure we always had food in front of us. We had about 4 rounds and enjoyed every bite of it. Would definitely recommend Woo Beasal. Feels like it melts in your mouth! Will continue coming here and bring family and friends.

author: Jan F.
review text:
Wildly popular?  Yes. Overrated? Absolutely not. I'm not one to just hand out 5 stars to every establishment I visit,  but Gen Korean Bbq has nailed this down. Made a reservation for 2, was greeted and seated within 10 minutes (a very busy night), and Jeffrey (our server) never batted an eye at our many questions on the menu, cooking time,  etc.  In fact,  he gave us some of the best server service we have ever had the pleasure of receiving. We never had to stop him to ask for a clean grill,  refill on drinks, or more meat-- ever. The food?  Phenomenal. We passed on the rice and just ate what we came here for-- beef chicken, and seafood! Beef bulgogi and Cajun shrimp was by far the best choices we made (apart from this delicious Korean pomegranate vodka). Cleanliness? I won't even go there. All tables, floors, serveware were pristine. Atmosphere?  Hip,  happening,  fun,  and friendly (even for a couple of parents of 2 like us). Overall, we felt like highly valued customers, it was a date night we will remember, and a place we can't wait to return to.

Value for price: 5 stars
Food/ Drink: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Cleanliness: 5 stars
Atmosphere: 5 stars

Tip: do NOT skip the macaroon ice cream. Even a non- dessert person like me FELL IN LOVE with this tiny, sweet perfection (coffee flavor).

author: Richard P.
review text: Please understand that I do not usually post reviews but WOW, WOW, WOW. Samantha was attentive and very personable. She asked questions to see what we would be interested in and the meal became an EXPERIENCE because of her. From the drinks to the not so often ordered items that blew us away, thank you Samantha for your hard work and helping us to enjoy our meal at this great place for food and atmosphere

author: Stephanie C.
review text: This place is terrific! I've been to their LA and Rowland Heights location as well, but this one has the best service by far! Samantha was our waitress and not only was she attentive to our party, she made excellent recommendations and made sure we had a great time while dining here! She made sure our meat was cooked properly and even took the time to show us a drinking game lol! They have a huge menu with high quality meat and seafood. If you're looking for a filling lunch or dinner with a great atmosphere, I highly recommend this spot. Make sure to try the sliced angus beef and garlic pork belly. And if you're feeling adventurous, the intestines here are delicious! I will for sure be back for many more visits.

author: Roxanne Holly C.
review text:
Daaaamn Daniel!

So......I've been to Gen locations like Rowland Heights and Cerritos. I'm so damn happy to finally have one down the street from my house. I went with my bro and son right after work. This place is legit. Even with everyone in training, the food AND service couldn't have been any better. Shout out to Lawrence, Keanu, Isabelle, Madelene, Nadine, Vince, Haowie, Paul, and Randy.. (sorry if I missed a few) for the spectacular service. Even if it was a hectic 1st Friday night after the restaurant first opened, I could tell that everyone worked together as a team to quickly and efficiently service the customers. I appreciate that I don't have to wait for "my server" because everyone was able and WILLING to help each other out. I am aware of what exceptional customer service is and they definitely provide that at Gen. By the way, the red wine pork belly, calamari steak, and bulgogi were my faves (all recommended by the staff). ALL the food was delicious actually (great portions) and the staff even helped cook the food so my family and I could really enjoy our time there. I hope the staff keeps up with the excellent service.  Such an awesome vibe as always. Great music (play more 90's hip hop and r&b! haha :P) and atmosphere for families and young adults especially. They have a very down to earth and easy going staff, but still very attentive. Sorry, but move over Wang Cho! Chino Hills finally has GEN! Gen got it right!

UPDATE!!!! I came back the next day (yes, I sure did) for lunch with my family. Keanu was our waiter again. He's an awesome waiter. Madelene and Vince were also sooo super helpful and nice. I just absolutely love the staff here. It's nice to know that every customer is important and that any waiter can help. I tried the Hawaiian steak and beef belly this time. BOMB DOT COM.  Gen.  Doesn't. Play. This Korean BBQ spot is the real deal. I now have a great place to dine out with the friends and coworkers because I know we will have the best customer service and great food. This place makes the customers feel so welcome. I already feel like fam! Even when I thought I lost my phone there, Vince and several staff members quick to help me find it. They care about the customers, which I truly appreciate. I'm definitely a forever customer. If you're reading this review....give this place a try. You won't regret it!

author: Stacey F.
review text: Came here for Saturday night date night.  Had excellent service.   We actually had 3 waiters/waitresses.   Rebecca,  Mannroop and Richard.   All were helpful explaining menu and frequently came to see if we needed anything.  Food was very tasty.  19.99$ all you can eat.  Will return soon.

author: Kevin E.
review text: Jenny and Kyle gave quality service that made my kbbq experience stellar. The only downside of gen was no steamed egg, other than that great meat and service!

author: Yassar F.
review text: This is one of the best Korean bbq places I have been to. Dinner is $19.99 and they have 37 menu items to choose from. The meat quality is really good. The staff is awesome as well. We had Randy and Jerrell as our servers for a 18 party group and they were awesome. I have already been to this four times and plan on coming back many more. A+++

author: Eric Z.
review text: Honestly, I been to every gen there is, from Westminster to Rowland, this is by far the best gen experience I have had. My waiters Dee, Ryan and Victoria killed it w the service. Non stop food and even offered to peel my shrimp!

author: Lawrence V.
review text: Came in with a hungry family. Craving satisfied. Food was great and service from Marc and Neil was excellent.

author: Naveen D.
review text: Anthony and Keanu, two spectacular waiters who were funny and very proactive! Left this place feeling completely satisfied.

author: Jamie D.
review text: AIANA, Vicky and Anthony!!! They're the greatest workers here! The quality of the food was great along with their service, coming back for sure, glad they opened up my in Chino Hills!

author: Danielle C.
review text: Very good quality meat especially beef and pork. Great service! Manager Vince give us very warm service and  help! I will come again and referral to my friends.

author: Andrea L.
review text: First timer and was really nervous!  I'm very picky when it comes to meat but it was awesome!! Loved everything!!  The lychee soju is awesome and the food is double awesome!!!  We had a party of 10 and were treated like VIP!!  Our service was top notch too!!  Our waiters Grace and Randy where so awesome and the MANAGER Andy was THEE best ever!!!  Can't wait to go back!!!

author: Regina R.
review text: Great service by Keanu, Neil and Cole!!! Request them as your servers. Good food. Good prices.

author: Clarissa V.
review text: Went to Korean bbq here for the first time and absolutely fell in love. The service from our waiter Grace was exceptional, she was very attentive and extremely sweet. Delicious selection of meats and we ate until we were stuffed. Definitely will be coming again and make sure to ask for Grace when you come by :).

author: Koreena C.
review text: Best food and customer service! Ruth, Mahroop and Joyce are the best! They took such good care of us. I definitely recommend this place for anything... small groups and big groups.

author: Mary G.
review text: i went here for my birthday & i did not leave disappointed. the meats here are exceptional & i wanted to eat more but i was so full that i thought my stomach was gonna explode. wish i had left room for a macaroon! my favorite meat was probably the hawaiian bacon...sooo thiccccc lol. our waiter louis was super cool & our grill was changed out by another dude & even the manager came by several times to check on us. we constantly had our drinks refilled. service & food were excellent A+++

author: Mishi C.
review text:
I have been to the Tustin location long time ago and i was really happy about the quality of food and service. However, during the recent years my mom kept telling me that the quality of food at Gen had dramatically decline. I didn't believe in her so i decided to give Gen BBQ a chance. this time, i went to Chino Hills location. I have to say that she is totally right about GEN bbq. even though it is not the same location, but i don't think there are much of differences in terms of the meats they serve.

Came here with my husband during a weekday lunch time. We were the first group of people arrived shortly after it was opened. the lunch is $15.99 per person and dinner is $20.99. pretty reasonable price.

So the lunch menu has fewer items (27 items) than the dinner menu. so the number of side dishes choices are much less than the number of side dishes in the past. only 4 choices.

Ordered
1. Premium Chadol (brisket). the first plate that we got..the meats had a lot of fat and it seems like it was frozen or leftover from last night? b/c when we got the second plate, the color of the meat is much more red and seem more fresh. the meat is alright just like any other brisket that i would get from a Korean bbq place but the meat is really thin and much more fat than other brisket that i had got in the past
2. Beef bulgogi: it came in a plate as a big chunk of meat. but when i took a bite into it, it is more like a bunch of marinated ground beef getting mixed together. the texture of beef taste kinda weird.
3. Handjungsal(pork check); i would say this is probably the best meat out of all the stuffs we ordered...very chewy and meat is really fresh..(we got small portion of meats vs when we ordered the brisket, they gave us a HUGE plate)..again i am assuming the first brisket plate we got were probably leftover or frozen?
4. shrimps: the shrimps are alright..not super fresh..and it is a whole shrimp not the peeled shrimps
5. Nook Gan Sal *marinated finger short ribs)...not so good..my husband even said the there is some sourness taste from the meat after it was cooked

the service is kinda slow and unsure why esp we were literally the only couple that was there..service is not bad but not outstanding...

Overall impression: the quality of meat is really bad...felt like they want to save money by reducing the cost for its meat..and i noticed in both lunch/dinner menus...the meats that are more tasty and typically cost more DO NOT have the "CHEF recommended"  such as beef tongue, Gen Signature Yangum Gablbi (bone in short ribs). and the one we ordered with CHEF recommended signs next to it is less tasty than the one WITHOUT it..maybe it is personal preference, but i have always thought beef tongue to be one of the best items and was always the reason why i eat all you can eat BBQ..

anyways, it is a very disappointing experience..i used to name GEN bbq as number one korean bbq ...but this place has failed me ...goodbye Gen bbq...

author: Janissa W.
review text: My waiter Aiana was super fun and helpful!! Gen is something that chino hills really needed! The food was delivered really fast which make my mom and I full very quick! The combination of good service and good food made my experience at gen very nice and something I would come back for!

author: Christina Y.
review text: Chino Hills is definitely becoming a hot spot city now that this Gen location is open. Prior to coming here, I have only tried the Gen in Rowland Heights. But, now that there's a Gen like literally seven minutes away from where I live, I can start visiting this one. The wait time was about twenty minutes long when my boyfriend and I signed in, so it wasn't too bad. When you walk right in, the restaurant definitely has a nightclub/lounge type of atmosphere. The servers are mainly young, English-speaking employees. I can tell that this restaurant caters mostly to younger people and those who are of non-Korean descent. There is a huge variety of meat to choose from and there are also complimentary side dishes as well. The food is definitely of good quality and is fresh too. Our server was Lawrence and he is so awesome! He's really attentive, polite, and consistently came by our table to ask us if we needed anything else. There is also a big bucket of candies and mints out in the front after dining, so I thought that was also courteous. We will definitely return!

author: Rae Ianne U.
review text: great food great service shoutout to the best server and runner duo out there: kyle r and kyle g yaaay

author: Mui D.
review text: Kyle ' s customer service exceeded our expectations! As for the meat, the brisket was fatty and tough today (no bueno). However,  the Hawaiian steak was tender and flavorful. We'll be back. THANK YOU again Kyle for the excellent customer service.

author: George G.
review text: Excellent service Paul and great food will be back.  Place is clean and everyone is very helpful with good service.  Food came out quick and they were changing the grill as much as they can.  Thx

author: Jessica T.
review text: My family loves coming here! Very clean with a nice ambience. The menu is huge so you have many choices. Quick service and Friendly Staff! S/O to Ethen our server for creating a fun experience as well as making the birthday surprise a memorable one! We will definitely come back!

author: Joey V.
review text: I love GEN!! I Used to go to the one in Huntington beach, but now we have one in chino!! service is exceptional!! Very attentive and kind. Panda Alex!! Best server ever! Thank you for the great night!

author: Karli W.
review text: Wow wow wow ! I don't think you will ever have better customer service than this !!! :) Richard & Andy are AMAZING !!!!!! They took care of us & peeled our shrimp & left us with the happiest tummies (:

author: Alyssa A.
review text: Marc was our server and he was fantastic! My mom told him that the fire was low even though the it was the highest level so he asked us to cook our meat. My first time ever a server in a Kbbq spot asked to cook our meat and it was awesome. Customer service here is the best. Plus the meat and the rest of the dishes are delicious. Highly recommend this kbbq spot!

author: Jeniel C.
review text: This place is the best! Staff is awesome and food is delish!! I would definitely come back again. The staff is much more friendly here then the place down the street...

author: David V.
review text: We celebrated our birthdays here and luckily for us, it wasn't one of those Sundays with people lined up out the door. Our Server, Isabelle was absolutely amazing! She's young and full of positive energy and managed to find time to be personable, despite the restaurant becoming busy with more people pouring in. It was an absolute delight to have her as our server. She even gathered her staff to sing happy birthday to us... when she announced it, she commanded the restaurant like a Boss! Great job, Isabelle!

author: KM R.
review text: Kyle is the best! Food was so good as usual and the service was great! Fast and fresh. We will definitely be back

author: Ana L.
review text: My mom and I had a wonderful time at Gen. Kyle is a great asset to your company . He gave us an excellent service.

author: Denise R.
review text: Wow! Can you say awesome, thank you to Erik and Asseret for the great service, my friend, her mom and myself had really appreciate for a great night. We will be back soon (:

author: Mayra M.
review text: I love gen and I come to this location a lot more than the one in Montclair because of the food quality but my recent visit changed everything for me....Not to mention me and my husband got sick... Came in with my husband Sunday evening we got there around 12 not to busy no wait time we sit and From the looks of it only one server was on the floor he had about 5 tables including us. We look at the menu and choose what meet what we want and a server brought us salad and ask If we would like rice and that our server would be with us shortly so roughly about 10 mins waiting Our server greets us and takes our order...we order glass noodles, popcorn chicken,brisket,rice cakes, Hawaiian steak which is always our first  round...Food start coming out and we start cooking and start to eat our popcorn chicken and glass noodles to only discover that everything was COLD!!! Was Pretty upset but still ate it we were hungry!!!! But wasn't sure if We were more upset about cold food or that only half our grill was HOT so cooking the food took even longer... We order more food and get half order of Red Wine pork belly and half order of Cajun chicken and prime steak...while waiting for the reminding of our food to finishing cooking a new server comes to our tables and mumbles something and he starts to flatten our steak with thongs for about 4 mins...my husband and I look at each other and say nothing  ...I don't know about you but I don't like a flat prime steak...I do appreciate that he was trying to help I mean he tried not like our server ofcourse... overall service was ok could be better!!! Food not to great food is either COLD or had a weird taste...Will give gen one more try but will prefer to drive to montclair for warm food and better service (even though the robots don't work most of the time)

author: Beautygirl B.
review text: #ethenfromGen was an amazing server! He was so accommodating!!! He peeled our shrimp and helped us cook.... because we are horrible cooks! Haha I would recommend this place to anyone! Quick service and great customer service!

author: Frederick S.
review text: Great food as usual but this time we received impeccable service from Richard. Special thanks to the assistant manager also for giving candy to the kids.

author: Tony Y.
review text: Our servers Francis and Richard are Awesome! The best service at any restaurant by far. We have been dinning at K BBQ for a long time and nothing top this place.

author: Chelsea V.
review text: Gen was such a fun and different eating experience. My boyfriend and I had never been to a restaurant like Gen and our server Samantha answered all of our questions and had great suggestions. We will definitely be back!!

author: Eddy E.
review text: From the modern feel to the high quality meat. GEN is one of the best places I've been to eat. Jabez, Gabriela, Tim were urgent accurate and did not make me feel like an outsider. As a small group of 3 we were sat in the matter of minutes from arriving hardly a wait if you ask me and we had no reservations. Jabez was the first to greet us and take out orders of meat, and it took Gabriela no more than 2 minutes to bring us waters and out first round of meats. Throughout my visit we were treated with smiles, friendly conversation and frequent refills. There was never a void moment which I think is the most important when dinning. From an overall view every server was attentive to each table surrounding ours and they also gather everyone's attention when it is someone birthday encouraging the whole place to join in on the festive celebration. The quality of the meat was excellent! And the presentation made it seem as if I was an emperor being served in my own palace. This place is a 5 star forsure.

author: Sam I.
review text: Wow. Amazing. First time here but definitely not the last... Grace and Madelene are the best.  Fun place great food and best people.

author: Stephanie C.
review text: This place is awesome! Just invented the lemoninia! Try it out. It's the pina colada and lemon flavored soju mixed! Shout out to our server Michael. He's a newbie who was handling! Love this place. So happy one opened up close to home. :)

author: Sarah A.
review text: Michael and Grace are super in services!  Best food and best services.  Will come again!

author: Gloria L.
review text: First time to chino location of Gen, I had went to different location of Gen and this one had best service! I love Jeffrey and Randy service and I really want to give 5 stars for their service which really outstanding for all other Gen location!!!

author: michelle l.
review text: Thanks for a great first time experience! The food was amazing and our service was fantastic. Thank you Bibien and Jabez!!

author: L E.
review text: Been to the chino hills location twice. Giving it 4 stars for the food, which was good both times; however, service the first time around was AWFUL so I'm giving it a 2.5 stars. We went on a Sunday after mass and boy was it was crowded! No parking space PLUS, they ran out of salad and rice!! Can you believe it! :( Heard so much hype about this place and didn't think they'd run out of items so fast! We had to wait an hour for both the salad and rice to cook, not to mention, our server wasn't too friendly nor accommodating. It looked like he was having a bad day. Tip: don't come here on a weekend and expect good service. Honestly, we felt rushed when ordering. On our second trip, which happened on a weeknight, service and food was WAY better. We had a female server this time and she was very helpful! Had the following items both times: beef brisket, marinated pork belly with garlic (yum!) shrimp, spicy pork bulgogi, garlic chicken, fried calamari frits, calamari steak, spicy tofu soup, steak and steamed rice. The spicy rice cakes were good too.

author: Yuichiro S.
review text: Great food. Jabez, Angie, Michael, Paul knew what's up. They got our grills changed without us ever asking.

author: G P.
review text: Awesome service!!! And Awesome food!!! Isabelle and Daniel were great. The manager Vince was also great!!Thank you for making it an awesome birthday party. We will definitely be back again :)

author: Elizabeth G.
review text:
Their ventilation system DOES NOT WORK!!! We were literally inhaling ALL THE SMOKE while waiting for the grill to be changed. By the time we left, my nose and throat was HURTING so bad, and my bf had been tearing up all the way til we got home. We literally ESCAPED the place. Of course, it took them 20 mins to get our check back.
My throat still hurts when I'm writing this review (literally an hour later), and I've been coughing and feeling nauseous ever since. Disclaimer: WE DON'T HAVE COVID. I'm surprised that they didn't get sued for this. Imagine all the toxic smoke that's been going into your system. Anyone who cares about their own health shouldn't be coming here.

Not gonna lie, WORST kbbq experience ever. We've always been coming to this location since it opened, and everything has been going down in the past few years. Meat quality, services & overall experience really are getting significantly worse. The meats for some reason are hard to chew on. On top of that, they don't have beef tongue, corn cheese or steamed egg that other kbbq places typically offer.
I swear this will be the last time we come here. They are EXTREMELY understaffed. Our server was literally running between tables and we still couldn't get a hold of him. It takes on average 15 - 20 mins for everything we asked for to arrive. That includes grill changes. Our grill was literally burning for 10 mins straight until they finally came around and changed it for us. A lot of things didn't come at the end, and we simply didn't bother asking for them cuz we wanted to leave so badly.

Ima drink more water and see if it gets better. If not let's see what's gonna happen.

author: YuTong L.
review text:
This review is only meant for Doordash Delivery.

Thinnest Galbi ever had in life, only three pieces.
Chicken only had like few bites. taste is alright, but definitely not worth for the money you paid. I mean $13 for like a kids meal basically.

author: Ally S.
review text: Delicious food. Truly helpful and fun staff. The environment was wonderful. The drinks were on point! The flavor was in the food. Not much words cause words can't describe the experience and the food we consumed. It was ever so delicious and we can't wait to go back. 1000% recommend this place.

author: Alex E.
review text: You can only get one meat a time and it takes 10 minutes for the waiter to come to table  . Zero refill in 30 min wait .I will continue to eat at different locations but NEVER at this location

author: Mushashi M.
review text: Our mozzarella sticks came with a free stainless screw, Manager couldn't even give us a reason.

author: Zoey M.
review text:
This location was so packed that there wasn't even parking. The wait time to eat inside was about an hour and a half. But outside dinning was on the spot. We chose to eat outside and we were seated right away. From the looks of it COVID regulations were being followed throughout the establishment.

This was our first time at this location, but it wasn't very different from other gens. The menu and over all atmosphere was the same.

The manager was very friendly and attentive with us. The server and busboy on the other hand were running around our table, and at one point we had no food on our table and the busboy could not take our order. We waited a good 15 minutes, literally just sat there with nothing to eat. And when our order was taken and finally came out they gave us extra meat we didn't order and it went to waste. The food was good, and overall satisfying.

author: Paprika M.
review text:
Taste :4.5/5
Environment: 4.3/5
Service/: 4.6/5

A great place for all you can eat Korean BBQ but it's really busy over the weekend.pls make reservation

The waiters are attentive any they come to your table to serve you and take care your grilled pan  .

The order is very quick as all
Food taste tasty yummy and fresh .

Recommend
Beef tongue
Canji Shrimp
Spicy squid
Pork cheek
Spicy pork bulgogi

author: Ken R.
review text:
We just finished what was a pathetic excuse for korean bbq. The appetizers took forever and came out towards the end. The 4 meat per order is a joke when it takes forever to get your order. You literally have to order in between since it takes so long to get your first order.
I remember going to the Gen in Rowland Heights before it closed...I think this place needs to follow suit..the meat is low quality, the tofu stew came with no tofu and barely cooked squash. Taste like they added Shin Ramen packets for the flavoring.

I would give this place less than a star if possible.  I recommend finding somewhere in Rowland or LA( if you can make it out there)

author: Linda N.
review text:
I was craving galbi short ribs so we decide to come here for lunch. To our surprise, their indoor dining was open.  Yay!

They have two menus to choose from:  lunch menu ($19.95) and a dinner menu ($24.95).  Since I wanted galbi short ribs, we had to order the dinner menu.

We weren't aware that they only give 2 pieces of galbi short ribs at a time, regardless of how many orders you tell them, so it took a long time for us to get our orders. The servers were really friendly and tried to accommodate my many orders of galbi, but just be aware of this, if you love galbi as much as I do.  

The meat quality is good here. You definitely get your bang for your buck. I'm not a fan of other Gen locations, such as Alhambra or Rowland, but this is definitely one of the better Gen locations.  Great value and great friendly service, so if you decide to go to Gen, come to this location.

author: Mico L.
review text:
I use several app to order the food from here .
I order raw and Benton item for several time (over 10times)
They was pretty on time before(3months before)
They just don't prepare the to go food if you don't show up in store.
I already have over 5 times that when arrive the store but the food not ready yet.  I matter I arrive on time or even 5-20minutes after the the schedule time.

Quick advise: once place your order just go to the restaurant because it doesn't matter you go on time or not. Because they start prepare your food after you show up in the restaurant. (No latter the order need to be cook or not)

author: Rachel I.
review text:
Omg !!!! I'm a first timer here and I was completely blown away !!! So delicious!!

The gentlemen on the phone who took my order ( who I think also brought out my order) was super awesome and really nice! What great customer service is all about!!

Super fast service
Quick and safe curbside pick up
Reasonable price
Quality food

author: Justin S.
review text:
During the Covid era with dining restrictions, Gen still offers outdoor dining via a partially repurposed parking lot adorned with tables and chairs, tents, and tarps. Each table has a portable gas stove and a heavy iron grill plate.

Fridays and weekends offer all-you-can-eat at $25/person. Per the usual arrangement, each table may only order 4 meats at once. The meats now arrived half-cooked to compensate for the comparatively weaker outdoor grill.

Service has increased in responsiveness, seemingly due to the reduction of patrons. Otherwise, the outdoor experience does not drastically differ from the normal experience.

author: Therese P.
review text:
I will first mention all the good things about this place before getting into the meat of it. The hostess was lovely and got us seated promptly as soon as our entire party arrived. The end. Onto the bad. We came here yesterday 09/27 and were seated at 6:19 PM table 34. It was moderately busy, of course it was a Sunday night and around dinner time. One of the people helping us mentioned that they were a bit understaffed and I get it- I've worked in restaurants for 5 years being understaffed is stressful and not everything is going to be perfect. I don't really expect perfect or smiles all around anyway. What I expect to do is to be able to eat. Anything. Something. Throughout the whole time we were there almost 2 hours as we got our check at 7:48. Not one person came to our table and said "hello my name is ---- and I'll be helping you today" though I saw many tables adjacent to us receive this courtesy. I've also included a notated picture of our receipt and we received less than half of what's tabulated on there, and what made it on there wasn't even everything we ordered (make it make sense). It was one thing after the other- "the kitchen lost your ticket" "sorry it probably didn't go through" "we're really backed up tonight (said in a thoroughly irate tone of voice)" ok! Cool! But now why are you getting irritated at us! For asking for the third time in 30 minutes why we haven't received our order of 4 items. Basically we were there for 1.5 hours and received 10 plates of protein overall. I've never had service affect a meal to this degree, and it was so frustrating especially seeing as this was supposed to be an outing for my mom's birthday. Anyway, Gen is popular enough that whoever likes going there is going to continue going there. This is the review for anyone in the fence about trying it anytime soon. My advice? Don't. You're going to be unsatisfied, unhappy, and most of all hungry by the end of it.

Quick aside about the food quality- it's standard kbbq nothing special, but one thing I will say is the beef belly that did make it to our table was really hit or miss. Some of it decent, perfectly edible. The last couple plates- D R Y as all heck.

author: Ellen M.
review text:
I heard many great things about this place and I realize they are doing what they can with outside dining, but several things made it just "ok" for be rather than great.  Upon entry to the restaurant, there is an optional temperature check.  It is unclear that you need to first order inside then go outside to be seated.  We waited a while to find out as it took a long time to get greeted.  The hostess was a bit rude, assuming we should know what to do which irritated me.  One bright spot was our server Shauna who was on the mark, checking on us frequently and making sure the food kept coming. The runner was hurried and confused, forgetting the stuff we repeatedly asked for. Apparently the dishwasher didn't show up to work.  It bothered me that the runners asked to use our tongs to move the meat onto our grill then gave it back to us. Doesn't seem very sanitary with Covid.

The good was ok but didn't come out raw as normal. We think they cook it slightly in the kitchen then bring it out to speed things up outside. Also the sides of the tent were not rolled up earlier in the day with diners inside. Didn't seem like a good situation for ventilation.

author: Phil Y.
review text:
The COVID-19 deal was great!  7 meats and 5 side dishes for $22 when I went there in early May.  They even threw in a roll of toilet paper.  I called them up early before 5 PM and told them that I didn't want to pick it up until 6 PM.  The woman who answered the phone told me, "No problem!  We will text you when it is done!"  Then everything went downhill.  I received a text at 5:30 telling me that me food was ready for pick-up.  What happened to my 6 PM pick-up?  I guess 5:30 was close enough to 6 PM so I didn't make a big deal out of it.  Besides, before leaving, the nice cashier gave me a roll of commercial grade "Monogram" toilet paper!  Feeling happy, I paid and left for home.  

When I got home, I opened up the boxes and saw my banchans and the 7 meats.  The banchans were okay since the servers (cooks) didn't have to do anything with them.  But, the meats.  The non-marinated meats were okay.  The marinated meats(pork belly) were all burnt!  If I wanted to eat burnt meats, I would've went to H-Mart to buy the meats and let my daughter cook it.  The portion of food was very good, if only it wasn't burnt.  

Service sounded good, but, they can't follow instructions.  It may be a communication problem between the order takers/cashiers and the ones that do the cooking.  Either way, the people that cook don't do a very good job.  Best of all, I now know that Kirkland Signature toilet paper is much better than their commercial grade "Monogram" toilet paper, or at least that is what my body tells me.  

Lastly, the $22 deal just went up to $23 for the Memorial Day holiday.

author: Michele J.
review text:
We had a wonderful dinner tonight. We made reservations for our party of 10 and they had our table ready. It was pretty busy, which is great to see.

The service was fantastic!! Jacob and Joseph regularly took our meat/seafood orders to grill and gave some great recommendations. They were attentive and had a great attitude. The grills were also changed whenever we needed it due to them constantly checking throughout our meal.

The food was great!! So delicious!! We all came hungry and they did not disappoint.

A big group of their servers cheerfully sang Happy Birthday!! It was a perfect ending to our celebration.

author: J B.
review text:
I have come before oftenand left 5 stars .. Friday night was the absolute WORST dinner I have ever been to ! I have waitressed and am sympathetic to the things that can go wrong and be patient but this was absolutely the worst! We sat down with 15 people for our reservation and was seated outside
. We sat down and When we asked for water they said they were running low on cups but will try to see how at they can get . They were out of plates for over half hour. We didn't get sides for over an hour , rice for at least that 30 min since they were out then we got mushy rice . We couldn't order meat for 30 min but didn't get it for almost an hour but only after we asked for a manager . They said they were out of rice paper then received it at the end of our dinner . The bathrooms were dirty and trash spilling out with things out of order .
What was out of order was the whole place ! We changed our own canisters removed our own plates refilled our own sauces and the only good thing about this whole place was josh who was a manager who tried when he could. We had started our dinner at 8 and rice paper came at 10 . There were roaches on the ground and will never go there again

author: Monica B.
review text:
VEGAN UN-INCLUSIVE.
I landed here for a party.  Obviously not my choice given the name, but unless you're vegan and feeling like maybe the world has become vegan-friendly enough for you and you decide to venture into this place for a little change you'll feel completely out of place.  They do offer a 50% off your tab but given that only 1 out of 38 things on the menu is vegan friendly it's a slap in the face with a "Silly vegan!  You think we care about you?  Ha ha!" message.

author: Téa F.
review text: Was good at first! But then managed to find a lot of plastic in my brisket. Server didn't do much, oh well:(

author: Sally M.
review text: It was very busy on a Friday night with a 40 minute wait. It's a typical AYCE Korean BBQ with many locations of this restaurant. Our waiter was missing for about 15 minutes. So service was not good. There are other choice out there.

author: Bea Y.
review text: Ordered to go and I feel so gipped!!!!! Paid an extra $ for the bbq ribs and where's the meat?! How does this equate to $30?????! There's no meat on the bones at all besides 1 piece.

author: David L.
review text:
This location recently opened patio dine-in and I was there with my family yesterday. My experience was so infuriating I wrote to the corporate office about it.

Bulletpointing what went wrong:

- We sat down, waiting for meat menu. no one mentioned about having to scan QR code for menu, so we sat there for about 10 minutes before the server asked us if we know what we want

- We aren't allowed to cook ourselves and all grilling is done in the kitchen. Waited 25 minutes before our first round of 3 items: brisket, hawaiian steak, bulgogi.

- They used home style frying pan where they just dumped all 3 meat, juices mixed up, unflavored brisket was marinated in bulgogi sauce as a result. It was soaggy mess. the presentation was pathetic. see pictures.

- Our 2nd batch came about 30 minutes after we ordered. We sat down at  12:15, got our 2nd batch around 1:20. By then we were no longer hungry

- We were charged full price came out to $85 including undeserved 20% tip for me and my wife + 2 kids aged 3 and 6.

I've been a fan of the chain since Tustin location opened 10 years ago. Never coming back again.

author: Nathan P.
review text: Don't believe any 4-star reviews .. Keala and Ryan killed it last time we were here for dinner and Keala again today for Memorial Day! It was super busy but they were on it and had super fast service. Last time people were complaining because they had to wait for a table on a Saturday night when it's busy? It's a weekend what do you expect. The servers don't get enough credit for their hard work, 10/10 service. The food was great, hats off to the chef. But be will be back because of the awesome staff

author: Michael J.
review text: We had the Blue fin belly, the sashimi sampler platter and a few other specialty dishes. The Blue fin belly, which is probably the most expensive dish they serve... proved worth it. Exemplary. Wonderful. Came with a raw quail egg and adorned with gold flake and fish roe. Dine in is back and the service was wonderful. Very friendly staff. Couldn't sit at the bar yet but we had quick, responsive service and really... it's a sushi place.... the fish was wonderful. And the cost is right on par with good fish.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Don't order takeout from this place!

We ordered two 7 meat meals from Gen that should've included 14 portions of meat.  When the food was delivered, we only received 4-5 servings.  Honest mistake, I thought.

I called to explain the situation and the person who answered, Veronica, seemed annoyed that we had a problem with our order.  She told us that since we had the food delivered by DoorDash that she won't help us and we're out of luck without offering any solutions, options or any type of customer service.  Veronica was condescending in the way she spoke to me, as if we were trying to cheat them out of a few pieces of meat.  She clearly wasn't equipped to handle customer issues.

Zero stars for this experience and a bad mark for Gen.

author: K T.
review text:
Haven't had kbbq in awhile and decided to try this location. The take out deal that they are having is great. Plenty of meat, rice and sides for $11 ($23 for more meat).

Unfortunately, it seems I had my bad luck strike again and I found a strand of hair in my food. After I pulled out the long hair that was halfway going white, I pretty much lost my appetite. With the pandemic going on, I would had hope this place would at least try to be sanitary and cautious.

I'm sure that this isn't a recurring thing that happens, but would likely not try this place again. I'll stick to grilling my own meat and venture out to my usual kbbq spot.

author: Julie N.
review text:
Always a nice, nearby place to go for KBBQ! What's great about this gen location is that the wait is never too bad. I arrived with a party of 9 at around 8pm on a Saturday and the wait was only 20 minutes. The servers were also really attentive and quickly changed the grill or gave us more sides whenever we needed it.

My favorite meats here are the galbi, brisket, bulgogi, and the beef tongue! The potato salad and kimchi are also great to have refills of. Pro tip, you can ask for rice paper as well - I always eat the meat with the rice paper.

author: Lishya H.
review text: Haven't been to Gen for a while and tonight it was a great night. The Hawaiian steak, kalbi, beef tongue, everything was delish. Service was very attentive. My two daughters were asking for more of the Hawaiian steak. Very moist, juicy, and flavorful! Thank you to our waitress, JOY, for such a great service, as usual ...!!!!

author: John T.
review text:
This is on their takeout what WAS $22 for 7 meats and 5 sides. The price is now $23, and o ordered 2 briskets, 2 Galbi (upcharge $1/ea = $2), smoked pork belly , spicy pork bulgogi, and cajun shrimp. With all the hype about Gen is why I got for tonight's dinner.  But disappointed...the brisket was more like 1 order and the Galbi was only 1 piece!

The plus was nice hostess and found out that they're now open for dine-in. But leaves a bad taste for my first time at this location, and unfortunately heard that the Rowland Heights location is permanently closed.

author: Reanna Kealle P.
review text: DO NOT EAT HERE!!! I've been here a few times & every experience is horrible. They lack customer service. You will literally have to get a servers attention to get anything you want. None of them will just check in on you to see how your meal is going. Some of the servers are just rude & impatient & it SHOWS! Today will be the last time I will EVER dine at this location. My husband & I went in for lunch & noticed that there were numerous clear strands in our meat. The only reason we noticed was because my husband pulled one out of his mouth. Mind you, as this was happening, our grill was burning; in need of a grill change. I COUNTED TWO SERVERS WHO MADE EYE CONTACT WITH ME BUT THEY JUST WALKED AWAY. It came to the point where I had to ask the bartender for a manager. The manager came & apologized for the inconvenience. He mentioned that the strands we found in our meat was "just plastic" & honestly didn't sound too concerned. Like what do you mean it's "JUST PLASTIC?!" That is not ok. He offered to change out our plates & etc. I'm sorry, but if I were him, I would've just comped the entire meal. But nope, he offered a new table setting even after I mentioned I had already lost my appetite. By the way one of our meats never came until I mentioned it to the manager as I was complaining. Seriously the WORST restaurant to eat at. DO NOT EAT HERE!

author: Ryan M.
review text: This restaurant is intentionally deceptive and purposely serves less food than stated on the menu. I ordered a meal from Uber Eats on August 5th. There's an option to add a 4 oz side of green tea salt. The container is marked only 3.25 oz, therefore the restaurant never intended to deliver the order volume. It was then only 3/4 full. Furthermore, the container only weighed 1.48 ounces. If this is representative of their integrity, I'm scared to see what goes on in the food prep areas. Avoid at all costs.

author: Steven C.
review text:
This review is based on the take out I just bought.

First off I appreciate that they are trying to stay open amidst the stay at home order and I wanted to show my support for local businesses. I had come here multiple times in the past for ayce kbbq and it was very decent for the price.

So when I saw that they were selling take out I wanted to satisfy my kbbq craving as well as reminisce about those by gone days of in person dining. However it is far from what I had expected.

I had ordered the 7 meat dinner with brisket, kalbi, steak and pork belly. I saw that the workers were cooking the food at the tables in lieu of the guests and was hoping it would taste like what I used to have. Wrong. All the meats were overcooked, tough and dry. Particularly the kalbi and steak which were burnt to a crisp and tasted more like Korean beef jerky.

I really did hope it would be relatively close to in person bbq but I think after today I'll just have to wait for when they reopen.

author: Naomi G.
review text: I was very impressed by how Gen updated their safety protocols to protect customers during the COVID-19 pandemic. There was a 6ft space among groups, plexi glass among tables, and temperature check before you walk in. There was limited seating capacity and I felt that there was less staff available to serve the tables. This made getting our food and sides a little slower than what I'm used to here. Overall the dishes were good and for the 16.99 lunch deal this can't be beat!

author: Raeanna D.
review text: I'm person dining is great and so are the servers but take out is such a rip off. This is supposed to be 6 meats for $26?! The garlic pork belly was 3 small pieces and the spicy pork belly was 3 pieces too! I'm having a hard time believing that this is actually the serving size. I'm really disappointed because I usually am really satisfied with this place.

author: Jacob T.
review text: They are doing amazing with everything during this pandemic!!! Sanitation, customer satisfaction, speed, service everything is amazing. Yeah it takes a while to get your seating but that's because they are booming with customers and have to clean everything for your safety. 10/10 highly recommend!!!

author: Elizabeth M.
review text: Really cool environment and perfect for large groups, and very big portions of food. I'm not really big on Korean BBQ and tonight this place was okay the meats were very gamy and no flavor. The  only thing I really liked was the salad appetizer. The rice was too sticky. I've had better to be honest. The atmosphere is cool tho for large groups and enjoy the experience of cooking together.

author: Anjanette G.
review text: Extremely slow service. Took forever to get our meat, they also placed uncooked chicken with beef on same plate... then cooked chicken with uncooked chicken. /: . Servers were nice and smiled , but this outside seating just doesn't work here. Check took a while to come and be picked up, had to take it inside to pay so we could leave. Food was good! Rice paper was fresh! Just wish things went back to normal already! #RecallGavinNewsom

author: Norman S.
review text:
Last meal of the trip! It's was hella quiet in the restaurant. Not sure if it was too early or something but it was nice.

There were 8 of us and we sat four and four with two burners. I'm always amazed at how much selection American buffets and AYCE has to offer and this place didn't disappoint! The meats that came out were amazing and the portions were generous!

The service was prompt and they replaced the burners regularly without having to be asked.  There were only maybe 3 servers max but never had to really wait for anything.

Love how they have Macaron ice cream sandwiches at the front you could order! That was a nice feature and the kids were dying to eat them.

One thing that happened was the server dropped a cup of water and it spilled some over my daughters chair and clothes. It wasn't a big deal but something to be noted.

author: Watkins L.
review text:
This a AYCE Korean bbq joint with the same name in many cities all around so cal. I was disappointed to see my experience this time, as I decided to come here to try again after visiting the location in Alhambra. Maybe it was New Year Eve, but the service was just lacking. Maybe there was too many tables to one server, or maybe it was just the waiter that we had. I want to give everyone a heads up, if you do plan to come here, to know that most of the dishes and Ban Chan is spicy.  Even the side salad was spicy. Don't expect to get any green tea ice cream after, at least if there was, it wasn't offered to us.

Food
For $23 a person, the choices you are offered isnt bad at all. Some of the things that you ordered that was good was the Galbi, Brisket and Rice Cake. Note that they no longer serve steam egg, and any soup you order will be spicy and not have much ingredients inside. A few of the plates we got food served to us was broken, and it just felt like there was a lack of quality of service. There was many times that we asked for more ban Chan, or Daikon, but it never came. Also the fact that NO one else would stop to help besides our own server was frustrating. If that was the case, I would hope that the server only had a few tables. It was to a point where the bus boys seem to be more helpful, and genuinely thoughtful. It joust felt like everyone would do things the lazy way. Like I saw a a worker refilling cups that stacked what looked like 20 water cups high,  so that they wouldn't have to walk back to grab the rest. I was more worried that they would fall.

Ambiance
This place has plenty of parking, sharing parking with other locations, and it is a pretty big place, but when we went, a whole other section was closed, maybe due to the amount of workers. If you are into watching sports, there are multiple TV'a for your entertainment.

Like I mentioned before, maybe it was just an off night, where they didn't have much people working, but I experienced what I did. Food is good for the price, just hope that the service improves. Maybe we will try it again some time in the future. Until then.

author: Emmett T.
review text:
I have been to this spot twice now, and each time there was no wait for seating. The interior was dark with neon blue lighting as if you were walking into a nightclub. The menu for proteins and seafood was very extensive with about 30 different choices available (about eight fewer selections for lunch). The dinner price of $21.99 per adult was a great deal compared to other AYCE Korean BBQ places I have visited in SoCal.

There were a couple of areas that I thought could use improvement. First, the tables at the booths seemed rather small. For our party of four, we seemed to run out of space quickly for plates when the meats and banchan were brought out from the kitchen. Speaking of banchan, that was another weakness as the variety was below average compared to its competitors. I did like the rice paper and rice cake though.

I can't wait until they open up their first restaurant in the greater San Diego area within the next several weeks. The demand there will be tremendous so I hope the servers can keep up. Maybe they will employ robots to bring items out of the kitchen as has been done at some Gen Korean BBQ House locations.

author: Benedict A.
review text:
So similar to the one in Rancho Cucamonga but so different in their customer service.  I can now see what half a star difference really means now.  Because the food at both is the same.  Same prices, same set up, same drinks, only thing difference is customer service.  And man did they bring it!!!  Several employees handling the same table asking us if we were ready to order if we wanted our grill to be changed out, getting us more water.  They were just really on it, even for a busy sunday night.  They must've changed out our grill 6 or 7 times in less than 2 hours, keeping it nice and clean with no burnt flavors.  Portion sizes maybe a little bit smaller, but they're both all you can eat.  So no biggie.  But they brought out the bulgogi or the brisket out so fast and regularly that our table was never without protein.  
Customer service was so on point, that it elevated the entire dinner.  I would not mind driving all the way out here for my korean bbq fix because its so much better than the one in Rancho Cucamonga!!

author: Jessica C.
review text: Came here for lunch around 1:30 on a Sunday and it was a 45 min wait. Covid precautions: a machine scans your temperature, staff wears masks, plastic barrier in certain places but they still seat people without like skipping tables. When something is AYCE, it's just a busy place and feels hectic but all the employees come by and try to be attentive and efficient without grumbling and didn't ever show that they are overwhelmed though I'm sure they felt it. Our waiter Alex was very friendly. The reason I'm really giving five stars is bc I'm glad this Gen hasn't increased their prices unlike other AYCE restaurants--especially since I'm sure Covid has made things harder but I think the price is super reasonable. Gen first came out to be known for their meat quality and variety and nothing has changed. Still pretty good quality at way better prices than other places. I really hope they don't change it. It was $24.99 for weekend (same price for holiday and dinner). I hadn't been to Gen forever even before the pandemic, but with this location's service, price, uncomplicated menu, and quality, I'll definitely be returning.

author: Razi M.
review text: First off I'm happy that they are still open during this whole quarantine thing. Called in and spoke to Hallie she was very friendly and helpful. I told her I saw this $10 deal on IG and she said yes what two meats would you like and named all the meats. Also helped me pick out sides, told me it would take 10 minutes. I walked in and Hallie was in front cleaning so I knew they were taking everything serious. She had a big smile and proceeded to check me out and even gave me a roll of toilet paper. I appreciate this kind of service and would definitely recommend this place to anyone who misses Korean bbq during these times. (They should make Hallie the manager if she isn't already.)

author: Genise S.
review text: Ordering to go was a pain. I had to repeat myself at least 3 times as they were having technical difficulties on their end which happens and it's fine, but the guy who was helping me was impatient. I was asking questions on how the to go menu works to which he says, "ok, first time ordering." My mom even commented on how it seemed like he was bothered taking my order. Had a little trouble picking up as well from an error on their side. They asked if I've already paid since the order was closed. Had to wait for them to fix it. I think biggest disappointment is that the to go order was definitely skimpy. I get that it won't be piles of food, but to get 3 PCs of shrimp, 3 PCs of pork belly? And not to top off the container for the sides? Also, the plain japchae counts as a meat and not a side, lol. I am still avoiding indoor and outdoor dining for now and would rather order for take out, but won't be ordering here again.

author: Jenny L.
review text:
I've been to plenty of Gens before but this was my first time at this location. The decor is what you would expect from Gens, it's dark and it smells amazing inside. We probably waited for 10-15 minutes before we got seated but after we got seated we were able to get our order in quickly.

The marinated kalbi was my favorite. It is just so good! It was my friend's first time at a KBBQ place and she loved it. Her favorite was bulgogi. There's plenty of meat on each plate and I believe we ate our $22 dollars back.

The service was amazing. The waiter replenished our sides and salads very quickly. The grill was changed whenever it got smoky. They did leave an item off our order but that was quickly addressed when we talked to our waiter.

I love going to Gens and this one was no exception!

author: Nadine S.
review text: Joy is so attentive & on point! Thank you for recommending the best apps and sake! She was there to deliver all the sauces and sides I needed and brought salads constantly!! We enjoyed our time & will be back

author: Ray L.
review text:
Decor 3.7 stars
Service 4.3 stars
Food 4 stars

Located in a plaza in Chino Hills.
On the day of Thanksgiving, my uncle's family and I decided to have AYCE Korean BBQ for lunch before we have turkey for dinner. ( no wonder I had food coma)

The servers were friendly, prompt and attentive.
We ordered Soondoboo / Spicy Tofu stew ( recommended), Cajun Shrimp ( is a must), Chicken, Fried Calamari, Beef tongue, Bulgogi .(try to eat with rice wrapper/rice paper and salad)

I was amazed how I didn't smell BBQ on my clothes after. And thanks to Dave , we definitely enjoyed our family time there.

Happy Grilling!!!!

author: Manuel P.
review text: Overall 5 stars all around! Everything tasted amazing and a big shout out to my servers Kyle and Dre! This was my first experience at Korean BBQ and they were extremely helpful and very friendly! I'll definitely be back just cause of the amazing service!

author: Arian R.
review text: This was overall such a great experience. The food was amazing and our Servers totally killed it. Thank you so much Erick, Brian and Hyelee for making our night rememberable and a lot of fun. They also recommended us some awesome food & were super quick to serve it. We will be back!!

author: Liz N.
review text:
Awesome!
Shout out to our server Alex H. And the rest of the staff you guys were wonderful. Our family didn't dine for that long but the staff changed our grill plate 3 times (and a 4th was going to happen if I let him). Food was equally as awesome. My 3 kiddos all said they loved the place. One even mentioned how good the service was and how nice everyone was there.
Can't wait to go back if we are ever in the area ;)

author: Bbchi C.
review text: Horrible. No service. Everything was freaking slow. Waited more than an hour for our table, that's fine. We understand No salad, no side dish until we asked for it. Took forever for the meat to come. Never change our grill either. I ended up spending 4 hours for this meal, that gave you an idea how slow and bad they are. Also, the staffs are wearing their face mask incorrectly, I saw their noses. Such a terrible experience!

author: Kenny C.
review text:
This place was fantastic.
We had to choose between Thai and Korean BBQ, and we had a group of 4 people. My wife insisted we go to Gen Korean BBQ. We all grudgingly agreed and went to Gen Korean BBQ.
We arrive. Great atmosphere. Nice tint of blue light around the whole restaurant.
Sit down. And we have a stove in front of us. We choose to do the all you can eat, and our waiter gave us his simple recommendations and we were on our way. He brings out the food uncooked, and we started cooking and then.... game over.
This place knocked our socks off. We tried EVERYTHING! Cajun shrimp, volcano chicken, steak, red wine pork, Hawaiian pork, and even cow tongue.
Food was fresh and delicious.
Let me just say, I loved being the chef and cooking my food. I probably ate too much raw food tonight because of my inexperience, but I enjoyed every minute and every bite.
Thank you. Thank you for pleasing my appetite and most importantly my soul.

author: Ray C.
review text: The orders we got was very disappointing.  When I called they told me that they make everything well done, but is burnt to a crisp.  Horrible service because when I called she started to laugh and thought it was funny.

author: Jen K.
review text: Came here for an early dinner... they were very understaffed at the time and it took us over ten minutes to be seated even though only 2 tables were sat. Our waitress was very nice and the one manager there seemed to really try, though the outcome was very poor service. Although another manager did show up eventually as well as another server, wait time for any service did not improve. A manager mopped the floors in front of the kitchen in front of us for about 15-20 min as our table grew more and more covered in dirty dishes, our old plates and napkins were not picked up once, and we waited with empty glasses. The air must have been having issues as it was very hot, even the employees paced around fanning themselves. Food was good but service was unacceptable. When a simple task such as clearing plates and napkins goes ignored, not much else matters.

author: Brian L.
review text:
Came in last weekend, and they're still running promotions to advertise their grand opening. We happily left the restaurant with some free pins and Sapporo Beer bottle opener keychains. Perhaps even better than that were the free samples of fruit flavored soju that kept coming around the restaurant. We're slated to get a Gen down in Hawaii soon, and I hope it was at least as good as this.

It's very trendy (and loud) in here, and you can probably tell your food is going to taste good from the slick of grease on the floor when you enter the dining area. The selection of meat is really good here, and the banchan don't taste too bad either.

We really enjoyed the beef tongue, although it was a little on the thin side. After a few shots of soju, if you're not paying attention, your tongue is donezos. Other items worth mentioning were the garlic samgyeopsal and the Hawaiian steak, Hawaiian in name and pineapple garnish  only of course. Make sure you order the samjang bean paste and ask for garlic to throw onto the grill with the meat. Gen has different types of bossam to wrap your food in including daikon and ddeok aside from the traditional lettuce.

The only thing off putting here was the staff. The only person on shift who was legitimately friendly and helpful was Rebecca. Lawrence, who was introduced as our server, was essentially MIA for most of the night. On top of that, he said the name of the restaurant incorrectly. This other guy, who seemed to be in charge was pretty cocky and arrogant. He also kept changing the grills way too often, something I'd never imagined I'd complain about in my life. He was really good at coming in at the perfect time to ruin the char on your meat, tossing your almost grilled items onto a new unheated grill, essentially sentencing them to boil and steam to death. Keep the Rebeccas, trash the rest of them.

author: Adrian T.
review text: One of the worst Korean places I've been to. Service was bad. 3 guys waiting on us , so you know there was lots of confusion cuz they take your order by memory then got to another tables & do the same. Some things we asked for never came. There bon chon sucks! 3 measly bowls with baby servings. The clean grill on pic was us waiting to put SUMTHING on it after our second order. measly portions of meat you saw for four hungry adults! & how are to mix your salt & oil when there in one plate with a divider, one on each side. If you want better service & food. Go across the 71 & eat @ wang cho! We thot we'd try gen cuz of all the hype.

author: Jacqueline H.
review text:
Came in tonight for the grand opening and have never been to a Gen KBBQ before. Surprised that they decided to open in this location because Wang Cho is just down the street, but it was pretty good!

Great, fast and efficient service - especially due to the amount of people in here tonight. It's a great place for dinner because they have tons of drink options - not good if you don't like loud restaurants though.

Food wise, it was pretty good. The steak and pork belly were the best on the dinner menu!

author: Joyce H.
review text:
I had family visiting from out of town, and wanted to pick a fun place for dinner.  I thought this would be a solid choice since I've been to other Gen locations before.  The staff was friendly.  That's probably the best thing of the night.  

1.  Our salad had plastic bag fragments in it.  The restaurant lighting is dim, and this could probably be easily missed.  How many people have unknowningly ingested plastic?
2.  They were out of radish.  Initially, they said it was thawing out in the back and would take time.  Then, they said they were out.
3.  They were out of japchae scraps.  We asked for a plate of the noodles (which is usually included in the banchan at places like Wang Cho), and the plate came out with short pieces of scraps.  When we wanted more, we were told that they were out for the evening.  I guess it's only made once a day?
4.  Rice was not ready.  This was a surprise.  My cousin asked for rice, and we were told they had to cook it.  We reminded them in between courses, and it was still cooking until we were almost done with our meal.
5.  Dishes forgotten.  We ordered about 8 meat dishes for 3 people at the start of the meal.  They brought 3 and forgot the rest.  I had to remind them about a few things.  At the end of the night, we still never got the beef tongue or marinated pork that we asked for.
6.  No steamed egg.  Ok, this one isn't anyone's fault.  They said it was removed from the menu because people were not ordering it.  But my friends and I love this stuff so I'm going to have to find a place that serves it next time.

The atmosphere was ok.  The bathrooms were clean, though one was out of order.  The staff was nice.  I still enjoyed catching up with family, and some of the meat dishes were tasty.  However, this didn't impress me the way I expected.  Korean bbq isn't an everyday affair, and I think it should always be a great experience when people do go.  Please find a system to get orders right, to have rice and sides in stock, and to ensure inedible materials are not left in the food that is served!

author: Cheryl H.
review text:
Our server Tim the Asian "Tim" was our best server experience since I've been coming here.
I will be sure to return and hope that he is here again!
His attentive service has def deserved all 5 *****

author: Carol N.
review text:
The boyfriend and I have tried all three Korean BBQ all you can eat places that we found in Chino. This place is our favorite of the 3, we also tried Wang Cho and Gangnam. This place is more reasonable priced than Wang Cho, being $21 for dinner. For $21, you have more than 30 items to choose from, which is more than you can eat in one sitting. They have sides at the table, as well as some others you can ask for too, such as rice paper, japchae, and rice. They also have hot sides such as popcorn  chicken and calamari, both of which are delicious! We ended up having the same waiter, Eric, both times we went. He was great, friendly and brought out things and took our order as soon as he could. Second time was much more busy... so some things took longer. I like that even though you have a primary waiter, all the workers here will tend to you! They all grab empty plates from your table, bring you your meats, and refill your drinks. Some other places that we've been to, they plates sit at your table, stacked up until your waiter comes to take it... I also like that they constantly change your grills when it needs to be changed. My favorite things to get here are the brisket, short ribs, popcorn chicken, calamari, pork belly, shrimp, japchae, bulgoli, and I'm pretty sure a few others that I cannot think of at the moment.

The vibe here is very hipster. There's always pop music playing and a mood lighting. I would say it's like eating Korean BBQ at a club! If you come for your birthday, be prepared for the staff to be super energized and sign out loud to you!! It seems like they really have fun with it! Lunch prices are a little cheaper, I think like $15, and obviously the selection is a bit less.

This is our favorite Korean BBQ place in the Chino area. You'll find us here again in the future!

author: Mac L.
review text:
Excellent choice. Kyle our server was great. Great attitude, staff were all friendly and upbeat. Food was fantastic.   Awesome place‼
The ambiance was excellent. Price was reasonable..

author: Frank Z.
review text:
One of the best korean bbq places anywhere near LA.

Nothing beats Gen for its combination of value, quality and service. The few times I've been here, it has never left me unsatisfied. First of all, for the price, Gen offers a HUGE menu during lunch and dinner times. You can get so many different meats, my favorite are the Hawaiian steak and the beef cheek.

The quality of the meat, the banchan (sides) and everything else is 10/10. Also, the service is outstanding. Never before have I had a waiter who never complained or showed any sign of annoyance when me and my table would be constantly asking for more sides, rice, meat, or rice paper. Every time we asked, the waiter brought it out with no hesitation.

Gen is a true all you can eat kbbq joint and it is definitely worth your time and money. P.S. try the cajun sauce, it literally goes well with any meat.

author: Tiffany N.
review text: I'm baaaaack, but at a different location haha. Great service once again, food is always amazing! Grabbed some beers with some friends too!

author: Sherry G.
review text: This was amazing!  The servers work in teams and they run their area very efficiently.  The meats looked fresh and clean.  The table is pre-set with all the condiments.  Awesome for just two but also looks like fun for a group!  Definitely recommend...just know that you will smell like BBQ after..

author: Anthony P.
review text:
A solid KBBQ joint. I've been here probably 3 times now. The decor is nice, modern, and feels upscale. The service is generally pretty good. This last time I went it wasn't very good at all. Thankfully a server, David, who wasn't our server kept coming through and saving the day. Whenever we eat KBBQ we don't eat all day then come and eat everything. The first round of meat too so long we ended up eating all of our sides before anything got to us. Then they brought out the brisket but not the steak we ordered. We ate the brisket and had some major down time till the other stuff came out. This was the first time the service was slow like this. Normally there isn't much down time between plates of meat.

The music they had playing was very inappropriate in my opinion. They were playing very ratchet trap music mostly. Every now and then a calm song would come on but it was mostly loud trap music which I did not enjoy. It made having a conversation difficult.

My friend and I were quite extra, always asking for extra sides and what not and they did bring out a large bowl of kimchi, potato salad, and cabbage which was very nice. The premium steak was a very large piece, probably 8 ounces. Meat quality was on point, can't complain about that at all. The sides were also very good. Generally we pick this KBBQ place because of the sides.

All in all this is a good place. Service was bad one out of three times which isn't too bad. I will most likely return when I'm in the area and want KBBQ.

author: Briana R.
review text:
Excellent experience. The staff was extremely friendly, and the food was amazing.
I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. The atmosphere is very kick back, with hip-hop/rap music playing in the background, and relaxing dim lighting.
We will definitely be coming back!
Thanks Marlon and Matt! You guys were great.

author: Marijane R.
review text:
This was our first time dining here. Nice atmosphere not too smoky like at other bbq joints I've been to.

The person at the front desk needs to be a bit happier and welcoming when greetong guests. Otherwise, the staff there was helpful and always tended to our table. We were a party of 5 seated right away on a Wednesday.  

Erick was our server and he was AWESOME.  He always came back to check on us and made sure our grill was always fresh. This is probably what is going to differentiate other Bbq places is the customer service and the quality of the food. There was a wide variety of meat selections.  And it was more meat than fat.  The marinated meats were not drenched in marination so it wasn't too sweet and blackened when grilled. There was no up charge for different meats or seafood. One price -Cost per adult was $20.99 and kids 5-10 were half off.  4 and under ate free.

We will definitely be back to eat here.  Great place for family gatherings too.

author: Sheryll R.
review text:
We went there today. Staff was really slow. We were so hungry but we have to wait for the meat. Second round of meat was even worst. We have to wait for almost 30-40 minutes for the meat to be served. I also ordered a chicken pop for my toddler, geez my toddler has no appetite by the time the order was served. Not kids friendly. The staff even told us that there was only 1 person in the kitchen! we came there to eat and we expect a better service specially they charge us $21 per person, to think it was an early brunch.
In terms of cleanliness, yikes the floor was filthy and sleepery. We were seated at the left side, I almost slip! I think its an oil build up. The table was filthy and not clean! When you touch the table it was sticky and yucky! Our griller was filthy and dirty and so the waiter changed it when the black liquid start coming out feom the griller plate when the fire was on. I have been here multiple times. I am dissappointed and I hope they will take action so the they can maintain a good review.

author: Angelica L.
review text:
Came here for my grandma's birthday with 20 of my family members. Neil did a great job handling all 5 tables! The food was super good & it came out promptly after being prepared. Grill changes were fast and just overall customer service was amazing. If you try anything here get crazy sauce brisket. It's not on the menu, but it was something Neil recommended!

Will come here again for another party!

author: Selena W.
review text: Usually I don't have any trouble with this gen bbq, but on Wednesday March 27 at around 9pm, my family and I decided to go eat, and let me tell you that the service was unbearably slow. I thought they were short staffed, but there were clearly 4 servers and a manager out that day. Our server was no where to be found most of the time, so we were there for 2 hours because we couldn't order more food most of the time. Not to mention we were playing Tetris with our dishes. The employees would walk by our table several times and would not take our plates. They even brought more plates of meat out for us and tried to fit it on our cluttered table. Our server didn't even take the plates for us when we ordered food. I don't know if it was an off night for them, but I just think this was unacceptable. At least we entertained ourselves with stacking plates as high as we could that day!

author: Joi B.
review text:
FIRST OF ALL! Shout out to the best server, NIEL. Everytime I go to this place, I always get him and I leave satisfied with his accommodating service and the GREAT food!!!

Place is NEAT.
Food is GREAT.
Price is AFFORDABLE
Service is PHENOMENAL.
People are AWESOME.

I would give more stars if I could. Ill add it to my comments!

author: Jasmine C.
review text:
Sticky rice cakeeeee! Lub!
We had 2 kinds of soju, lychee+yogurt & peach, very girlie and tasty! Love love !
Specially shout out to Buddha, (well I work overseas now, and don't come back very often) and you made my day! Thanks !!!

author: Nirmeen S.
review text:
The quality of the meat was good and the service was amazing. We had two people waiting on us, and both were very nice, but one was exceptionally great. Our server Matthew was so attentive and eager to help us with anything that we asked for. He was polite, fast, and friendly. If every server was like Matthew, all businesses would flourish. Keep up the great work:)

The restaurant was very  clean.  The peach soju was delicious! The portions were pretty small last time I went, but this time they were decent. It is AYCE, so it shouldn't matter but I don't like asking for things several times. The bulgogi & the brisket are my personal favorite. Since we went with a few friends we expanded our horizons and tried beef tongue (wasn't a fan) and pork belly. The pork belly was very tasty but does have a lot of fat!

Overall, we had a pleasant experience and would recommend GEN & come back again. Thanks again Matthew!

author: Leonard A.
review text: Making a good impression usually keeps them coming back,I'm definitely coming back.The hostess was very friendly and gave us a detailed run down on the menu.The decor had a lounge feel to it and very clean.Panda Alex was taking care of us that night.He must of worked at a fine dining place because he was on point like point can be.He was very welcoming and his interaction with us made me feel like we were buds.I came in with a large party so we ordered almost everything.The food was great,no complaints.Panda Alex did recommend to cook the pork cheek with kimchi.Dude,that was probably the highlight of my night,really tasty.We also ordered the macaroons for dessert but by the time they came out,we were tapped out.If food here is good,I'm pretty sure the macaroons are too.Thanks to Panda Alex for making our dining experience here a memorable one.

author: Cam C.
review text:
I give this place 3.5 stars, but that's not an option so I will round up.

Chino Hills Gen has the best service I have ever encountered at any AYCE Korean BBQ establishment to date. I came with my family on a Friday evening after work and it was slowly getting busier as the night went on, but everything we ordered came out in an expedited manner and anything we needed was brought out to us in a blink an eye.

37 items on the menu, but I tried no more than 10.

Minus .5 stars because even though their cajun shrimp was something I ordered on every round, it was clear it was on the older side since it was pasty instead of firm.

Minus 1 star because they don't have the pre-made egg soup, you have to cook it yourself over the grill. And also because their fermented bean stew is heavily oversalted (to the point of being inedible), and their tofu soup is beyond bland.

author: Michael M.
review text:
Man, so I'm sitting here in GEN and I just finished eating what seemed to be everything, but everything was so good.. I mean everything.
I really want to emphasize how great the food is, you literally can not go wrong with anything on the menu!
We lucked out and got "Neil" as our waiter, he pretty much picked everything for us since it was our first time and everything her selected rocked and he showed us neat ways of cooking the meats.
The best part tho was leaving and having that Thanks-Giving feeling!

author: Tuyen H.
review text:
Experience at this Gen has to be the best ones I've been to. Service was quick and the staff always made sure we were comfortable and satisfied! Nicole and Paul were the best servers anyone can ask for. For a place only opened for about two months pretty effieicient! I would definitely recommend coming here for AYCE kkbq.
